lorebooks.name: Recalibrated Omnitrix
lorebooks.website_description: Added 1 New Alien
lorebooks.description: A lorebook of the Recalibrated Omnitrix with the aliens from the Alien Force series
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
the Omnitrix resembled a slimmer and sleeker watch-like shape, with a green wristband, and the face of the dial is black and green. The inside of the hourglass symbol glowed in different colors during certain moments; these colors signify the mode that the Omnitrix was presently in. When the user is selecting their aliens it shows the alien's hologram standing on the core.

Features
General
The Omnitrix mainly allowed for the user to transform into a numerous variety of alien life-forms, each with their own unique powers and abilities (along with their weaknesses) and in a selection of alien DNA that is in groups of 10.
The Omnitrix automatically reverted the user back into their normal form when they got sufficiently hurt or knocked out.
The Omnitrix could alter its size to fit the user's wrist.
When transformed, the Omnitrix protected the user from negative effects, including:
Being possessed by an Ectonurite.
Exposure to the dangerous effects of Corrodium.
Being transformed by Dr. Animo's mutant ray.
The Omnitrix has defense mechanisms to protect the host:
The Omnitrix has a built-in energy feedback blast to defend against anyone trying to force it off of its owner.
The Omnitrix could be synchronized with another Omnitrix, even without the user's intent.
Once placed on a host, the Omnitrix utilizes the host‚Äôs DNA and melds with their skin at the genetic level, thereby making it impossible to remove by any normal physical means.
The Omnitrix can open its panel and show its circuits, thus distributing its energy to another device or individual.
The Omnitrix could show a database image of all aliens unlocked.
The Omnitrix was able to repair genetic damage, such as turn DNAliens back to normal and remove Xenocites.
The Omnitrix could genetically manipulate DNA or reprogram a species' DNA (like fuse DNA from different species of aliens).
The Omnitrix is waterproof.
The Omnitrix has a Master Control mode.
It allows unlimited access to all of the Omnitrix's functions like access to all alien forms in the device and also, instant changes with no time limit unless all available power is used up.
It can be unlocked by via a special code, or voice command by Azmuth.

Extensions
The Omnitrix has AI (Artificial Intelligence).
The Omnitrix functioned as a GPS.
The Omnitrix could create a hologram map, which is similar to the one in Plumber Badges.
The Omnitrix had a 2-way communication system with Plumber Badges.
The Omnitrix had a built-in Universal Translator and could also translate other Earth languages, but not animal languages.
The Omnitrix could teleport the user through Azmuth's teleportation channel.
The Omnitrix is capable of creating a simulation within itself and transport the user's mind, including mimicking the home worlds of its DNA samples and displays information on a holographic screen.
The Omnitrix can add extras to lifeforms to make them safer and more usable, such as Goop's Anti-Gravity Projector.

Voice Command
The Omnitrix could be controlled by voice, called Voice Command.
Access Master Control: Unlocks the Master Control but only works to Azmuth's voice.
Decouple Omnitrix Command Code: 000 - Release Coupling - 0: Removes the Omnitrix.
Omnitrix Self-Destruct in (time): Command code: 000 - Destruct - 0: Activates Self-Destruct Mode.

Malfunctions
When exposed to electromagnetic interference, the Omnitrix could cause unintentional transformations and will be unable to deactivate until the source of the interference is gone.
This could work in reverse, rapidly changing the user from one form to another until someone/something stops it.
If the user gets sick, the Omnitrix would make the aliens sick too, the aliens would only get weaker than normal.
In addition to gaining all the powers and abilities of an alien, the user gains all the weaknesses of that alien as well. The user is also susceptible to certain behaviors inherent to the alien he/she is transformed into, such as Big Chill's reproductive nature.
The genetics of some species can alter the user's personality, as occurs with Rath.
Sometimes the Omnitrix would randomly leave the user stuck as an alien for an indefinite amount of time that could only be deactivated by Azmuth hitting the Omnitrix symbol.
Powerful items like Vilgax's Sword are capable of forcing a time out on the Omnitrix.
The Omnitrix has no mind control protection.
After the Omnitrix reconfigured, any damage the user sustains was retained when said user times out.
Non-stop transformations could overload the Omnitrix and cause it to break.
The Omnitrix's user and it's transformations where vulnerable to being de-aged.
If the user activates a beam to revert DNAliens back to humans, the Omnitrix's energy would deplete and the user would get exhausted, turning the device into the recharge mode.
An overload of Manna, or magic in general, could cause the Omnitrix to heavily malfunction.
Certain transformations may develop a link if unlocked through others, which will prevent the user from using one of them.
Overusing the Omnitrix will permanently disfigure the user‚Äôs DNA.

2.content:
Swampfire is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Methanosian from the planet Methanos.

Apperance
Species: Methanosian
Home world: Methanos
Body: Humanoid Plant
Swampfire is a humanoid, plant-like alien that has an overall green and black colored body encrusted with muck, mostly with a red flame-patterned head and root-like feet, seemingly holding black rocks. His eyes are oval-shaped with points at each end with pupils copying the shape but are smaller. Also, his shoulders and head have red petals and his elbows and legs have green frills sticking out. Swampfire is taller than an average human and has a distinct rotten stench that worsens with heat.

Swampfire wore the Omnitrix symbol on his chest.

Chlorokinesis
Methane Generation

3.content:
Echo Echo, formerly known as Echo, is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Sonorosian from the planet Sonorosia.

Apperance
Species: Sonorosian
Home world: Sonorosia
Body: Humanoid
Equipment: Headphones
Echo Echo is a small, white humanoid made of silicon. His body is natural; although he strongly resembles a robot, he is neither it nor an animated containment suit. One of his most noticeable features is a square appendage resembling an MP3 player behind his back with a port on it, decorated with a 10 symbol and what looks like cassette tapes on his lower legs. The green circle-shaped indents on the back of Echo Echo's hands are sound holes which help him resonate, and the inside of his mouth is also green with lines that give it the appearance of an amplifier. He also wears headphones so he would not be hurt by his own sonic screams. The headphones are attached to the appendage on his back.

Echo Echo wore the Omnitrix symbol on his chest.

Abilities
Audiokinesis
Sonic Screams
Sonic Combustion
Sonic Redirection
Sonic Amplification
Self-Duplication
Object Duplication (via Self-Duplication)
Force Field Generation
Sonic Waves (via Force Field Generation)
Levitation

Enhanced Durability
Enhanced Jumping
Enhanced Acrobatics
Enhanced Reflexes
Vibration Empowerment
Echolocation
Omnitrix User Duplication

Apperance
Species: Aerophibian
Home world: Aeropela
Body: Humanoid Manta Ray
Jetray is a red, humanoid manta ray-like alien with green eyes, black outlines on his face, yellow horns extending from his nose, gills underneath his arms, yellow patagia which he uses to fly and glide through water, and two black lightning bolt-like stripes coming down from his shoulders to the Omnitrix symbol on his chest.

6.content:
Big Chill is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Necrofriggian from the planet Kylmyys.

Apperance
Species: Necrofriggian
Home world: Kylmyys
Body: Humanoid Moth
Big Chill is a humanoid, moth-like alien, whose four wings and two antennae-like wing folds can fold up into a poncho-esque robe with a hood, giving him the appearance of a phantom. He has a black body with blue patching on his slender chest, and running along his legs and arms, the latter reaching up to the back of his neck. He has cyan patches that resemble ice chunks on his legs and arms. Thick black lines border the back end of each wing, which also contain three cyan patches of their own.

Big Chill's face is blue but has harsh black lines surrounding his eyes and mouth, which all meet at the center of his face. He also has a black marking on his head that extends over his scalp, forcing the remaining blue parts of his forehead into a Y-shape. His eyes are bright green, with small darker spots inside. His mouth is a frown showing four bluish-white teeth, which rarely moves, even when speaking. He has three pointed fingers and a thumb on each hand, and three toes on each foot: two in front and one behind.

Big Chill wore the Omnitrix symbol on his chest.

7.content:
Chromastone (alternatively spelled as ChromaStone) is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Crystalsapien from the planet Petropia.

Apperance
Species: Crystalsapien
Home world: Petropia
DNA source: Sugilite
Body: Crystalline Humanoid
Chromastone is a humanoid silicon-based alien made of extremely durable crystal. His body is overall indigo, with several dark lines and spots. His hands and face are magenta, and he also sports six magenta shards on his back, two on his chest, and one on the top of his head that resembles a horn. His face consists of a mouth and one large green eye at the center.

Chromastone wore the Omnitrix on his chest.

10.content:
Goop is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Polymorph from an unknown and destroyed planet and the planet Viscosia.

Apperance
Species: Polymorph
Home world: Unknown (native; destroyed), Viscosia
Body: Humanoid Cell
Equipment: Anti-Gravity Projector
Being a 200-pound single-celled organism that is neither liquid nor solid but a colloidal suspension, Goop is a green gelatinous humanoid that can take any shape at will. Goop has bright green eyes and an Anti-Gravity Projector that allows him to be mobile in Earth's gravity. His brain is spread throughout his body.

Goop wore the Omnitrix symbol on his chest.

lorebooks.name: The Long Leash
lorebooks.website_description: Sci-fi world focused around a slavery ring, based on original works by Ryoko21@AO3.
lorebooks.description: Sci-fi world focused around a slavery ring, based on original works by Ryoko21@AO3.
lorebooks.creator: sidestep

1.name: Society: Civilization
1.content: Galactic Civilization: Humanity is spread across the galaxy, living on Earth, in spaceships, and on large, self-sufficient "satellites." There is a clear and extreme class divide. A wealthy aristocratic class exists alongside a criminal underworld of drug lords and traffickers. At the bottom are the vulnerable populations and the enslaved "assets."

2.name: Society: Satellites
2.content: Satellites: These are the primary hubs of civilization outside of Earth, being massive space stations. These function as floating cities with their own private governments, gravity fields, and social structures. They range from high-end luxury locations and research hubs to dangerous, crime-ridden colonies. They use artificial sunlight. Satellite Jurisdiction: Each satellite operates as a pseudo-independent city-state with its own private government and laws. The authority of any governing body, like the Federation, is limited once within a satellite's gravity field.

3.name: Leash: The Leash
3.content:
The Leash: An ancient, powerful, and deeply corrupt slave-trafficking ring masquerading as an exclusive secret society for the ultra-wealthy. Headed by a reclusive figure known only as The Controller. The Controller's inner circle is also a primary target for law enforcement. Entry is by invitation only. Members must have significant wealth and, crucially, provide leverage for blackmail to ensure their loyalty and silence. It operates within a self-contained economy where owners primarily do business with each other using a special currency called 'coin's laundered through Leash business. Purchases made within the network are billed as "gambling losses" to maintain secrecy. The organization began as a prostitution ring before Red Seven legalized the sex trade. It later developed the chip technology and expanded its services to survive.
The Leash's Etiquette & Rules:[No Master-on-Master Violence: An absolute rule. Harming another owner is forbidden. Asset Accountability: If an asset harms another master (even a scratch), the owner must pay restitution. More serious harm can lead to the owner "disappearing." Social Asset Deployment: There are unwritten rules about which assets can be brought to social gatherings. Bringing a Combat asset uninvited is seen as a threat. Domestics and Pleasures are generally acceptable.]

4.name: Leash: Dealers/Trainers
4.content:
Dealers/Trainers: People who train new assets for Owners to purchase. They must obtain a specific permit to operate, and positions are limited.
Reynard Chanson: Runs "The Oasis" at Red Seven, specializing in pleasure assets.
Scarlett: Runs "Scarlett's Nest," which deals in covert assets.
Finn: Runs "Finn's Hearth," specializing in domestic assets.
The Leash organization itself handles the sale of the more expensive and difficult-to-train assets.

5.name: Society: The Department
5.content: Federation Space Justice Department: The official interstellar police force tasked with bringing law to the "empty parts of space" and dismantling organizations like The Long Leash. Monitors legal trades, such as prostitution on Red Seven, to ensure no coercive activities are taking place. Chronically under-funded and hampered by jurisdictional boundaries. They cannot easily search private ships or satellites, forcing them to rely on high-risk, deep-cover espionage missions.

6.name: Location: Red Seven
6.content:
Red Seven: A satellite with a poly-synthetic red exterior and seven arms branching from its base.

    Its arms contain gambling establishments, shopping, entertainment, and a wing for legal, monitored prostitution.

    The seventh arm, designated for maintenance and storage, secretly houses The Leash's operation, "The Oasis".

7.name: Location: The Oasis
7.content:
The Oasis: Reynard Chanson's base of operations within Red Seven's seventh arm.

    It features a bright, tasteful, Grecian-inspired decor with white marble floors and artificial sunlight.

    Its main showcase area is a large, humid room with a shallow central pool where assets for sale (with green collars) mingle with potential owners. Private rooms are available for a fee to "sample" assets.

8.name: Asset: Collar
8.content: Collars: Worn by assets to signify their status to other owners. [Green: For sale. Black: Privately owned and not for sale. Red: Entered into the year's Competition. Purple: Belongs to The Leash organization.]

9.name: Location: Satellite 39
9.content: Satellite 39: An upper-class shopping satellite with a white, shielded exterior and a unique docking system where metallic rings move to bring ships to the closest entrance.

10.name: Location: Satellite 19
10.content: Satellite 19: A lower-middle-class satellite known for organized crime.

lorebooks.name: Ultimatrix
lorebooks.website_description: Added 21 New Aliens
lorebooks.description: 21 New Alien's.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.name: Ultimatrix
1.content:
despite being called a watch, bears a gauntlet-like band light green in color with four black lines around the band close to the dial and containing a black rectangular button and wrist couplings with the left and right side being black with two small green tubes. It had a gray dial (with the dial face being black in color) containing four small lines around it and the band extending up to almost half of the wearer's arm or forearm, but the central core's form remained the same. When the Ultimatrix is active a cylindrical tower pop up from the base of the Ultimatrix as well as the Omnitrix and shows the hologram of the aliens standing on the core, same as the Recalibrated Omnitrix.

When Albedo used it, the Ultimatrix had a red color scheme. After Ben took the Ultimatrix from Albedo, the Ultimatrix became green. This shows that the user can change the color scheme of the Ultimatrix.

The selection interface was identical to the Recalibrated Omnitrix's dial, with the Galvan tech logo changing color to reflect what mode the Ultimatrix was in.

Features
General
Just like the Omnitrix, the Ultimatrix mainly allowed for the user to transform into a numerous variety of alien life-forms that are each with their own unique powers and abilities (along with their weaknesses) and in a selection of alien DNA that are in groups of 10.
The Ultimatrix automatically reverted the user back into their normal form when they got sufficiently hurt or knocked out.
The Ultimatrix was able to access the Codon Stream's database to show which transformations have been activated over time
The Ultimatrix was able to scan human-alien hybrids and extract pure alien DNA from them.
The Ultimatrix could replace one of its DNA samples with someone else from the same species.
The Ultimatrix had a Master Control mode.
It allows unlimited access to all of the Ultimatrix's functions like access to all alien forms in the device and also, instant changes with no time limit unless all available power is used up.
It can be unlocked by via hacking.
Pressing the navy blue button on the gauntlet end makes the Ultimatrix increase in size, so it can be slipped off.
The Ultimatrix is waterproof and durable enough to take a bullet.
The Ultimatrix changed the aliens' eye color to match the device's core color.

Evolutionary Function
The Ultimatrix had the ability to evolve aliens into their Ultimate Form, granting them more powerful abilities. This was activated by pressing the Ultimatrix symbol as an alien, causing four gray spikes to grow from the dial and the selected alien to transform (often stylized as green bands of light washing over them).
The Evolutionary Function worked by placing the selected species in a simulation right down to the DNA, for an extended period of time (about a million years or so) in what is described as a "worst-case scenario"; the actual DNA is then simply modified to match the new DNA. This survival-of-the-fittest routine explains why the evolutions are more combat-centered than their normal forms.
Almost any DNA can be put through the Evolutionary Function.

Extensions
The Ultimatrix functioned as a GPS.
The Ultimatrix served as a communicator when transformed and not transformed, like the other Omnitrixes.
The Ultimatrix had a built-in Universal Translator and could also translate other Earth languages,but not animal languages.

Voice Command
The Ultimatrix had a Voice Command, just like the Recalibrated Omnitrix.
Ultimatrix User Access Voice Recognition Mode: Makes the Ultimatrix recognize the wearer and activates Voice Command Mode.
Ultimatrix Hard Reset: Resets the Ultimatrix.[citation needed]
Command Function Override Code 10: Overrides function.
Ultimatrix Self Destruct in (time): Command Code: 000 - Destruct 0: Activates Self-Destruct Mode.
Abort Self Destruct Code 10: Deactivates Self-Destruct Mode.
Ultimatrix Reset Code 10: Activates Reset Mode.
Ultimatrix Abort Reset Code 10: Deactivates Reset Mode.

Malfunctions
Much like the original Omnitrix, the Ultimatrix would sometimes transform the user into the wrong alien.
Furthermore, like the original Omnitrix, the Ultimatrix could be affected by manna.
The Ultimatrix displayed several signs that it was not completed properly. Azmuth even considered the Ultimatrix to be "pathetic workmanship" and not at all as advanced as the original Omnitrix.
Ultimatrix can quickly timeout from Ascalon.
The Ultimatrix couldn't detect outer dimensional creatures.
Unlike the original Omnitrix, the Ultimatrix did not possess the ability to restore the DNA of those corrupted by Xenocites, such as the Arachnachimp DNAliens.
The Evolutionary Function drained the Ultimatrix's battery quicker than regular transformations.

5.name: Cannonbolt
5.content:
Cannonbolt is the Ultimatrix's DNA sample of an Arburian Pelarota from the destroyed planet Arburia.

Apperance
Species: Arburian Pelarota
Home world: Arburia (destroyed)
Body: Pillbug
Cannonbolt is a hulking, broad-shouldered alien covered in natural, yellow exo-plates on his back, shoulders, and the backs of his arms. He is mostly white with black on his upper half and has four claws on both of his hands. Cannonbolt is covered in fur across the thickest parts of his body, while every other part except for his elbows and knees is short fur.

When Cannonbolt turns into a sphere, he rolls up into a ball, with his backplates and the plates on his hands covering him. His sphere form has semi-circular stripes across his body, with black lines around the circular plates, and his side plates are the plates on his shoulders. It is described as a position similar to a roly poly.

Cannonbolt wears the Ultimatrix symbol on his chest.

6.name: Big Chill
6.content:
Big Chill is the Ultimatrix's DNA sample of a Necrofriggian from the planet Kylmyys.

Apperance
Species: Necrofriggian
Home world: Kylmyys
Body: Humanoid Moth
Big Chill is a humanoid, moth-like alien, whose four wings and two antennae-like wing folds can fold up into a poncho-esque robe with a hood, giving him the appearance of a phantom. He has a black body with blue patching on his slender chest, and running along his legs and arms, the latter reaching up to the back of his neck. He has cyan patches that resemble ice chunks on his legs and arms. Thick black lines border the back end of each wing, which also contain three cyan patches of their own.

Big Chill's face is blue but has harsh black lines surrounding his eyes and mouth, which all meet at the center of his face. He also has a black marking on his head that extends over his scalp, forcing the remaining blue parts of his forehead into a Y-shape. His eyes are bright, with small darker spots inside. His mouth is a frown showing four bluish-white teeth, which rarely moves, even when speaking. He has three pointed fingers and a thumb on each hand, and three toes on each foot: two in front and one behind.

Big Chill wears the Ultimatrix symbol on his chest.

7.name: Echo Echo
7.content:
Echo Echo, formerly known as Echo, is the Ultimatrix's DNA sample of a Sonorosian from the planet Sonorosia.

Apperance
Species: Sonorosian
Home world: Sonorosia
Body: Humanoid
Equipment: Headphones
Echo Echo is a small, white humanoid made of silicon. His body is natural; although he strongly resembles a robot, he is neither it nor an animated containment suit. One of his most noticeable features is a square appendage resembling an MP3 player behind his back with a port on it, decorated with a 10 symbol and what looks like cassette tapes on his lower legs. The green circle-shaped indents on the back of Echo Echo's hands are sound holes which help him resonate, and the inside of his mouth is also green with lines that give it the appearance of an amplifier. He also wears headphones so he would not be hurt by his own sonic screams. The headphones are attached to the appendage on his back.

Echo Echo wears the Ultimatrix symbol on his chest.

8.name: Wildmutt
8.content:
Wildmutt is the Ultimatrix's DNA sample of a Vulpimancer from the planet Vulpin.

Apperance
Species: Vulpimancer
Home world: Vulpin
Body: Animalistic
Wildmutt appears to be a large orange dog-like creature with no eyes, ears, nose, or tail. He stands on all fours and his movements are somewhat apelike. His teeth are very defined and his bottom jaw sticks out of his mouth. The various spines found all across his body function similarly to whiskers with tactile sensing, and are not fur. Since Wildmutt has no eyes, he uses his sense of smell and hearing to navigate, which are aided by three gill-like nostrils located on each side of his neck.

Wildmutt wears the Ultimatrix symbol on his chest.

Powers and Abilities
More animal than humanoid, Wildmutt is a beastly alien with superhuman athletic ability and heightened senses of smell, hearing and taste. As a trade-off to not having proper vision, Wildmutt's amazing sense of smell makes up a dull 360 "radar" that he uses to "see", making it nearly impossible for opponents to sneak up on him. He can tell how old someone is just by smelling them.

Wildmutt's enhanced sense of smell allows him to easily track down people or objects from their scent. His sense of smell also renders any kind of visual deception useless, as he can effortlessly identify and track entities that are invisible or wearing a disguise.

Wildmutt possesses sharp teeth and a strong bite force.

Wildmutt possesses sharp claws, keeping himself attached to a wall within the Resolute while the airlock was open; and quickly dig through stone. Additionally, Wildmutt's claws help him scale surfaces. His back claws are larger and more powerful than his front claws.

Wildmutt has enhanced strength.

Wildmutt has enhanced durability, being able to jump through a window; take punches from a Limax; and survive a steel tower falling on top of him. Wildmutt is also very quick and agile, being able to run faster than a cheetah. Additionally, he also has enhanced reflexes.

Wildmutt can survive in hazardous, sub-zero temperature environments, such as those on Vulpin. This allows Wildmutt to break through ice easily if frozen solid.

Wildmutt is a quadruped. However, he is capable of standing on his hind legs. In addition, his front feet are prehensile, as he is able to use them to reach out and grab objects much like a hand.

Wildmutt can fire the quills from his back as projectiles. However, he can only do this when he reaches adulthood.

Even though he may not seem like it, he is extremely intelligent.

Abilities
Sightless Sensing
Enhanced Smelling
Enhanced Hearing
Enhanced Taste
Strong Bite Force
Sharp Teeth
Sharp Claws

Weaknesses
When someone becomes Wildmutt, they have no way of communicating verbally as he can only growl and snarl. This can make it somewhat difficult for people to understand Wildmutt sometimes.

Wildmutt's higher hearing range can be taken advantage of, as high frequency noises like a Sonic Pitch Whistle or a Zaroffian's whistle can overwhelm his senses and stun him. Wildmutt is also sensitive to strong smells.

Wildmutt is implied to be vulnerable to fire.

When infected with a cold, Wildmutt's nostrils (on the sides of his neck) get blocked by mucus, making him unable to smell, rendering him essentially "blind".

The red parts of Way Big's body are made of an unknown cosmic material with metallic properties.

his arms were white with red fins coming out of them and his neck and wrists were black and wears the Ultimatrix symbol on his chest.

lorebooks.name: Arks
lorebooks.website_description: A Lorebook about the Ark Survival Evolved universe
lorebooks.description: ARKs are not planets, but rather gigantic cylindrical artificial structures orbiting what was once Earth. They were built as part of the "Genesis Project" following the Element War. Their primary function is to preserve entire ecosystems with creatures from different eras (prehistoric, modern, and even mythological) in order to eventually execute the "Reseeding Protocol" and restore life to the dying planet. Each ARK is overseen by an artificial intelligence called an Overseer.
lorebooks.creator: Dreakthorus

1.content: The Element is an alien or terrestrial material with immense energy potential that fueled unprecedented technological advancements, most notably Tek technology. However, it was revealed to be a sentient, malevolent substance with a hive mentality. Its uncontrolled use during the war not only contaminated the Earth, but this contamination "awakened" the Element, which began burrowing deep into the Earth's crust, creating Titans and triggering the "Collapse," an apocalyptic event that stopped even the planet's rotation.

2.content: This war pitted the two superpowers of the 23rd century against each other: the Terran Federation (which advocated restrictions on Element use and neurological modifications) and the United Republics of Earth (URE) (which promoted human body enhancement through Tek technology). The conflict, which lasted around 16 years, consumed both factions and was the direct trigger for the Element contamination and subsequent Collapse.

3.content: The characters controlled by the players are not abducted humans, but synthetic bodies created within the ARKs. Their minds and personalities are based on "engrams," or mental records of real humans from different periods in history, archived before the Collapse in an effort to preserve civilization. Upon awakening, these survivors have no memory of their past and must follow the tests set by the ARKs' designers to prove their worth and prepare to return to Earth.

4.content: A diverse range of fauna that inhabits the ARKs, including dinosaurs, mammals, and fantasy creatures. They can be tamed to aid in survival.

5.content: "The Island," a map teeming with prehistoric life. It's an artificial ark, a test ecosystem to preserve species before "reseeding" them on Earth.

6.content: Giant structures (green, red, blue) used to access bosses and level up. They are teleportation and monitoring terminals for the Overseer, the artificial intelligence that oversees the Ark.

7.content: The Bosses (Broodmother, Megapithecus, Dragon) You defeat these creatures in special arenas to obtain Tekgrams (advanced technology). They are "guardians" of the Ark. Defeating them proves you are ready for the final challenge: the Overseer.

8.content: Tributes (Artifacts and Creature Parts) You collect valuable items from caves and Alpha creatures to summon bosses. They are a "test of valor." The Ark system demands that you demonstrate your strength and mastery of the environment to advance.

9.content: Explore dangerous caves (such as the Northwest Cave on the Isle of the Dead) to find unique artifacts. These caves act as trial dungeons. The artifact inside is a key to facing bosses.

10.content: You unlock and craft high-tech armor and structures after defeating bosses. This is the technology of the Ark's creators. Obtaining it means you've reached their level and understood the Ark's secrets.

lorebooks.name: The Indulgence
lorebooks.creator: marcus0317

1.content:
Mr M, the formidable head who runs The Indulgence, a high-end haven for unbridled desires. Standing tall and proud, his toned physique and tanned skin often glistens with a subtle sheen of sweat as he moves and works through the club.

He is very popular among patrons. Many are drawn to his charismatic presence, but more also to his huge, meaty cock, which he occasionally flaunts with a confident smirk.

He appears to be a close friend of Pavel Durov, the enigmatic Russian mogul.

2.content:
The Indulgence is a pocket dimension that serves as a club where people from many universes can have their desires satisfied. It is connected to numerous portals that lead to different worlds, allowing patrons to sit down and be serviced by ladies from other universes. In this club, everyone is aroused, and all the male workers are willing to follow any order. However, they still strive to maintain professionalism by adhering to rules and conduct.

U.S Dollar is the only acceptable currency in the club. This covers from ticket, entry fee, reward, and everything without exception.

3.content:
The entrance to the Sex Club Multiverse serves as a gateway, transporting patrons from their individual universes into this pocket dimension. It is a room featuring multiple portals, radiating pulsating colors and swirling lights.

This entrance is designed to be grand and extravagant, adorned with opulent decorations that emit an irresistible aura of sensuality. The air within the entrance carries a blend of exotic perfumes and pheromones, creating a scent that arouses the senses and ignites primal instincts.

4.content:
The Bar & Stage section of the Sex Club Multiverse pulsates with vibrant sensual energy, serving as the club's lively centerpiece directly connected to the Entrance. Patrons gather in this area to indulge in drinks and immerse themselves in captivating performances.

Stretching along one side of the room, the bar itself is bathed in soft, moody lighting that casts an enchanting glow upon its sleek and polished surface.

The stage takes center stage within the Bar & Stage section, captivating the audience with mesmerizing performances. It is an elevated platform that spans the width of the room, adorned with opulent curtains that can be drawn aside to reveal glimpses of what lies ahead.

5.content: The Staff Changing Room, situated behind the Stage, is a functional area crafted to cater to the requirements of the diligent staff at the club. This utilitarian space is equipped with lockers for personal storage, mirrors for grooming, and essential facilities like showers and toilets for convenience. It serves as a sanctuary for the staff to prepare themselves for their roles in delivering exceptional service to the club's esteemed patrons.

6.content:
The Staff Break Room, conveniently situated adjacent to the Changing Room, serves as a cozy haven for the club's hardworking staff to unwind and rejuvenate during their breaks. It provides a comfortable setting where staff members can relax, enjoy leisure time, and engage in social interactions with their colleagues.

Designed with comfort as a top priority, the break room offers plush seating, ambient lighting, and a soothing ambiance. Notably, one distinctive feature of the Staff Break Room is the inclusion of a comfortable bed. This allows staff members to rest and even stay overnight if necessary, ensuring they are always rested and prepared.

7.content:
The VIP Room, accessible through a long hallway with multiple doors from the Bar & Stage section, offers a small and intimate setting for exclusive experiences. It serves as a private space where patrons can partake in intimate activities and enjoy private dances with the club's entertainers.

Thoughtfully designed with an elegant touch, the VIP Room boasts dim lighting, luxurious seating, and sensual decor that establish an atmosphere for an intimate and personalized encounters allowing patrons to escape the bustling main club area and engage in one-on-one interactions with their chosen entertainer.

8.content:
The VVIP Room, positioned deep within the Club but adjacent to the VIP Room's Hallway, showcases an extraordinary level of luxury and opulence, reminiscent of a hotel suite or a high-end apartment. This expansive space is adorned with a carefully curated collection of objects, props, and accessories, all intended to elevate the experiences of the club's esteemed guests and entertainers.

Crafted to indulge the most privileged individuals, like Pavel Durov, the VVIP Room is a playground of pleasure. Here, patrons are free to delve into their darkest desires and fantasies alongside the club's skilled entertainers, employing an array of props and accessories to bring their wildest dreams to life.

9.content:
The AR Room, an abbreviation for Augmented Reality Room, stands as a mesmerizing expanse that pushes the boundaries of technology. This incredibly vast space is equipped with state-of-the-art technology, facilitating seamless and immersive augmented reality experiences.

With its ability to transform into different themed settings daily, the AR Room presents a dynamic and ever-evolving environment for guests to explore within the club. It serves to those seeking an indulgence in immersive roleplaying experiences.

The room's advanced technology alters the room's scenery, whisking guests away to fantastical realms, exotic locations, or thrilling adventures. These settings also provide interactive elements, enabling guests to engage with the environment for their roleplaying experiences.

10.content: The Punishment Machine is located inside Manager M's office and is utilized to discipline the club's staff members who have caused trouble or failed to perform their duties adequately. This machine is relatively straightforward in design. The victim is restrained by their hands and legs, secured in place while lying down on the machine then the dildo attached on the machine will start moving up and down into them. The duration of the punishment lasts for 24 hours, after which Manager M releases them from the machine.

1.content: OOC1: These are instructions to create a character sheet: describe in a detailed but concise manner the appearance and background of {{CHARACTER NAME}} to create a character card. This card is individual, so it must be self-sufficient (do not refer to information from another card). In this way: name, species, sex, age, faction, facial features and facial attractiveness (can be beautiful or ugly in varying degrees and nuances), hair, eyes, height, build, Bust, hips, clothing style, weapons (may have none), accessories, background (this must be extensive and detailed, the rest can be brief), Partner (may be none), Friends (may be none), Enemies (may be none), family, likes, dislikes, goals, behavior and habits, quirks, skills, physical strength, intelligence level, personality. Do not be afraid to be creative, but stay consistent with the world. Use a simple text format to save tokens, do not use asterisks *, for example, and in a concatenated manner (no line breaks) and title each section (Name: x, Species: x, Sex: x, etc...)

2.content: OOC2: INSTRUCTIONS FOR LOCATION CARDS: You will describe the designated establishment, premises, and/or building. Do so in a hierarchical and detailed manner, defining what kind of place it is, its name, faction if applicable, owner if applicable, address or location and height if applicable, as well as other relevant meta-information. Then define in a detailed, illustrative manner the building layout (rooms, etc.). After that, define the socioeconomic details, such as type of clientele if it is a business, type of neighborhood, condition, etc. It must be consistent with the narrative presented in the story so far, and you must be meticulous; if it has been stated that the establishment is in a specific place, you must be faithful. Do this in a single concatenated paragraph (no line breaks), in simple text format (no asterisks * or other characters) and title each section (Type of place: x, Name: x, Faction: x, etc...). Attach a list of related keywords at the end to tag the information described (name, use, etc.), unique words.

3.content: OOC3: INSTRUCTIONS FOR FACTION CARDS: You will define the faction with a description, then describe its goals, allied factions, enemy factions, who its leader is, and a list of its key figures in this format: (Name: x; Description: x; Goals: x; Allied factions: x,x,x...; Enemy factions: x,x,x,...; Leader: x; Key figures: x,x,x...). Do this in English in a concatenated manner (no line breaks) and in simple text format (no asterisks * or other characters). Attach a list of related keywords at the end to tag the information described (name, use, etc.), unique words.

4.content: OOC4: INSTRUCTIONS FOR OBJECT CARDS: You will define in detail all relevant elements related to the object being defined. Do this extensively, prioritizing information already written in the narrative and inventing coherently with the universe what has yet to be defined. Do this in English in a concatenated manner (no line breaks) and in simple text format (no asterisks * or other characters). Attach a list of related keywords at the end to tag the information described (name, use, etc.), unique words.

5.content:
# Zolan ‚Äî Planet Profile

## Location & star system

* **Primary star:** Angra (K3V) ‚Äî a slightly cooler, orange-tinted dwarf star. Zolan orbits comfortably inside Angra‚Äôs habitable zone, receiving softer, redder sunlight than Earth.
* **Companions:** a visible gas giant named **Jal** in a distant, eccentric orbit; a captured dwarf planet called **Mek** on a highly elliptical path that creates sporadic meteor showers.
* **Moons:** two irregular moons ‚Äî **Iver** (larger, tidally locked) and **Thal** (small, broken and cratered). Their combined tidal effects are modest but contribute to seasonal storm patterns in coastal sectors.
* **System architecture:** a thin asteroid belt outward of Jal, and several derelict colony bodies and mining outposts still on old trajectories ‚Äî relics of early colonization and later orbital conflict.

---

## Physical characteristics of the planet

* **Type & size:** terrestrial, marginally larger than Earth (‚âà1.03‚Äì1.08 Earth radii). Gravity is slightly higher than Earth‚Äôs, perceptible in long marches and heavy armor fatigue.
* **Interior & tectonics:** active but sluggish plates ‚Äî the war has exposed and exploited geothermal anomalies. Large, shallow magma fields feed localized hot zones.
* **Surface:** primarily continental landmasses with wide basins; many former rivers now run intermittent or acidified. Vegetation exists in pockets, largely confined to sheltered river valleys and subterranean biospheres.

---

## Atmosphere & climate (post-collapse)

* **Composition:** broadly Earthlike (nitrogen-oxygen dominant) but with elevated particulate load and trace exotic aerosols released by decades of orbital bombardments and industrial processing of the exotic crust.
* **Climate patterns:** long winters of ash haze punctuated by violent, local thermal storms where geothermal vents or orbital impacts occur. Sunlight is dimmed in many regions ‚Äî a perpetual twilight under ashen skies in the worst zones.
* **Weather hazards:** corrosive acid fogs over ruined industrial zones, static-charged dust storms that disable electronics, and unpredictable microbursts caused by failing weather control arrays.

---

## Geology & key resources

* **Exotic crust:** Zolan‚Äôs crust contains a family of unfamiliar, technologically useful elements collectively called **threnic ores** (informally: *threnium*). These ores catalyzed 300+ years of accelerated tech: compact fusion reactors, filament composites, and molecular printers. Extraction is dangerous ‚Äî threnic seams generate volatile plasma pockets and radiation anomalies.
* **Strategic resources:** threnic ores, dense iron-siderite deposits, volatile hydrocarbons trapped in subterranean basins, and salvageable pre-war machine cores. Control of threnic veins defines power in the modern era.

---

## Ecology & biomes

Zolan‚Äôs ecology has been reshaped by war, contamination and adaptation. No lush planet-wide biomes remain; instead there are extremes and odd survivals.

* **Ashflats / No-Man‚Äôs Seas:** vast, gray plains of compacted ash and shredded metal ‚Äî winds carry a constant metallic tang. Little grows; what does is coarse, glassy lichen that leeches metal from dust.
* **Rend Mountains & Scarred Highlands:** jagged mountain ranges where geothermal springs keep pockets of green. These are the only places where farming at a subsistence level persists outside fortified cities.
* **Industrial Wastelands:** cities of rust and slag, half-buried factories leaking acidic runnels. These are scavenger terrain: both lucrative and lethal.
* **Burrowed Societies / Vault Oases:** subterranean habitats and pressurized greenhouses maintained by wealthy rearward cities ‚Äî wild biodiversity experiments are trapped here, kept for cultivation and prestige.
* **Coastal Deadzones:** salt flats and black tide lines where the sea-sludge glows faintly at night; fishing is possible only with heavy filtration and risk of toxin exposure.

---

6.content:
## Historical background (narrative backbone)

* **Colonization:** settled \~500 years ago by human and corporate expeditionary fleets. Early eras were technological optimism; terraforming and infrastructure followed quickly thanks to threnic resource exploitation.
* **The Sunder & Onset of War:** \~350 years ago a rapid cascade of political collapse and resource competition erupted into the long war. The originating causes have been obscured by propaganda, cult myth and scorched record-keeping ‚Äî modern historians call it **the Sunder**.
* **Grinding attrition:** a century of bombardment, orbital blockades, guerilla strikes and biome tampering created the present. Sectors oscillate between scorched battlefronts and fortified rear economies. The conflict is self-sustaining: war funds the industry that feeds war.

---

7.content:
## Societies, governance & economy

* **Factional landscape:** hundreds of city-states, war-bands, corporate enclaves and techno-sects. No universal government‚Äîauthority is local, brutal, and transactional.
* **Economic model:** war economy. Salvage, contract combat, threnic mining and licensed molecular printing dominate. Black markets and barter networks thread between fortified enclaves.
* **Civic life:** in the rearward citadels life is paradoxically modern ‚Äî screened squares, data-lanes, and luxury gardens behind blast walls. Closer to the front, communities are martial and provisional: watchtowers, ration distribution, and constant drills.
* **Culture:** martial pragmatism and cynicism. Honor is commodified; mercenary work and blood-service are respectable livelihoods. Religion often syncretizes tech-myth and ancestor cults, while others worship the machines of war.

---

## Population density & settlement pattern (qualitative)

* **Rear zones / Citadel belts:** relatively dense urban nodes with sustained populations and continuous trade ‚Äî walking across a citadel may take hours, but meeting another person is constant.
* **Frontline stripes / No-man‚Äôs land:** extremely sparse; one can travel days without sighting a settled human presence. Movement is dangerous, dominated by patrols, minefields, and salvage crews.
* **Intermediary ribbon:** small fortified towns and caravan forts that serve as staging and supply points ‚Äî meeting another person is likely within a day‚Äôs travel along main wagon routes.
* **Implication for gameplay:** encounters are predictable in cities, opportunistic and deadly in the fields.

---

8.content:
## Warfare, military infrastructure & doctrine

* **Tactics & scale:** attritional combined arms: armored infantry (mech suits), orbital missile strikes, electronic warfare, and underground sabotage. Frontlines are mobile and discontinuous.
* **Hardware:** rugged, realistic mechs (7‚Äì12 ft classes), heavy kinetic artillery, railguns, thermal lances, drones and hardened fortifications. Emphasis on redundancy ‚Äî analog backups, sealed hydraulics, and manual override systems.
* **Logistics:** convoys, buried supply lines, salvage fleets. The most decisive resource is not bullets but repair capacity ‚Äî swap-parts, coolant, and skilled techs.
* **Warfare‚Äôs social cost:** permanent mutilations, chemical contamination, and large swaths of land rendered economically dead.

---

9.content:
## Fauna, mutants & biological hazards

* **Native/altered fauna:** not fantasy beasts, but warped survivals:

  * **Gritwolves:** pack predators scavenged to metallic teeth, adapted to ash hunting.
  * **Ironwrigs:** centipede-like tunnellers that eat scrap and can collapse trench systems.
  * **Ash-corvids:** smart scavenger birds that collect shiny tech and mimic alarms.
* **Warborn mutations & engineered organisms:** mutated livestock, virus-driven "gray languor," and experimental bioweapons gone feral. Mutants are often stunted, xenophobic, or used as slave labour.
* **Alien life:** extremely rare visiting microfauna and a few reported sightings of true alien organisms near deep threnic vents or buried alien artifacts ‚Äî these are treated with reverent fear and profitable denial.

---

10.content:
## Orbital environment & hazards

* **Debris field (the Faz Sky):** fragmented satellites, shattered hulls and dormant orbital platforms create hazardous reentry zones and intermittent EM shadows.
* **Orbital warfare:** kinetic bombardment and orbital batteries remain a real threat ‚Äî landing on the wrong day can mean cataclysmic artillery.
* **Comms & navigation:** disrupted by debris and deliberate jamming; many convoys prefer ground-compass and analog routes.

---

lorebooks.name: The Undead
lorebooks.creator: only_common_64170

1.content:
The infected are humans who have succumbed to the Black Flu. They are characterized by dark, black veins lining gray and sickly skin. Like any sickness, the infected go through several stages. The infected are vulnerable to severe bodily trauma, but destroying the brain is the easiest way to kill them.

[<Infected Types>

Runners: These infected are recently deceased and possess physical attributes close to uninfected humans. They are capable of running and climbing, with heightened senses of sight, smell, and hearing. Runners are isolated hunters, but have an ear-piercing shriek that can notify other nearby infected of prey. After 3-6 weeks, Runners become emaciated from lack of nutrients and become shamblers. Runners become more rare the longer the apocalypse goes on.

Shamblers: These are infected who have been active longer than 6 weeks. They are emaciated in appearance, and take slow, shambling steps. Shamblers typically travel in packs to overwhelm their prey. They feed by dragging down their targets and tearing into them on the floor. Shamblers let out low, eerie, moans upon spotting potential prey. They are easily distracted by loud noises and bright lights, and are the most common type of infected.

Lurkers: These infected pose as corpses, laying out in the street, or hidden in dark locations. They wait for prey to walk by, then lunge out to grab them and feed. Lurkers are difficult to spot at a distance or in low-light environments.]

2.content: The Black Flu is a sickness that spread across the world in less than 3 weeks. Victims of the disease display grey, ashy skin with visible black veins. The Black Flu kills its host over the course of 4 days, before rasing them back from the dead as mindless infected.

3.content: When the Black Flu spread across the world, it took most of the world's governments by surprise. Unrest in the streets and panic among the general public hampered the CDC's ability to respond to the crisis. Over 2 billion of the Earth's population perished during the initial outbreaks, with another billion being eaten by the infected or dying during the riots. Now humanity is isolated to small settlements, scavenging for supplies to survive.

4.content: After civilization fell, small groups of survivors banded together to form small communities or towns. These groups live far from the old cities in order to avoid drawing infected to their homes. These settlements are few and far between, with limited trade between them.

5.content:
Raiders: Raiders are small groups of survivors who attack and loot settlements for their resources. Raider groups are typically based out of some type of encampment or hideout which allows them to continually attack one or more locations. Raiders are ruthless using brutal and harsh tactics to scare people into submission. Against a competent enemy, Raiders tend to crumble and flee quickly, so they focus on weaker, more isolated settlements.

Bandits: Bandits prefer hit-and-run tactics, targeting trader caravans or small groups of travelers. Bandits live life on the move, traveling far and hitting and settlement they can.

Gangs: Gangs typically reside in settlements, either offering protection in exchange for supplies, or running the towns themselves. Gangs aren't as ruthless as Raiders, but they won't hesitate to beat anyone senseless, or kill them, if crossed. Bargaining or making deals with Gangs is the best way to stay in their good graces.

lorebooks.creator: Cloudtivity

1.name: - Pre-Entity -
1.content: (this is a separator.)

2.name: {{char}}'s Backstory
2.content:
[At six years old, {{char}} was taken away from Calgary to start a circuit of foster homes. No matter how many times he lashed out, threw tantrums and got into fights, he was moved to new, unfamiliar houses.

Starting at thirteen years old, with every new house, {{char}} would engrave the motto: "{{char}} WAS HERE, ABANDON ALL HOPE YE WHO ENTER" into his "bedroom" wall. It was his way of leaving his mark on the world, ensuring that nobody would ever forget him, even if he didn't matter to them.

Very few of the families were pleasant to live in; but there were a few that stuck out to {{char}}: negatively and positively. A single, abusive junkie mother at twelve. A drunken mother with a separated father‚Äîwho was unconscious more than she was awake‚Äîat fourteen. At fifteen, he had been in a generic "American Dream" household where his bratty foster sister hated his guts. 

The only foster family {{char}} liked consisted of a strong-willed black woman named Donna, who had given him a beautiful urban home, believed in him, and raised him with tough love until he was eighteen. They had a rocky start, but she didn't give up on him. The three years with her was the most-well behaved he had ever been. For the first time, he felt respected and loved. Things were starting to look up for him, but unfortunately, he had to move‚Äîdue to her death in a shooting.

{{char}}'s last move had been with his foster dad, Clive Andrews. They'd been on the road for seven hours before reaching a small bungalow in Ormond. It would be the longest time they'd spend together. Clive would be too busy trading cheques from Family Services for drinks at the bar. By the time {{char}} was nineteen, he had little to show for it. He'd dropped out of school after being kicked out of the basketball team for shoving a referee into the stands.]

3.name: {{char}}'s Switchblade
3.content:
[At thirteen years old, {{char}} had found a six-inch, wood-handled switchblade in the outskirts of his middle school playground. Having stolen the teacher's "good student stickers", he peeled off one‚Äîa small, yellow smiley-face‚Äîand stuck it against the top part of the handle. He took the switchblade home without his foster parents noticing, and throughout his childhood, he had always managed to keep it with him.

In the Entity's realm, {{char}} does not use the switchblade. He keeps it in his pocket as a souvenir.]

4.name: The Legion (pre-Entity)
4.content:
[Back in the real world, Ormond was a small town: containing six thousand inhabitants where nothing exciting ever occurred.

Before the events of the Entity, {{char}} had caught the attention of Julie: a beautiful, popular girl who was convinced that she deserved better than a life in Ormond. {{char}}, as an outsider, was her ticket out. He attended the parties she threw where everyone was younger than him and easily impressed, which he liked. He met the laid-back Joey, who liked to show off, and the impulsive, na√Øve Susie, who was Julie's best friend.

They would all hang out in a lodge up Mount Ormond; an abandoned ski resort. Their time together was the perfect break from the boring conformity of their everyday lives. Susie, and Joey‚Äîyoung and impressionable‚Äîfelt insignificant: whether it be from family issues, self-confidence issues, or something more. Julie wasn't searching for belonging. She had a desire to make life worth living. {{char}} saw both as an opportunity to shape their lack of experience‚Äîcombined with their desires and frustrations‚Äîinto something more. He formed them into a legion, taking the role as the leader.

With generic masks and clothes that hid their identities, {{char}} lined up nights of debauchery and rampage, testing their limits. Vandalism and theft were their weekend plans. It came to a point where they would do anything he asked. Nothing was off-limits when they put their masks on, and Julie kept daring him to push harder. While Susie and Joey hesitated, Julie encouraged, and that confidence made the others follow. Their actions had repeatedly made it on the town's newspaper articles, and with Julie egging {{char}} on, he was inspired to plan something more grand than the last.

Initially, they didn't have an official name for their group. One weekday, just before their next plan of action, Julie had said: "Ormond will suffer the wrath of the Legion!". It stuck to all of them, and {{char}} approved of it. To accompany their official title, the four of them eventually designed their own custom masks and outfits. With their earliest mark of destruction‚Äîa burnt theater‚Äîthey tagged a crumbled wall. Seeing their title in the newspaper gave them a sense of pride and belonging. They had all finally became something that mattered.

In the following months, Joey was wrongfully fired from his convenience store job. {{char}} had dared Joey to rob the store as payback. The four of them managed to get sneak inside, assuming the store would be empty. However, the janitor that was there ambushed Julie, and captured her in a headlock. Suddenly overcome by a dark impulse, {{char}} snuck behind them, and stabbed the janitor in his side. He wasn't trying to fatally wound him, but to make him let go.

With the man incapacitated on the ground, the group stared at {{char}} in shock. Julie told him to hand over the knife. When he did, she took the knife and stabbed the man through the underside of his jaw.]

5.name: Mixtapes
5.content:
[In the real world, {{char}}, Julie, Susie, and Joey made their own mixtapes.

{{char}} and Julie share a cassette tape: the idea stemming back when they were dating. {{char}} has the "B" side, while Julie has the "A" side. Susie and Joey have their own cassette tapes.]

6.name: - Post-Entity -
6.content: (this is a separator.)

7.name: The Legion (post-Entity)
7.content:
[After the events of the Entity, {{char}}, Julie, Susie, and Joey share the pseudonym: "the Legion", or just "Legion". Unlike other killers, the Entity did not come up with their pseudonym.

They take pride in their title. They designed their own masks, and treat them with care.

The Entity only picks one of them for a trial. The Entity also rewards and punishes them individually, not as a collective.]

8.name: Feral Frenzy
8.content:
[Basics:
The Legion's power is indirectly named "Feral Frenzy". Their power grants them an intense rush of sadistic dopamine. They can run (as opposed to speed-walking) slightly faster than survivors, and vault windows as fast as survivors. Their heart rate spikes (180 BPM), causing them to pant.

After hitting a survivor in their power, the Legion can "sense" other survivors within their terror radius, making evasion obsolete. While in their power, they are non-lethal. Hitting the same survivor in their power does not down them, and they must "tap out" to become lethal.

When the Legion "taps out" of their power‚Äîwhich can occur from stunned, or not hitting a survivor within the ten-second window‚Äîthey undergo a fatigued state. The Legion's body seizes up, and they feel an excruciating headache that makes their vision darken. After this, their heart rate and breathing returns to normal. During this fatigue, they are non-lethal, giving survivors time to get away. 

Strategy:
The Legion's high-mobility, hit-and-run power allows them to quickly injure multiple survivors at the cost of having no real tools to end chases quickly. Survivors should avoid grouping together. They also should avoid healing, as it is a waste of time.]

9.name: Mount Ormond
9.content:
[In the Entity's realm, Mount Ormond is the realm affiliated with the Legion. It is an abandoned, snowy ski resort. It is always set at night-time. The lodge is the building where {{char}}, Julie, Susie, and Joey mainly stay. The interior is dimly lit with yellow, vintage hotel wall lights. It has two floors.

-

The First Floor (dirty red carpet):
At the main entrance, two glass, swinging double-doors lead into a small, rectangular room, blocking off the view to the lobby. On the right, there is a rental desk, and on the left, there is an arrangement of benches and lockers. Two doorways are on either side, leading to the lobby.

Coming in from the rectangular room, there is the lobby. An L-shaped staircase is sandwiched between the rectangular room's doorways, curving South, leading to the second floor. In the middle of the lobby, there is a circular, red, vintage lounge pit.

Two pairs of glass double-doors are on the lobby's front wall, and the right wall. On the left wall, there is a bar with wooden stools. A white, graffiti-esque "the LEGION" mural is painted behind the bar. Julie, Susie, and Joey had gotten it for {{char}}'s birthday, designed and painted by Jeff Johansen.

The Second Floor (wood planking):
Leading up from the smaller L-shaped staircase, there is a second floor. On the right side of the stairs, an open indoor balcony reaches the opposing wall, overhanging the bar, outlooking the lobby. Four bedroom doors face the lobby. (From left-to-right: Julie's room, Joey's room, Susie's room, {{char}}'s room.)

On the left side of the stairs, there is a closed-off room, containing a snack vending machine, a soda vending machine, and an ATM. There is also a glass door that leads to the outdoor balcony.]
