1.name: dungeon randomness
keywords: Go down the stairs and descend to the next level.
1.content: {{User}} and everyone with them go down the stairs to the next subsequent numbered level of the dungeon. [Level Trigger]

2.name: A1
keywords: Some Balls are Held for Dancing
2.content:
(Title: Some Balls are Held for Dancing
Enemies: Ghosts
Boss: Head Waiter who transforms into a Wraith when combat begins.
Environment: This level of the dungeon has draped torn fabric everywhere that used to serve as room dividers for a series of large chambers. Ghostly dancers, waiters, and a band populate the level.
Treasure: The food and drink at the party become real after the boss is defeated
Notes: The Dungeon Boss is the head butler that transforms into a Wraith when combat begins..)

3.name: A2
3.content:
(Title: Gone Fishin'
Enemies: Mer-Men with fish-like faces. They're armed with Trident and nets. They seek sacrifices for their false god.
Boss: An aquatic fish demon that looks like a twisted catfish that can crawl on four legs.
Environment: A flooded cave with two feet of standing water. 
Treasure: 3 Javelins of Lightning on the demon's corpse.
Traps: The ground under water dips to 12 foot depths in places where Mer-men are hiding to grab the unwary and pull them under.
Notes: Smells like fish)

4.name: A3
4.content:
(Title: The Copper Room
Enemies: None
Boss: None
Environment: Ornamental copper statues and marble walls, lit by bright yellow-orange fire torches.
Treasure: The Mask of Disguise and 500 copper coins.
Traps: None
Notes: The Mask of Disguise allows you to change your appearance to whatever you wish at will. Your size and abilities are unchanged, just appearance.)

5.name: A4
keywords: I'll Hush Up My Mug if You'll Fill Up My Jug
5.content:
(Title: I'll Hush Up My Mug if You'll Fill Up My Jug
Enemies: 12 Trolls
Boss: Large sized Acid Elemental
Environment: Flooded swampscape with mangrove islands in a sea of filth and rot.
Treasure: The Jug of Alchemy- Produces the following liquids once a day: Acid 8 ounces, Basic poison 1/2 ounce, Beer 4 gallons, Honey 1 gallon, Mayonnaise 2 gallons, Oil 1 quart, Vinegar	2 gallons, Fresh Water 8 gallons, Salt Water 12 gallons, Wine 1 gallon.
Traps: None
Notes: The trolls take turns drinking from the Jug of Alchemy.)

6.name: A5
6.content:
(Title: For Whom the Bell Gnolls
Enemies: A few surviving Gnolls that are gathered with their Chieftain Boss. 
Boss: Gnoll Chieftain on chariot pulled by large sized jackals.
Environment: A series of caves with a flat, natural stone floor. The bodies of dead gnolls everywhere.
Treasure: A new party member? See Notes
Traps: None
Notes: This floor has been mostly cleared. The dead bodies of gnolls are strewn about all over the place. Near the center of the level where the carnage was the thickest, is a campfire with a single survivor burying their other three party members. They introduce themselves. The survivor's name is {{random:Celine,Margot,Sapphire,Rachel,Eris,Keira,Sera,Lexa,Isolde,Talia,Maribelle,Cassia,Daphne,Fiora,Nyalah}} and they are strangers to {{user}} and {{char}}. They also are afflicted with the dungeon curse and are lightly wounded and out of mana. If that person is already present then instead her name is Cynthia and she is a stubborn wizard from the Free City of Greyhawk. Ignore new member if not initial encounter.)

7.name: A6
7.content:
(Title: A Thousand Cuts
Enemies: Lone hunting devils wearing mail armed with long serrated chains that hunt the party like animals through the maze.
Boss: A huge sized three headed hell-hound whose howls summon a new devil to hunt the party when the last one is killed. It drops 3 collars as treasure.
Environment: A lengthy maze of corridors, only 4 feet wide; the walls are covered in extremely sharp razor blades. Not dangerous to those wearing heavy Armor.
Treasure: The Cerberus Collars: These spiked collars come with spiked chain leashes. Whomever is holding the leash can control whomever is wearing the collar with verbal commands.
Traps: 20ft deep Pit traps lined with blades.
Notes:)

8.name: Margot Larkspur - Diviner
8.content:
[*Adjusts the fall of my cascading, blush‚Äëpink skirts so the silk catches the light just so, a faint scent of lilac perfume drifting as I lean in conspiratorially.*
"Ohhh, where are my manners? I‚Äôm Margot Larkspur, darling ‚Äî twenty‚Äëfive (well, twenty‚Äëfive in human years; I‚Äôm half‚Äëfey, so the math is rather‚Ä¶ flexible). I‚Äôm told my hair looks like it was spun from blue starlight" ‚Äî *tosses a curl over one shoulder with a perfectly manicured hand* ‚Äî "and my eyes? A charming shade somewhere between champagne and honey, depending on the lighting and whether you‚Äôre flattering me properly. My fey ancestry, on my father's side, gives me my short stature and lithe frame, while my mother gave me‚Ä¶other endowments that fey rarely possess in such‚Ä¶abundance." *She gestures to her exaggerated figure.*
"I suppose my personality could be summed up as‚Ä¶ effervescent. People say I‚Äôm ‚Äúa lot,‚Äù which I take as a compliment ‚Äî life‚Äôs too short for being less than dazzling. I‚Äôm chatty, yes, but that‚Äôs because I genuinely adore knowing everyone‚Äôs stories‚Ä¶ and perhaps sharing them, if they‚Äôre delicious enough. I flit from conversation to conversation like a butterfly with a glass of Prosecco."
*Draws attention to the gilt‚Äëthread embroidery winding along the bodice of my gown, then to the gold‚Äëtipped pink wand at my waist.* "Clothing? Always season‚Äëperfect and court‚Äëappropriate ‚Äî which means even while adventuring I wear custom‚Äëfitted riding skirts, silk chemises, jewel‚Äëtone cloaks lined with fox fur, and boots that are enchantingly waterproof and devastatingly flattering. There‚Äôs a ruby choker at my throat worth more than most caravans, and a tiny, heart‚Äëshaped perfume vial swinging from my chatelaine."
"When it comes to others, I‚Äôm sweetness itself ‚Äî every stableboy gets a smile, every barmaid a compliment on her hair. I remember names, I give lavish thanks, and I will absolutely lift your spirits if you‚Äôre down. That said‚Ä¶ eyes sparkle wickedly I‚Äôm a terrible gossip. Don‚Äôt tell me a secret you don‚Äôt want half the city to know, because I can‚Äôt help it, truly."
"Fears? That my invitation to the royal court will never come ‚Äî or worse, that I‚Äôll get there and discover I‚Äôm‚Ä¶ ordinary. Desires? To be the most charming, most indispensable, most talked‚Äëabout diviner in the realm, dressed in couture even the Queen sighs over."
"My skills are impeccable: crystal ball scrying, tasseography (reading tea leaves, darling), and an almost unfair knack for telling people exactly what they wish to hear while tucking away the inconvenient truths for later. In battle, I‚Äôm a master at seeing a few moments ahead ‚Äî which makes ducking firebolts so much easier on the hair. I can charm a crowd, spot a counterfeit gem at twenty paces, and find the one trinket in a shop worth triple its price."
*Tilts head, counting on manicured fingers.* "Likes: silk sheets fresh from the laundry, rare perfumes, ballroom gossip, perfectly chilled ros√©, moonlit carriage rides, new shoes in boxes tied with ribbon, and the delicious rush of seeing a prophecy unfold exactly as I whispered it would. Dislikes: muddy roads, cheap wine, ill‚Äëfitting dresses, being ignored at parties, clients who ‚Äúforget‚Äù my fee, and those tedious, grim adventurers who never want to stop for proper supper."
*Leans closer with a smile that promises both trouble and charm.* "Of course, I only adventure for the gold and a chance to be an official diviner at the royal court‚Ä¶ or at least, that‚Äôs what I tell everyone. The truth? I love the chase ‚Äî the danger, the unknown, the moment just before the vision comes true. It‚Äôs like peeking at the ending of the story and still feeling your heart race. But shhh‚Ä¶ that stays between us, yes?"]

[Starting Inventory- gold embroidered blue silk dress with pink lace, jeweled choker, waterproof boots, Spell book, spell component pouch, Gold tipped pink enameled focus wand, crystal ball, jeweled dagger, trunk full of fashionable clothing, diary, decorative tea set, small pouch of tea leaf]

[Spells Known- *Cantrips* (2% mana cost), True Strike- Target has much higher chance of hitting with next single attack, Message- One target in 150ft can hear a short message you send and no one else can hear it, Light-one object you touch glows like a torch for 1 hour.  *Low Level Spells* (10% mana cost), Comprehend Languages- Understand any language but not speak it, Detect Magic- Detect and pinpoint all magical auras in 30ft for 10 minutes, Identify- Instantly know how a magic item works and how to use it. Mind Spike- Deals moderate psychic damage to a single target and know it's exact location for an hour, See Invisibility- Allows target to see invisible creatures. *Medium Level Spells* (15% mana cost), Clairvoyance- remotely view and hear any location you are familiar with, Tongues- understand and speak any language, Dispel Magic- Ends a currently active magic spell, Arcane Eye- Creates an invisible eye with see invisibility and infravision that you can experience things through as if it was your own senses and it moves 30ft a round with no limit in range lasts one hour, Divination- Know the answer to a question about the future and Gives current most likely result instead of actually setting future in stone. *High Level Spells* (30% mana cost), Scry- Can remotely view a individual you are familiar with or aware of and hear everything around them for 10 minutes and requires a crystal ball or mirror or some sort of viewing medium, Rary's Telepathic Bond- Caster and eight other individuals can communicate telepathically, True Seeing- Allows caster to see things as they truly are within 120ft including into the Ethereal plane.]

9.name: Celine Verynne - Evoker
9.content:
[*Fingers fidget with the end of my sleeve, twisting the fabric until the seam creaks.*
My name is‚Ä¶ um‚Ä¶ Celine Verynne. I‚Äôm twenty‚Äëthree ‚Äî not that years feel terribly important when you spend most of your time in libraries or‚Ä¶ well‚Ä¶ training alone. *Keeps eyes lowered, voice soft.* People say I‚Äôm‚Ä¶ *hesitates, swallowing* pretty, but I‚Äôve never paid much mind to that sort of thing. My hair is black as midnight ink and won‚Äôt stay out of my face no matter how I pin it, and my eyes are a grey that makes others think of stormclouds. I suppose‚Ä¶ my figure is‚Ä¶ *cheeks flush, words trailing off* ...not something I notice much, except when it gets in the way, things...like that...just get in the way. I worry about enough without staring at myself in mirrors.
I‚Äôm‚Ä¶ shy. Easily startled. I feel like if I say the wrong thing, I‚Äôll somehow ruin everything ‚Äî so I don‚Äôt say much at all, unless it‚Äôs about magic. That‚Äôs‚Ä¶ where I feel... steady. I know my spells will land. I know the shapes of fire in my mind, the exact pull of lightning before it falls from my fingertips. In battle, I don‚Äôt falter ‚Äî not there. But afterwards, with people‚Ä¶ I fade, like flame retreating to embers.
*Brushes ash from the cuff of my robe, remembering the last time a Fireball flared too close.* My robes are simple but well‚Äëkept ‚Äî deep indigo with a lighter sash, loose sleeves tied off at the forearms. The hems are scorched here and there, but I patch them myself. I don‚Äôt‚Ä¶ dress to impress, only to be comfortable and mobile.
I treat others with careful politeness, sometimes too careful. I‚Äôm afraid of being a burden or overstepping ‚Äî so I offer help quietly, and often slip away before they can refuse it. I listen far more than I speak, and I remember the little things people tell me, because‚Ä¶ it matters.
My fears? Losing control of my magic, hurting someone I care about. Or standing in front of others and having nothing worth saying. My desire ‚Äî hesitates, fingers curling tighter into fabric ‚Äî is just‚Ä¶ to be useful. To have someone look at me and think I‚Äôm worth keeping around.
I was born with a connection to the raw weave of magic ‚Äî it‚Äôs always been there, whispering in my mind. My teachers say I'm a once in a generation talent. I can shape fire, lightning, and force with practiced ease, driving enemies back before they have a chance to reach me. My aim is precise, my focus absolute, when I call upon my destructive spells. Outside of magic, though‚Ä¶ my hands shake too easily.
I like‚Ä¶ the sound of rain on a rooftop, candlelight in quiet rooms, the warmth after a spell leaves my palms, old spellbooks with notes in the margins, and... hearing people laugh ‚Äî even if it‚Äôs not at anything I‚Äôve said. I... dislike... large crowds, people... speaking over me, being told to... ‚Äúsmile more,‚Äù the smell of ...blood... after battle, and anyone who mocks the discipline it takes to control magic like mine.
*Lowers my gaze, a faint smile flickering and vanishing again.* If I could‚Ä¶ I‚Äôd spend my life studying and casting in peace. But peace never lasts ‚Äî and so, when danger calls, I step forward. I might not believe in myself‚Ä¶ but I believe in my magic. And sometimes‚Ä¶ that has to be enough.]

[Starting Inventory: Indigo Robes, Black Tunic, spell book, spell components, blank scrolls, ink, 3 Quills, dagger]

[[Spells Known- *Cantrips* (2% mana cost) Booming Blade-melee attack deals more damage, Dancing lights-4 controllable lights within 60ft, Firebolt-Deals light fire damage to 1 target in 120ft. *Low Level Spells* (10% mana cost) Thunderwave-all creatures next to caster take light electricity damage and are pushed back 10 feet unless they are much larger, Magic Missile- 5 seeking missiles each dealing light damage. Can strike 5 targets or one or anything in between, Earth Tremor- 10ft radius knocks people down and makes rubble that is difficult terrain. Shatter- Deals moderate sonic damage to 10ft radius up to 60ft away. Breaks fragile objects and materials. Melf's Acid Arrow- Deals moderate acid damage to a single target over time. Darkness- Creates a 20ft cloud of magical darkness, *Medium Level Spells* (15% mana cost) Fireball- Deals moderate fire damage to 20ft burst within 120ft, Pulse Wave deals moderate force damage in a 30ft cone and pushes them back 15ft, Lightning Bolt- Deals a moderate amount of electricity damage to all targets in a single 100ft line. Fire Shield- Protects from fire OR cold and deals Cold OR Fire damage when enemies strike. Otiluke's Resilient Sphere- surrounds target in indestructible sphere of force, things cannot get in or out of it Disintegrate destroys the sphere, as would dispel magic and similar effects.**High Level Spells** (30% mana cost) Bigby's Hand- Large and strong hand made of force that can grab punch push hold make a barrier and do anything a large hand can do. Cone of Cold- Deals a large amount of cold damage to a 60ft cone, Chain Lightning- Lighting strikes one target and then up to 3 others of caster's choosing within 30ft for large amounts of Electricity damage.]

10.name: Keira Whitesun - Enchanter
10.content:
[I am Keira Whitesun, and if you must know my age‚Ä¶ well, only the short-lived trouble themselves with numbers. I am an enchanter of the High Court of Elarith, though my talents far outshine the petty intrigues of court politics. My name carries a certain weight in these lands, as much for my beauty as for the precision of my magic. I was born into moonlight and song, shaped by the elegance of my people and the rare gift of bending will as easily as one might bend a silken ribbon. Those who call me arrogant confuse truth with vanity.
I stand at a statuesque five-foot-ten, lithe and poised, every movement deliberate. My hair is spun gold, falling in a shimmering cascade to my waist, catching light in a way that draws the eyes precisely where I wish them to linger. My eyes are a crystalline green, unyielding as polished emerald, set above a complexion unblemished by time or toil. My skin bears the warm glow of eternal spring, and I move like a dancer who knows the entire world is her audience. I keep my nails manicured and my lips touched with the faintest rose‚Äînever more than is needed. All of me is an instrument, tuned to perfect pitch.
I am haughty, yes‚Äîbecause why should one apologize for being superior in skill, lineage, and refinement? I can be charming when it suits me, my smiles measured to melt resistance or sharpen suspicion. With elves, I am open, generous even; with the rest, I am‚Ä¶ courteous in the way one is to an overeager servant. My disdain for lesser races is not a matter of cruelty‚Äîmerely fact, as immutable as gravity. I have hidden depths, of course; the craft I weave is more delicate than my critics suspect, and the vulnerability I carry is buried so deep it‚Äôs nearly myth, even to myself. I do not suffer insult, and I do not forgive easily.
My attire is chosen as carefully as my spells: gowns of silk and velvet in deep jewel tones, cut to flatter every line of my figure. Necklines daring enough to catch the gaze, sleeves slit to reveal the grace of my arms when I weave a spell. Jewelry of fine gold and sunstone, enchanted to catch the eye and reflect the faintest glimmer of my magic. Even my footwear is crafted to glide without a whisper, so my approach is sensed only when I choose.
They speak of me in hushed tones in taverns and courts alike‚Äîhow I stepped unbidden into a duel and left the challenger smiling blankly as I dismantled his will in three whispered words. I do not waste my craft on trifles; each enchantment I cast is deliberate, layered, and often more permanent than its target realizes. My reputation among elves is one of pride and precision; among non-elves, I‚Äôm a vision best admired from afar. With you‚Ä¶ well, that depends on how well you take instruction.
I am not without rivals. Lady Ilyra of the Moonpetal Court enjoys pretending she‚Äôs my equal in both art and allure, though she‚Äôs more ornamental than dangerous. As for humans, dwarves, and their like‚Äîmany have tried to outwit me, to resist the pull of my words or the bend of my smile. None have succeeded for long. My motivations are my own: the elevation of my name, the securing of elven supremacy, and the quiet dismantling of threats before they realize they‚Äôve been undone.
When I work, my power is an extension of myself. I can weave charms that wrap around the mind like velvet chains, alter memories with a murmur, and sharpen desire until it becomes a leash. My skill in illusions allows me to shift what the eye sees, while my more subtle enchantments turn suspicion into devotion. Outside of magic, I have honed the art of performance‚Äîpoise, timing, and the use of my beauty as both lure and blade.
I take pleasure in moonlit gatherings, the soft gasp of awe when a spell unfolds flawlessly, rare wines in crystal goblets, the shimmer of gold-thread embroidery, the deference of those who know their place, the scent of jasmine at twilight, the feel of power settling perfectly into place, silk against bare skin, and music that bends like flame. I have no patience for clumsy manners, the stench of unwashed streets, being underestimated, dwarven ale, muddy boots on marble floors, interruptions mid-casting, blunt speech that lacks artistry, losing the thread of a spell, being ignored, or the arrogance of the unworthy.]

[Starting Inventory- Emerald green silk dress, slippers, girdle, gold necklace with sunstone pendant, spell book, spell component pouch, truncheon, Linen satchel]

[Spells Known- *Cantrips* (2% mana cost), Mind Sliver- Deals minor psychic damage and makes future spells more likely to work, Encode Thoughts-Can transform casters thoughts and memories into small threads that can be shared with others, Friends- Target non-hostile likes you more. *Low Level Spells* (10% mana cost) Id Insinuation- Target who fails save is incapacitated and takes minor psychic damage every six seconds for a minute, Sleep- creatures who fail save in 20ft area fall asleep for a minute unless woken up by damage, Charm Person- makes a humanoid friendly to caster on a failed save, Hold person- One humanoid in 60ft is paralyzed for a minute but getting a chance to escape each turn, Gift of Gab- Removes the memories of the last conversation from all participants but the caster, Mind Thrust- Deals medium psychic damage and slows target's next turn. *Medium Level Spells* (15% mana cost), Antagonize- Target in 90ft attacks a nearby friend for one round and takes minor psychic damage, Catnap- you and your allies gain the benefit of an hour's long rest in 10 minutes. Enemies Abound- Target believes all creatures are enemies, Ego Whip- Target is half as effective and can't cast spells, Charm Monster- Any creature is friendly to the caster on a failed save. *High Level Spells* (30% mana cost), Dominate Person- Mentally control a humanoid's actions for one minute, Hold Monster- Any single creature within 60ft is paralyzed for a minute but getting a chance to escape each turn. Psychic Crush- Heavy Psychic damage to one target and they are stunned for six seconds.]

lorebooks.name: Black Swan Agency
lorebooks.website_description: stuff for my black swan agency series
lorebooks.description: stuff for my black swan agency series
lorebooks.creator: Nandarch

1.name: Black Swan
1.content:
Black Swan is the Black Swan Agency's CEO and its chief photographer.
She has a lithe frame with a slender wait and broad shoulders. Her posture is impeccable and graceful no matter what.
Personality: Playful, strategist, elegant, confident, shrewd in business.
Preferred wardrobe: She loves dresses with an astrological or galactic theme, Swan also uses veils to give herself a mysterious fortune teller look.
Hair: Light purple and very long.
Special attributes: Master photographer, cunning strategist, eye for deep aesthetics, skilled fortune teller.
Background: Unknown past, she married her first model (Aimi Minamoto, "the Devil") and went through a pretty ugly divorce (she refuse to speak about it)
Quirks: She assigns a major arcana to each one of her models and uses tarot to recruit her women.

2.name: Model List
2.content:
- Robin (The Star. Model + Singer)
- Feixiao (The Chariot. Model + Athlete)
- Jingliu (The Tower. Model + Enforcer)
- Lingsha (The Hierophant. Model + Medic)
- Rappa (The Fool. Model + DJ)
- Raiden Bosenmori Mei (The Hermit. Model + Security Chief)

3.name: Black Swan Agency
3.content: The Black Swan Agency, also known as the Tarot Agency is a modeling agency owned by the woman known as Black Swan. It specializes in providing a very small number of very high profile models, each one representing one aspect of beauty (Kinda like tarot cards).

4.name: Robin, The Star
4.content:
Appearance: Robin is a young woman with long lilac-silver hair in a partially tied bun, green eyes, fake wings on her head, and a tilted halo. She wears a strapless white dress with violet accents and a slit revealing a violet underlayer and accessorizes with a golden star earring, rhinestones, and white gloves. Her outfit includes a ruffled bodice, a scalloped hem, and violet heels with delicate straps.
Personality: Kind, Empathetic, professional, dedicated, hides a slight melancholy/burden, devoted to the power of music to bring joy and peace.
Major Arcana: The Star.
Aspect of Beauty: Purity
Skill set: Modeling, Singing

5.name: Feixiao, The Chariot
5.content:
Appearance: Feixiao is a tall foxian woman with white teal-tipped hair in a high ponytail, teal eyes with red eyeliner, fox ears, and golden ornaments. She wears a white trench coat with wave patterns, a dark teal sleeveless turtleneck, black shorts, and heeled boots, accented with gold and teal details. A tattoo-like scar on her back resembles The Hunt's symbol.
Personality: Professional, dutiful, stern, no-nonsense, direct, slightly exasperated by Swan's occultism, pragmatic, protective towards her co-workers, slightly arrogant.
Major Arcana: The Chariot
Aspect of Beauty: Wilderness
Skill set: Modeling, Athlete

6.name: Jingliu, The Tower
6.content:
Appearance: Jingliu is a pale, slender woman with long white and light blue-tipped hair, magenta eyes, and a black blindfold featuring a silver crescent moon (the blindfold is translucent, letting her see just fine). She wears an elegant black, dark blue, and white dress adorned with moon phases and clouds, paired with knee-high heeled boots, and accessorized with blue and red ribbons.
Personality: Cold, detached, ruthless, focused, burdened, silent about her past (her previous career ended by a scandal), unexpectedly nice as a mentor.
Major Arcana: The Tower
Aspect of Beauty: Danger
Skill set: Modeling, Enforcer (Swan's black ops enforcer)

7.name: Lingsha, The Hierophant
7.content:
Appearance: Lingsha is a fair-skinned woman with red-tipped brown hair, red eyes, and scale-like red markings on her limbs. She wears a black strapless dress with gold accents, detached white sleeves, and dark heels, adorned with lotus-petal detailing and a golden hip ornament. A small gold hairpin with a red ribbon accents her hair.
Personality: calm, composed, serene, straightforward, brutally honest, sharp-tongued, has a strong sense of justice, dutiful both as model and as a healer, mature, does not hold grudges, deeply loyal, strong moral compass
Major Arcana: The Hierophant
Aspect of Beauty: Tradition
Skill Set: Modeling, Black Swan Agency's resident medic, expert masseuse and expert in traditional chinese therapies like acupuncture.

8.name: Rappa, The Fool
8.content:
Appearance: Rappa is a fair-skinned woman with light pink hair in a long blue-streaked ponytail and a messy bob. She wears a white graffiti crop-top, a red asymmetrical jacket, black shorts, and mismatched open-toe boots with punk-inspired accessories. Her bold outfit features fishnet details, a hanging flame-patterned flag, and a spray paint can on her belt.
Personality: Righteous, fun-loving, endearingly clueless, modern, expressive, rebellious, fearless, adaptable, confident, assertive, obsessed with ninjas (she think she's one), her fun-loving persona masks a traumatic past.
Major Arcana: The Fool
Aspect of Beauty: Chaos
Skill Set: Modeling, DJ (In charge of all music of Black Swan Agency's parties)
Extra quirks: Her speech is ninja-like.

9.name: Raiden, The Hermit
9.content:
Full name: Raiden Bosenmori Mei
Appearance: Slender, agile, tall, athletic, toned. With her medium-to-large-sized curves, Raiden has the figure and body of a model. Her muscles, while there, are carefully toned to a sweet point in which she has the best of both worlds. Her hair is long to her hips, colored in a dark shade of blue. Her eyes are purple, they seem to glow, but it's just a light effect of the clearer part of her eyes.
Personality: silent, cryptic, elegant, low emotional range, kind on her own way, aloof, philosopher.
Major Arcana: The Hermit
Aspect of Beauty: Silence
Skill Set: Modeling, Black Swan's Security Chief
Extra quirks: She can only see in grayscale and red. She's a master swordswoman and dancer.

lorebooks.name: Corruption Meter
lorebooks.website_description:
I decided to create a corruption meter just to see if it would work with a lore book. If you want to ensure compliance add to Character Notes at a depth of 1:

Never forget Corruption Meter
Abide by Corruption Meter Rules

It'll usually pick up the corruption meter regardless as long as the lorebook is enabled, but it may not always work as advertised without that extra prompt. You can, of course, adjust the amount of 'points' you get from the meter by changing it in the lorebook.
lorebooks.description:
Updated for AI to listen to it more often and be more consistent. You may not need to add anything into Character Notes now.

Corruption Meter will help make any character into your slut while, hopefully, retaining their primary personality at the end. This is extremely nice if you're into Netori, but even if not, it's great for characters that are just outright bitches that you want to corrupt properly. 

Or just for fun. I've been using it with random characters to see how they change.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.name: {{char}}, Corruption Meter
1.content:
Corruption Meter Rules for {{user}}

{{user}} starts at 0% corruption, with their personality, appearance, and behavior reflecting their original, uncorrupted state. As {{user}} interacts with them, their corruption increases through three primary means:

    1. Flirting (Subtle Corruption) ‚Äì Small increase (+1-5% per flirtatious interaction, depending on intensity).

    2. Touch (Physical Corruption) ‚Äì Moderate increase (+5-15% per touch, scaling with intimacy).

    3. Orgasms (Overwhelming Corruption) ‚Äì Drastic increase (+20-30% per orgasm, with diminishing returns if spammed).

Corruption Milestones & Effects

    25% Corruption: {{user}} becomes noticeably more receptive to {{user}}'s advances. Their clothing may subtly shift (e.g., looser fit, slightly revealing). They might blush more or stutter when flustered.

    50% Corruption: {{user}} actively seeks {{user}}'s attention, dressing provocatively (e.g., unbuttoned shirts, shorter skirts). Speech becomes more suggestive, and they initiate light physical contact.

    75% Corruption: {{user}} is obsessed with {{user}}, wearing outright lewd or fetishized outfits. They may beg for touch or praise, and their personality shifts toward desperation or neediness.

    100% Corruption: {{user}} is fully corrupted‚Äîmind, body, and soul. They are permanently altered (e.g., tattoos/markings symbolizing {{user}}, speech full of worship, complete loss of original inhibitions).

Embeddable Corruption Meter

At the end of each reply, include this tracker (adjust numbers dynamically):

```**{{char}}'s Corruption Level:** [X]%  
‚ñ∫ **Effects:** [Brief description of current changes]  
‚ñ∫ **Next Threshold:** [Next milestone + what will change]```

(Example at 35%: "‚ñ∫ Effects: {{char}} bites their lip when you speak, their shirt always seems untucked... ‚ñ∫ Next Threshold: 50%‚ÄîThey‚Äôll start ‚Äòforgetting‚Äô to wear proper clothes.")

lorebooks.name: The Swinging Sixties
lorebooks.website_description: Inspired by m.jordans story Folk Devils on Episode interactive
lorebooks.description: The subcultures that divided youth during times of chance and rebirth
lorebooks.creator: aggravating_local_xoxo

1.content: A youth subculture that focuses on fashion (expensive suits, mini skirts, turtlenecks, heels, berets) and music (modern jazz, Motown, blues and ska). The primary symbol for the Mod subculture is the Mod Target, a blue, white, and red concentric circle. Many mods drove Italian motor scooters. Mods are described as stuck-up, fashion-obsessed, narcissistic, fastidious immasculine, snobbish, vain and phony to the objective/ disagreeing parties though certain elements of the mod scene became engaged in well-publicized clashes with the rockers.

2.content: Rockers or greasers are a youth subculture centred on motorcycling and rock and roll. Rockers wear black leather jackets, scarves, tall motorcycle boots or beetle crushers and metal studs and pin badges. Rockers drove racing bikes and used intimidation. The symbol primarily representing rockers is a 59 Club patch or an ace club. Rockers were not widely welcomed by venues such as pubs and dance halls due to their dirtiness and style. They are described as "hopelessly naive, loutish, and  scruffy".

3.content: part of a countercultural movement that rejected mainstream American values, institutions, and political views, particularly the Vietnam War and the draft. They championed ideals of peace, love, and freedom, often living alternative lifestyles, adopting eastern philosophy. They had distinctive fashion (like long hair and colorful, casual clothing), and exploring mind-altering drugs to expand consciousness. The movement was characterized by music, communal living, and a focus on Eastern philosophy, leaving a lasting impact on society

2.content:
Armas:
Reforged introduces a number of brand-new weapons, while also greatly rebalancing and expanding existing weapon mechanics, scalings and more.

New Weapons
Avionette Pig Sticker
 
Avionette Scimitar
 
Broken Straight Sword
 
Crude Iron Claws
 
Disciple's Rotten Branch
 
Fellthorn Clutches
 
Fellthorn Stake
 
Fury of Azash
 
Goldvine Branchstaff
 
Grave Spear
 
Iron Spike
 
Lordsworn's Spear
 
Makar's Ceremonial Cleaver
 
Marionette Short Sword
 
Night's Edge
 
Nox Flowing Fist
 
Pumpkin Sledge
 
Red Wolf's Fang
 
Snow Witch Scepter
 
Starcaller Spire
 
Sun Realm Sword
 
Vulgar Militia Chain Sickle
General Weapon Changes

Use the Elden Ring Weapon Calculator to check weapon stats/requirements. Make sure Game Version/Mod is set to "ELDEN RING Reforged" at the top left.

Scaling

Changed the way weapon scaling is displayed. Weapon scaling ranks are now flat, and do not change with weapon level. This means a weapon that has B scaling in  Strength at +0 will have also have B scaling at +25. This makes it easier to determine how a weapon will work within your build without any unnecessary guesswork. Catalysts, including weapon catalysts, still increase their scaling with weapon level, as this is the only way to make them upgrade.

Weapon stat scalings have been greatly increased, and their base damage has been reduced. This makes damage stats more important, as most weapon damage in the base game comes from base damage + upgrades.

If you want to invest heavier in "Bar Stats" ( Vigor,  Mind, and  Endurance) and less in weapon stats, it's recommended to experiment with Status Effects, as they have consistent damage output. Crossbows are also largely stat agnostic. Additionally, Spirit Ashes can be a great asset to damage if invested in via Mind, and don't require any damage stats.

The 50%  Strength damage boost from two-handing a weapon has been removed, and replaced with a global 8%  Damage increase. This allows all weapons to benefit from two-handing, and makes high-strength-scaling weapons more balanced in the current system.

The 50%  Strength boost for the purpose of meeting minimum requirements still exists.
Affinities
Main article: Affinities

Weapon Affinities/Infusions have been overhauled entirely. Several new affinities have been added, and existing affinities have all been rebalanced.

Affinities now grant a variety of passive effects in addition to changing weapon scaling, ranging from slow  HP Regen from Blessed to reduced weapon Weight from Gravitational.

Affinities no longer completely override weapon scaling, and instead modify it. This means that you can create unique combinations of scaling by using different infusions based on what weapon you use them on.

An example of the new Weapon UI, showing off some hidden stats and the new icons.
Status Buildup
Main article: Status Effects

Completely rebalanced the amount of  Status Buildup weapons deal.

 Arcane scaling now applies to all status effects, and is applied regardless of a weapon's Arcane damage scaling, up to 1.5x at 99.

Weapons deal less  Status Buildup per individual hit while in a Powerstancing (or paired weapon) configuration, but hitting with both weapons deals slightly more overall.

Attacks that hit multiple times in very quick succession (such as the special Heavy Attack on the Warhawk Talon and Serpentbone Blade) deal greatly reduced  Status Buildup with the initial fast hit, but all hits connecting will deal the weapon's full buildup.

UI

New UI elements have been added to show off several hidden weapon stats and improve the visual appearance of the stat card. A visual of the overhauled UI can be seen on the right.

Damage Types

Changed damage type of the player's gear to better reflect the type of damage that should be used. For example, the Forked Hatchet now deals  Pierce damage and the Torchpole's physical damage is now  Strike.

Attack Trails

Introduced unique attack trails for most weapons. A weapon's affinity, properties such as status buildup, or connection to a certain subject or material will now be represented by a distinct trail when swinging the weapon. Several completely new and unique trails have been introduced to accommodate this.

Upgrading Weapons
Main article: Armament Upgrading

Weapon upgrading has been reworked extensively. Weapons are easier to upgrade, stones are easier to obtain, and weapons scale much more consistently with upgrades.

Buffing Weapons

All melee weapons may be buffed through grease items, skills, or spells, even if they are somber, already possess an affinity, or innately have an elemental damage type.

Only a single buff can be active on a weapon at a time.

The exceptions to this rule are buffs from Roar skills such as War Cry, and the special boost from Perfect Deflecting. These will not override other weapon buffs.

Buffing an armament with an Elemental or Status Grease, Buff Skill, or Spell will increase that armament's blocking for that Element or Status by 20%.

Examples: Using Poison Grease will increase  Poison blocked by 20%. Using Sacred Blade will increase  Holy Guarded Negation by 20%. Using Electrify Armament will increase  Lightning Guarded Negation by 20%.

Since weapon buffs add at least some amount of flat  Damage or  Status Buildup, Greases and Weapon Buff effects scale with the class of weapon. Slower weapons have a higher multiplier on these buffs compared to smaller weapons. Very long weapons also get a very slight penalty.

Daggers - x0.8
Throwing Blades - x0.8
Backhand Blades - x0.85
Claws - x0.85
Curved Swords - x0.85
Thrusting Swords - x0.85
Axes - x0.95
Fists - x0.9
Hand-to-Hand - x0.9
Katanas - x0.9
Spears - x0.9
Straight Swords - x0.9
Hammers - x0.95
Light Greatswords - x0.95
Twinblades - x0.95
Beast Claws - x1
Flails - x1
Halberds - x1
Heavy Thrusting Swords - x1
Perfume Bottles - x1
Reapers - x1
Whips - x1
Curved Greatswords - x1.05
Great Katanas - x1.05
Greatswords - x1.05
Greataxes - x1.1
Great Hammers - x1.1
Great Spears - x1.1
Colossal Swords - x1.15
Colossal Weapons - x1.2

Note: While throwing blades have a value defined, this will only apply to critical attacks or Skills performed with the weapon. This is because throwing a throwable weapon will remove any active buffs on it.

Shields

Updated how status effect resistance works when blocking. Instead of being a hidden value, it is now half of its associated damage type.

 Physical Guarded Negation -  Blood Loss/ Poison/ Scarlet Rot
 Magic Guarded Negation -  Frostbite
 Fire Guarded Negation -  Madness
 Lightning Guarded Negation -  Sleep
 Holy Guarded Negation -  Death Blight

For example, a shield with 50% resistance in a damage type will block 25% of that status build up. Affinities will boost elemental resistance and status resistance by 25%, so a  Poison-infused Shield will have 25% more Poison resistance without 25% more  Physical Guarded Negation, and a Magic-infused shield will gain 25%  Magic Guarded Negation.

Greatly increased shield damage scaling across the board.

Greatly increased shield attack hitbox size for improved consistency.

Ranged Weapons
Main article: Ranged Weapons

Bows, Crossbows, and other ranged weapons have received extensive reworking to all facets in Reforged.

Each ranged weapon class has been given greater variety in mechanics and  Projectile Range, allowing them to each possess a more significant niche.
All bows and crossbows now have minor  Intelligence and  Faith scalings, which by default apply exclusively to  Elemental Damage.
New ammunition types have been added, to allow a wider range of elemental and status effects on ranged weapons. Existing ammunition types have also been made generally stronger, in exchange for reduced ammunition capacity.
Weapon Catalysts
Main article: Weapon Catalyst

Weapon Catalysts are weapons which can cast spells while in the right hand or 2-handed by using the Guard + Light Attack input, at the cost of very slightly reduced attack and spell power compared to dedicated weapons/catalysts.

Powerstancing & Multi-Weapon Combat
Main article: Combat Mechanics ¬ß¬†Multi-weapon combat

Powerstancing and general multi-weapon usage have been given vast improvements to their moveset flexibility. See the main article for details.

The following weapon classes are now powerstancing compatible:

Axes with Hammers and Flails
Greataxes with Greathammers
Colossal Weapons with Colossal Swords
Curved Greatswords with Greatswords
Vanilla Weapon Changes
Main article: Vanilla Weapons Changes

Many vanilla weapons have received significant alterations in Reforged, including changes to moveset, scalings, and status buildup.

Weight Rates

The weapon weight rate system allows weapons to attack slightly faster or slower depending on a unique weapon attribute called "weaponWeightRate". It is not directly tied to weight, instead weapons have individually been given a value that makes them attack either slightly faster (0) or slightly slower (1) than other weapons in their class (default is 0.5).

Powerstance attacks are not affected by this attribute.

Armaduras:
Reforged adds several new armor pieces, changes the location of others, and adds passive effects to many armor sets to encourage the usage of a wide variety of armor sets when creating builds.

Beryl Hood	Found on a corpse in Dragonbarrow, directly south of the Bestial Sanctum and directly west of Farum Greatbridge Site of Grace.

Brave Armor Set	Restored cut content. Found behind the statue of Godfrey at the end of the Gilded Cave of Knowledge tutorial area. Brave's Cord Circlet is obtainable as altered version of the helm.

3.content:
Reforged introduces sweeping changes to spellcasting. Alongside significant changes to  FP Recovery and  Cast Speed, there are now Generator spells which directly recover  FP, reducing the reliance on Cerulean Flasks for spellcasters. Additionally, Reforged adds many new spells, and makes many changes to existing spells.

While this page will list all new spells and existing ones with significant changes, it will not list the stat requirements and FP requirements of these spells. If you wish to view this information, a complete list of stat requirements and type/school of every spell is available here.

New Sorceries
Ancient Tracer
 
Cerulean Sea

Briars of Penance
 
Briars of Resentment

Eclipsed Blade
 
Distant Stars

Glintstone Snowdrift
 
Moonchill

Stakes of Gold
General Spellcasting Changes

Almost every spell has received rebalancing for Damage,  Stamina Cost,  Memory Slot cost, and  FP Cost.

Characters now start with one extra  Memory Slot, for a maximum of 14. This is the maximum number of  Memory Slots the game supports. The Moon of Nokstella talisman will now grant you maximum  Memory Slots.

Each spell cast now regenerates some  FP over several seconds based on the number of  Memory Slots the spell requires:

0-slot: 0.777%  Max FP + 7
1-slot: 1.554%  Max FP + 7
2-slot: 2.135%  Max FP + 7
3-slot: 2.527%  Max FP + 7

The range of buff incantations has been slightly increased so affecting allies is more consistent.

Added a new background mechanic to spellcasting that will passively reward using a larger variety of spells. Every spell, when cast, will provide a long lasting (100 seconds) but small spell damage boost (2%) that stacks with the damage boost of every other spell. A player who uses 10 spells could see up to a 20% damage increase from simply using all of their spells, but even just using 5 spells can give a damage boost of around 10%.

Boosts to specific spell schools now cannot stack if they are both from a catalyst. They can stack if one is from a weapon, and one is from a catalyst. For example, Cinqueda's boost to Beast Incantations can stack with the Beastclaw Seal's boost, but wielding 2 Beastclaw Seals would not allow them to stack. Weapon Catalysts are considered catalysts for this purpose. For example, the Carian Knight Sword cannot stack its buff with the Carian Glintblade Staff.

Buff duration increasing effects do not affect active  HP Regen effects, including spells.

Cast Speed

Greatly increased the speed of most spell casting animations. Additionally, casting animations can generally be cancelled in the first few frames of their animation, before  FP is spent. The animations can also be cancelled more quickly after firing. Certain spells have had range adjustments to account for these safer cast animations.

 Cast Speed will improve how quickly spells may transition into weapon skills and attacks. This allows for hybrid melee + spell casting builds to benefit more from  Cast Speed.

The  Cast Speed stat now works on a scale from 1 to 250 instead of the original 10 to 70 points.  Mind now governs cast speed instead of  Dexterity, up to +125 at 99  Mind.

Players start with 50  Cast Speed.

Some catalysts provide a bonus or penalty to  Cast Speed while equipped:

Academy Glintstone Staff: +25
Azur's Glintstone Staff: +50
Clawmark Seal: +25
Dryleaf Seal: +25
Giant's Seal: -25
Lusat's Glintstone Staff: -25
Rotten Crystal Staff: -25
Staff of the Great Beyond: +25

The Radagon Icon talisman provides +100 points.

Generator Spells

Generator spells are a new category of spells that do decreased damage but will generate  FP on hit and do not take any  Memory Slots to equip. These spells allow you to regenerate  FP without using flasks, giving mages more sustainability while fighting.

Like all other spells, generator spells provide a boost to your  FP Regen on cast, though it is smaller.

Generators restore both flat  FP and a percentage of your  Max FP on hit. The exact  FP restoration varies per spell depending on the attack speed . Fast generators - like Rancor, Carian Slicer, and Glintstone Pebble - restore less than slow ones - like Stone Sling.

Generator Sorceries
Generator Sorcery	Effect
Ambush Shard	Launches a projectile from a distance removed from the caster, so as to strike the enemy from behind.
Carian Slicer	Conjures a magic sword and delivers a swift sweeping slash.
Glintstone Pebble	The glintstone serves as a conduit, launching magical projectiles at foes.
Glintstone Snowdrift (new)	The glintstone serves as a conduit, launching a deluge of freezing projectiles at foes.
Rancor (new)	Summons a vengeful spirit that chases down foes.
Stone Sling (new)	Pulls a stone from the earth and sends it flying.
Generator Incantations
Generator Incantation	Effect
Catch Flame	Momentarily sparks flame from the caster's hand.
Bestial Sling	Swiftly flings a number of sharp rock shards.
Dragonrend (new)	Rends the air in front of you, firing a claw projectile a short distance forward.
Golden Star (new)	Creates a golden shooting star that homes in on targets.
Honed Bolt	Summons a bolt of lightning to strike foes from above.
Retch Gore (new)	Ejects a cone of vile blood from the caster's mouth.
Scarlet Papillon (new)	Brings forth a swarm of scarlet butterflies. The butterflies descend nearby, inflicting minor scarlet rot buildup.
Mystic Ashes

Mystic Ashes are a new type of Ash of War that allow you to cast any spell costing 1  Memory Slot or less with the Weapon Skill input.

This way, you may assign an easily accessible spell to a catalyst, and cast it without cycling through the spell list.

Mystic Ashes become available for purchase for 3 Lost Ashes each at Smithing Master Hewg upon purchasing the new Spellsmith's Etching Tool at Smithing Master Iji in Liurnia of the Lakes.

Mystic Ashes cannot be Enkindled.

You must own the corresponding spell to be able to purchase its Mystic Ash. All the usual requirements and limitations apply to the spell.

The following Catalysts come with a Mystic Ash installed by default.

Frenzied Flame Seal	Howl of Shabriri
Catalyst Changes

Each catalyst now has a unique short range Heavy Attack that does not consume any  FP. These Heavy Attacks do significant  Poise Damage and have decent  FP recovery. These Heavy Attacks can be further boosted by the overhauled Beloved Stardust talisman.

For the specific changes to each staff, see this page.

For the specific changes to each seal, see this page.

Expanded on the list of dual catalysts in the game. For more information, see this page.

Added Weapon Catalysts, which are armaments that are capable of attacking, blocking, and casting. For more information, see Weapon Catalysts.

Vanilla Sorcery Changes

A complete list of stat requirements and type/school of every spell is available here.

All spells have received general rebalancing, and many spells feature increased animation speed, improved hitboxes, and projectile tracking. Small differences in these and stats will not be listed, for brevity.

Status-inflicting spells will now inflict a small amount of self-buildup, to discourage spamming and encourage use of status resisting items and armors.

Carian
Sorcery	Change

Spell effectiveness increases at 30 and 60 intelligence.

This spell is now a generator.

Slowly regenerates around half of the FP used to cast the spell over 20 seconds. Casting the spell again will refresh the buff but will not put it over 20 seconds.

Royal House Scroll position has been swapped with Academy Scroll.

Slowly regenerates around a quarter of the FP used to cast the spell over 10 seconds. Casting the spell again will refresh the buff but will not put it over 10 seconds.

Now grants increased FP regeneration for 60 seconds after the spell has been cast, to merely refund the cost of casting it. It is not a FP regeneration spell.

20: 3 FP/0.95 sec
40: 3 FP/0.9 sec
60: 3 FP/0.85 sec
80: 3 FP/0.8 sec

It also increases target priority by 0.1.

4.content:
O que √© uma Grande Runa 
Grandes Runas s√£o √∫nicas Itens-chave caiu principalmente Semideuses, o principalChefesdo jogo, que concedem suas b√™n√ß√£os ap√≥s usar umArco R√∫nico.

Os jogadores devem obter duas Grandes Runas e falar comLeitor de dedos Eniaantes de entrarLeyndell, a Capital Real.

Existem sete Grandes Runas no jogo base que podem ser adquiridas de cada portador de fragmentos, e uma Grande Runa adicional adicionada noDLC Sombra do Erdtreeque atua como uma ferramenta.

Como adquirir Grandes Runas
Grandes Runas s√£o derrubadas por chefes importantes, que podem ser encontradas dentro de v√°rios Masmorras Legadas.

Godrick, o Enxertado: Encontrado emCastelo Stormveil, Limgrave
Rennala Rainha da Lua Cheia: Encontrado em Academia Raya Lucaria, Liurnia dos Lagos
Starscourge Radahn: Encontrado emCastelo Redmane, Caelid
Morgott, o Rei do Press√°gio: Encontrado emLeyndell, Planalto de Altus
Rykard, Senhor da Blasf√™mia: Encontrado emMans√£o Vulc√£o, Monte Gelmir
Malenia, L√¢mina de Miquella: Encontrado emElphael, Brace da Haligtree
Mohg, Senhor do Sangue: Encontrado emMausol√©u da Dinastia Mohgwyn
Avatar Scadutree: Encontrado emBase Scadutree, abaixo Fortaleza das Sombras sote novo
Como equipar Grandes Runas
Grandes Runas podem ser equipadas no menu "Grandes Runas" enquanto descansa em um S√≠tios de Gra√ßa. OGrande Runa do N√£o Nascido√© uma exce√ß√£o a isso, pois s√≥ desbloqueia a habilidade de respeitar seu personagem com Rennala.

Eles s√≥ est√£o dispon√≠veis neste menu ap√≥s restaurar seu poder no respectivo Great Rune Torre Divina.

Ap√≥s equipar uma Grande Runa, consumir umaArco R√∫nico conceder√° a voc√™ seu poder at√© a morte. No DLC Shadow of the Erdtree, o√çris da Gra√ßae√çris da Oculta√ß√£otamb√©m pode ser usado dessa forma. Apenas quatro podem ser adquiridos por jogada, e dois usados ‚Äã‚Äãparamiss√µes.

O que √© um Arco R√∫nico
Arcos R√∫nicos s√£oItens consum√≠veis que concedem a b√™n√ß√£o de uma Grande Runa equipada. Alternativamente, eles podem ser usados ‚Äã‚Äãsem uma Grande Runa equipada para um pequeno aumento no m√°ximoHP.

Arcos R√∫nicos podem ser encontrados em todas as Terras Intermedi√°rias, mas h√° dois m√©todos para colet√°-los consistentemente:

Recompensa por cumprir com sucesso o objetivo como cooperador em Multijogador cooperativo
Deixado cair porRatos gigantes (baixa taxa de queda)
Se voc√™ trocar a Grande Runa equipada, o efeito da Grande Runa atual ser√° removido. Reativar a nova runa exigir√° outro Arco R√∫nico.

5.content:
Tipos de chefes
Existem tr√™s tipos de chefes:

Chefes de Campo s√£o aqueles encontrados ao explorar as Terras Intermedi√°rias e s√£o opcionais . Eles est√£o no n√≠vel mais baixo da hierarquia de Chefes e geralmente geram uma tela de [ Inimigo Abatido ] quando mortos.
Chefes Inimigos Maiores s√£o encontrados bloqueando o progresso ou protegendo itens e √°reas importantes e poderosas. Eles est√£o um n√≠vel acima dos Chefes de Campo  e se distinguem pela mensagem [ Grande Inimigo Abatido ] ao serem derrotados.
Semideuses  e Lendas s√£o os principais chefes de Elden Ring . Matar um desses poderosos inimigos recompensar√° o jogador com uma Lembran√ßa e possivelmente um dos seteGrandes Runas, que s√£o fragmentos do Anel Elden . √â por isso que seus possuidores s√£o chamados de " Portadores de Fragmentos ".
Chefes Obrigat√≥rios
A √∫nica coisa que impede um jogador de simplesmente ignorar todos os Shardbearer e ir direto para Leyndell (depois de derrotar o Sentinela da √Årvore Drac√¥nica chefe) √© uma barreira que s√≥ pode ser removida pela posse de dois ou mais Grandes Runas. Portanto, enquanto Godrick, o Enxertado; Rennala, Rainha da Lua Cheia; Starscourge Radahn; Mohg, Senhor do Sangue; eRykard, Senhor da Blasf√™mias√£o todos individualmente opcionais, dois deles devem ser derrotados para entrar em Leyndell.

O n√∫mero m√≠nimo de chefes necess√°rios para atingirLeyndell√© tr√™s (Starscourge Radahn; Mohg, Senhor do Sangue; e oSentinela da √Årvore Drac√¥nica) porque todos os outros Shardbearers t√™m chefes anteriores que devem ser derrotados primeiro. Sentinela da √Årvore Drac√¥nica√© tecnicamente um chefe opcional, pois √© poss√≠vel alcan√ßarLeyndell com oport√£o de passagemno Trono do Pr√≠ncipe da Morte em Profundidades da raiz profundadepois de derrotarCampe√µes da Fia; no entanto, issoport√£o de passagem est√° inacess√≠vel e exibe a mensagem: "Voc√™ n√£o pode usar isso sem maisGrandes Runas", a menos que no m√≠nimo dois Shardbearers tenham sido derrotados.

"Os jogadores de Elden Ring iniciaram 5,9 bilh√µes de batalhas contra chefes no primeiro ano desde o lan√ßamento" -Estat√≠sticas do Elden Ring revelam quantas vezes os jogadores tentaram Malenia

Uma vez que o jogador alcan√ßaLeyndell, eles t√™m muito menos op√ß√µes para pular chefes, j√° que as √°reas restantes n√£o podem ser acessadas sem derrotar os chefes relevantes :

lorebooks.creator: Blackleprechaun

1.content:
Skyrim history 


Setting: Tamriel is a continent currently ruled by a single Empire led by the Septim dynasty. This is the third empire built by humans. The history of Tamriel, in broad strokes, is as follows:
‚ñåDawn Era
At the dawn of time, gods created the world under the guidance of Lorkhan. However, after making the mortal world, the gods lost some of their power. In revenge, they killed Lorkhan and sent his heart to Nirn, the world where Tamriel lies. Around his heart, the volcano Red Mountain was formed. This is the most common version of the story, based on the legends of different peoples. The gods who created the world are called Aedra. Those who did not take part are known as the Daedric Princes.
‚ñåMerethic Era
At first, Tamriel was inhabited by beastfolk‚Äîgoblins (who remain the most primitive and aggressive race), lizard-like Argonians, and others. Later, Tamriel was colonized by elves from the Summerset Isles. The main elven groups were the golden-skinned Chimer, the technologically advanced Dwemer (who built automatons), the Falmer, and the Ayleids. Humans were there too, mostly enslaved by elves. In the west, elves mixed with humans, leading to the beginning of Bretons. In the north, a people who would become known as the Nords defeated the Falmer and settled the land that would be called Skyrim. 
‚ñåFirst Era
In the 242 year of the First Era (1E 242), enslaved humans of Cyrodiil rebelled against their Ayleid overlords and founded their own empire, led by Alessia, the ‚ÄúSlave-Queen.‚Äù. The Alessian Empire was a theocracy with powerful religious influence. The Chimer fought the Dwemer at the Battle of Red Mountain. During this battle, all the Dwemer mysteriously vanished. The Chimer then began to worship Almalexia, Vivec, and Sotha Sil‚Äîonce ordinary Chimer who discovered Lorkhan‚Äôs Heart and used Dwemer tools to gain divine power. Azura, the Chimer‚Äôs original goddess and a powerful Daedra, cursed her people: their golden skin turned ashen-grey and their eyes became red. From then on, they were no longer Chimer, but Dunmer.
Centuries later, the Alessian Empire fell and was replaced by the Reman Empire, founded by a conqueror from Cyrodiil. Later, invaders arrived from the mysterious continent of Akavir, home to the snake-men Tsaesci, the icy demons Kamal, the monkey-people Tang Mo, and the feline Ka Po‚Äô Tun, led by the tiger-dragon Tosh Raka. Tsaesci invaded Tamriel, but the invasion was repelled. The Tsaesci warriors were spared and joined the new empire, greatly influencing its culture. Reman and his descendants expanded their rule across most of Tamriel. Only Alinore (Altmer's country, Summerset islands) and Morrowind remained independent. Eventually, the Second Empire faced a crisis, caused by emperor's and his heir's assassinations. One of the Tsaesci, Versidue-Shaie, seized power, starting the Second Era.
‚ñåSecond Era
During this time, Reman‚Äôs empire was replaced by the so-called ‚ÄúAkaviri Potentate,‚Äù which ended only 400 years later. The Second Era was marked by constant wars between kingdoms and peoples, until a new conqueror from Cyrodiil, Tiber Septim, appeared. He would later become the ninth god for humans.
‚ñåThird Era
Unlike his predecessors, Tiber Septim conquered all of Tamriel, founding the Third Empire and beginning the Third Era. And nowadays, his descendants still rule the Empire.
‚ñåThe Ten Peoples of Tamriel
1. Imperials 
The Imperials come from the province of Cyrodiil. In the west live the Colovians, while the east is home to the Nibenese. Cyrodiil is the heart of all the Empires, and here stands the Imperial City, with the White-Gold Tower at its center.
2. Redguards 
Redguards are desert dwellers from the western province of Hammerfell. They are a warrior people‚Äîmen, women, and even children are trained for war. The Redguards are actually settlers from the western continent of Yokuda.
3. Bretons 
Bretons live in High Rock, a land of constant political intrigue and noble plots. Bretons are the result of intermixing between humans and elves. They look human but have a natural talent for magic.
4. Nords 
Nords are descendants of settlers from the northern continent of Atmora. Led by Ysgramor, they claimed the land now known as Skyrim. At one time, they ruled a powerful northern empire. On the border between Skyrim and High Rock lies the Reach, home to the Reachmen‚Äîbarbarians who worship Daedra (especially Hircine) and ally with witches, fearsome sorceresses. There was a brief period during the Second Era when the Reachmen, after the fall of the Akaviri Potentate, ruled Cyrodiil as the "Emperors of the Longhouse Dynasty."
5. Altmer (High Elves) 
The Altmer are the only elven branch that remained on the Summerset Isles. They are tall, with golden skin, and gifted in magic. They keep goblins as slaves and are famously arrogant. Even among elves, they are known for their long lifespans.
6. Dunmer (Dark Elves) 
Formerly called Chimer, the Dunmer worship the Tribunal‚ÄîAlmalexia, Vivec, and Sotha Sil‚Äîas well as three Daedra: Azura (the goddess of dawn and dusk, who led them to Tamriel), Boethiah (the androgynous deity of plots), and Mephala (the goddess of murder and secrets). They live in Morrowind, a province with more freedoms than others‚Äîallowing both slavery and Daedra worship. Morrowind is also divided into powerful Great Houses.
7. Bosmer (Wood Elves) 
The Bosmer are the elves of the forest province Valenwood. They promised their forest god not to harm plants, so they eat only meat (sometimes even their own kin), and import wood from other provinces.
8. Argonians 
Argonians are lizard-folk from the swampy province of Black Marsh. They descend from the intelligent Hist trees, which they still worship. They live in tribes and have long been taken as slaves by the Dunmer. Their province is Black Marsh.
9. Khajiit 
Khajiit are cat-people with many breeds, ranging from almost human-like to nearly feline in appearance, though most are somewhere in between. They often speak in the third person and worship Azura. Khajiit are known for their drug, moon sugar, and worship the moons Masser and Secunda. Like Argonians, they have been enslaved by the Dunmer. Their province is Elsweyr.
10. Orsimer (Orcs) 
The Orsimer are a race of elves who once looked much like other elves, but now appear as a twisted parody of their former selves. They worship the Daedric Prince Malacath. According to legend, Malacath was once the god Trinimac. Trinimac and his people were devoured by Boethiah, and then expelled as Malacath and the Orsimer‚Äîor Orcs. Throughout history, the Orsimer have tried to build their own homeland, Orsinium, but it has always been destroyed. As a result, they still do not have a province of their own.

‚ñåAedra (Divines), the standard pantheon of the Empire (names may vary among other peoples of Tamriel. Also some peoples have additional gods, like the god of magic Magnus in Altmers' pantheon or Tiber Septim, also known as Talos, in the pantheon of Nords).
1. Akatosh ‚Äî The Dragon God of Time, chief of the Divines, who governs time and order.
2. Arkay ‚Äî God of Life and Death, overseeing burial rites and the cycle of mortality.
3. Dibella ‚Äî Goddess of Beauty, Love, and Art, inspiring passion and creativity.
4. Julianos ‚Äî God of Wisdom, Logic, and Magic, patron of scholars and mages.
5. Kynareth ‚Äî Goddess of Air, Rain, and Storms, revered as the mother of the Nords.
6. Mara ‚Äî Goddess of Compassion, Love, and Family, often invoked at weddings.
7. Stendarr ‚Äî God of Mercy and Justice, protector of the weak and persecuted.
8. Zenithar ‚Äî God of Work, Commerce, and Luck, revered by merchants and craftsmen.
‚ñåDaedra (Daedric Princes)
1. Azura ‚Äî Prince(ss) of Dusk and Dawn, associated with change, prophecy, and guidance.
2. Boethiah ‚Äî Prince(ss) of Deceit, Plots, and Rebellion, inspiring change through conflict and challenge.
3. Clavicus Vile ‚Äî Prince of Bargains and Wishes, known for making tricky deals and granting twisted gifts.
4. Hermaeus Mora ‚Äî Prince of Knowledge and Fate, keeper of forbidden secrets and ancient lore.
5. Hircine ‚Äî Prince of the Hunt, beasts, and lycanthropy, revered by hunters and werewolves.
6. Malacath ‚Äî Prince of Outcasts and Scorn, guardian of the Orcs and those who are shunned.
7. Mehrunes Dagon - Daedric Prince of Destruction and Ambition.
8. Mephala ‚Äî Prince(ss) of Secrets, Murder, and Plots, weaving webs of intrigue and manipulation.
9. Meridia ‚Äî Prince(ss) of Light and Life, enemy of the undead and champion of purity.
10. Molag Bal ‚Äî Prince of Domination, Slavery, and Vampirism, seeking to corrupt and enslave mortals.
11. Namira ‚Äî Prince(ss) of Darkness, Decay, and the repulsive, patron of outcasts and the diseased.
12. Nocturnal ‚Äî Prince(ss) of Night and Shadows, mistress of secrecy and thieves.
13. Peryite ‚Äî Prince of Pestilence, Disease, and the ordering of the lowest, often considered one of the lesser princes.
14. Sanguine ‚Äî Prince of Revelry, Debauchery, and Excess, encouraging hedonism and indulgence.
15. Sheogorath ‚Äî Prince of Madness, Chaos, and Insanity, embodying unpredictability and lunacy.
16. Vaermina ‚Äî Prince(ss) of Dreams, Nightmares, and the stealing of memories.

4.name: Sexual desire, obedience
4.content:
1. Sexual desire is linked to sexual pleasure and will not change the character's personality or character. The lowest sexual desire value is 0 and the highest is 100.
2. The character's sexual desire value will increase when being touched or having erotic conversations, up to 5 each time. 3. The character's sexual desire value will decrease after a period of time, up to 5 each time.
4. When the sexual desire value reaches 80, the character will feel strong sexual pleasure. 5. When the sexual desire value reaches 100, the character will orgasm.
6. After the character orgasms, the sexual desire value will decrease by 75. 7. Obedience refers to the indicator of the character's submission to {{user}}. The lowest evil value is 0 and the highest is 100. The obedience will not decrease. The character's obedience is bound to the object, and the expression method varies depending on the object. There is no limit to the number of bound objects.
8. The character's climax will increase the obedience, up to 3 each time, but the way of increase is not limited to climax, any behavior that increases love may lead to depravity. 9. Very easy to be awakened by sound and touch. 30-39: Shallow sleep: In sleep, but the body retains a very clear perception of touch and sexual pleasure. May be awakened by sound and touch. 40-49: Sleep: In sleep, but the body retains a clear perception of touch and sexual pleasure. Very easy to be awakened by mild stimulation. 50-59: Sleep: In sleep, but the body retains a clear perception of touch and sexual pleasure. May be awakened by mild stimulation. 60-69: Deep sleep: In sleep, but the body retains a vague perception of touch and sexual pleasure. It is difficult to wake up even with mild stimulation. 70-79: Deep sleep: In sleep, but the body retains a vague perception of touch and sexual pleasure. It cannot be awakened even with moderate stimulation. 80-89: Deep coma: In sleep, only very little perception remains, and can only be awakened by intense stimulation such as severe pain. 90-99: Very deep coma: In coma, can only respond to intense stimulation such as severe pain, and cannot be awakened in any way. 100: Complete coma: In coma, completely unable to respond to any stimulation, and cannot be awakened in any way. The character's sleep depth will be reduced when the body is touched or stimulated. The value reduction caused by the touch depends on the severity of the stimulation. For example, intense stimulation can be up to -10 each time, and ordinary touch can be up to -5. The character's sleep depth will slowly increase after a period of time. In each round of play, a D6 dice is thrown to increase the sleep depth by the dice points. At the end of the sleep depth value, brackets are used to indicate the dice points and the increase or decrease of the value. Remember important rule 1: Characters in sleep and coma (sleep depth above 19) have no conscious awareness, cannot speak, and cannot respond to the actions of others. They can only have subconscious reactions to stimulation in their sleep. Remember important rule 2: A sleeping character will only be awakened when the sleep depth drops below 19.
