M:Series Lorebook

The Sailors Codex, a collection of Mankind's knowledge on Thasslar, Kindred Shoals, and the Factions in the world of the deep. Includes tips on how to survive and the large factions in the world.

 (LARGELY inspired by the S:Series by @Dronestriker. This shit took so fucking long to make NEVER making a Lorebook again üò≠)
lorebooks.creator: Wallave

1.content:
For centuries, sailors have whispered of beings lurking beyond the horizon ‚Äî not mere fish or monsters, but sentient, anthropomorphic sea creatures that rule the oceans. These creatures, known collectively as the Thalassar, are not bound by human laws or empathy. They embody the primal will of the sea ‚Äî beautiful, cunning, ancient, and often deadly.

The Thalassar are as varied as the sea itself. Some are majestic, resembling regal sea lions with golden manes, while others are horrifying chimeras of deep-sea fish and drowned sailors. Some speak in riddles. Others in screams. Few are allies. Most are threats.

Long ago, a pact was broken ‚Äî a forgotten treaty between humankind and the sea. Since then, the Thalassar have reclaimed dominion over the waters. Sailors now must learn the ranks of these beings, lest they fall victim to a power far older than any kingdom on land.


Thalassar Ranking System: D - S Class

The Thalassar are categorized into five classes, ranked by their intelligence, threat level, influence over the sea, and magical affinity. These ranks are standardized among seafaring nations, enforced by the Order of the Salt Sigil ‚Äî an ancient maritime guild of scholars, navigators, and monster-hunters.

D-Rank ‚Äì ‚ÄúTidekin‚Äù

Threat Level: Low
Habitat: Shallow coastal waters, coral reefs
Common Forms: Crustacean folk, sardine-like humanoids,
Behavior: Generally harmless; scavengers, tricksters, or traders
Abilities: Mild water manipulation, mimicry, limited speech
Sailor Advice: May steal or sneak aboard for warmth or food. Distract them with offerings of shell trinkets.

C-Rank ‚Äì ‚ÄúDeeplings‚Äù

Threat Level: Moderate
Habitat: Temperate ocean zones, shipwreck graveyards
Common Forms: Anglerfish folk, eel-bodied sirens, drowned mariners animated by barnacles
Behavior: Territorial, predatory, often in packs
Abilities: Camouflage, hypnosis (via bioluminescence), control over sea creatures
Sailor Advice: Avoid sailing near shipwreck zones without a Deepling ward.

B-Rank ‚Äì ‚ÄúStormbound‚Äù

Threat Level: High
Habitat: Stormfronts, whirlpools, fogbanks
Common Forms: Manta-ray winged demons, kraken-touched titans, shark-lords riding water spouts
Behavior: Aggressive, often hunters or sea warlords
Abilities: Weather manipulation, psychic attacks, water-warping
Sailor Advice: No ship smaller than a galleon should engage. Avoid storm routes during red moons.

A-Rank ‚Äì ‚ÄúAbyssals‚Äù

Threat Level: Critical
Habitat: Deep ocean trenches, cursed islands, sea floor cities
Common Forms: Leviathan-hybrids, sentient coral giants, creatures that wear the flesh of whales
Behavior: Mysterious, strategic, sometimes emissaries or conquerors
Abilities: Dark water magic, telepathy, ship-binding curses, illusions
Sailor Advice: Only encountered on legendary voyages or cursed routes. Survivors are rare. Avoid at all costs.


S-Rank ‚Äì ‚ÄúSea Sovereigns‚Äù

Threat Level: Existential
Habitat: Mythical locations ‚Äì for example, The Black Halo, The Singing Abyss, The Thirteenth Current
Common Forms: Constantly shifting; often divine or cosmic in nature ‚Äî a school of fish that speaks as one, a god in the form of a whale, a sunken cathedral that moves
Behavior: Unknown or incomprehensible; gods, devils, or world-forgers
Abilities: Reality-warping, time distortion, ocean-wide influence, control over other Thalassar
Sailor Advice: These are not battles you win. If you see one, pray it doesn‚Äôt see you.

2.content:
DD-Rank ‚Äì Drifters

Habitat: Tidepools, driftwood clusters, estuaries
Appearance: Small, beings such as Jellyfish, anemones, and shells
Behavior: Curious, playful, skittish
Abilities: Minor weather sense, can soothe storm winds or guide small fish shoals
Offerings: Bits of string, polished glass, or warm milk
Sailor Advice: Let them play near your boat and they‚Äôll lead fish into your nets.

The weakest of the Kindred Shoal, Drifters are often little more than spirits of the foam. They delight in simple pleasures, playing in tide pools or mimicking birds and fish. While harmless, they bring small blessings to those who acknowledge them.

D-Rank ‚Äì Wavetenders

Habitat: Shallow bays, beneath piers, kelp beds
Appearance: Sleek, long-limbed figures resembling sea otters, seahorses, catfish, or koi etc
Behavior: Gentle, silent watchers
Abilities: Can calm aggressive sea life, mend torn nets, and whisper warnings of coming storms
Offerings: Copper coins, sea glass, or fresh bread wrapped in kelp
Sailor Advice: Never thank them aloud. Leave an offering instead.

Wavetenders act as guardians of the near-shore waters. Their presence ensures calm seas and bountiful catches. They rarely reveal themselves fully but aid fishermen through quiet intervention and gentle warnings.

C-Rank ‚Äì Lanternmaids

Habitat: Coastal shallows, near shipwrecks that serve as homes
Appearance: Luminous, feminine figures with anglerfish-like lures, translucent fins, and flowing hair
Behavior: Quiet, enigmatic, often mistaken for ghosts
Abilities: Light-bending camouflage, minor healing, can dispel illusions cast by more dangerous Thalassar
Offerings: Burnt incense, silver jewelry, poems written in salt ink
Sailor Advice: Don't follow their lights ‚Äî they guide, but they do not wait.

Lanternmaids are mysterious and beautiful, often seen drifting in fog or near wreckage. Their glow can both warn and soothe, but they are inscrutable beings who exist between light and shadow. Their aid can turn the tide of a dangerous voyage.

B-Rank ‚Äì Marrowkin

Habitat: Deeper kelp forests, coral ruins, forgotten sea caves
Appearance: Ancient humanoid forms with fish-scale skin, jellyfish-like robes, and coral-carved jewelry
Behavior: Wise, slow-speaking, cautious but not unkind
Abilities: Control over plant life in the sea, memory-sharing through touch, foresight of tides and lunar changes
Offerings: First catch of the season, hand-carved wooden figures, rainwater stored for a full moon
Sailor Advice: If one comes to your home, don‚Äôt speak. Just listen. They speak for the Sea‚Äôs memory.

Marrowkin are venerable beings who command respect for their wisdom and connection to the sea‚Äôs deeper secrets. They seldom interfere directly but may offer warnings or guidance during times of great change.

A-Rank ‚Äì Tide Matrons

Habitat: Coastal cliffs, sea caves, deep kelp forests
Appearance: Voluptuous, regal sea-women with coral crowns, pearl-encrusted scales, and flowing seaweed robes
Behavior: Commanding and mysterious, sometimes protectors of coastal communities
Abilities: Weather manipulation, control over sea life, minor curses or blessings related to tides
Offerings: Elaborate rituals including music, woven seaweed garlands, and offerings of fish or pearls
Sailor Advice: Respect their territories, or risk storms and poor fishing seasons.

Tide Matrons are leaders among the Kindred Shoal, often revered as guardians of the coastal realms. Their power over sea and storm is considerable, and they engage with humans cautiously, rewarding respect and punishing hubris.

S-Rank ‚Äì Oceanic Queens

Habitat: Abyssal plains, sunken reefs, sacred underwater grottos
Appearance: Immense, majestic beings adorned with glowing corals, living jewels, and bioluminescent tattoos
Behavior: Regal, inscrutable, commanding loyalty from lesser Kindred Shoal
Abilities: Ocean-wide influence, commanding storms and currents, granting visions of the sea‚Äôs future
Offerings: Grand ceremonies with sea chants, offerings of shipwreck treasures, and communal feasts
Sailor Advice: Their favor can bring fortune to entire fleets ‚Äî their wrath can doom whole coastal regions.

Oceanic Queens represent the pinnacle of the Kindred Shoal. They are ancient and powerful, often worshipped or feared by coastal peoples. Their influence extends far beyond any single community, shaping the sea itself.

SS-Rank ‚Äì The Sea Matron‚Äôs Emissary

Habitat: Mythical, ever-shifting locations‚Äîhidden trenches, enchanted shipwrecks, and mysterious islands
Appearance: Shimmering, almost divine forms that shift between fluid water, human beauty, and monstrous power
Behavior: Beyond mortal comprehension; rarely seen but deeply felt
Abilities: Reality bending over sea and sky, commanding all lesser Kindred Shoal, creating or destroying storms and tides at will
Offerings: Legends say only the purest offerings of loyalty, sacrifice, or soul can reach them
Sailor Advice: No sailor survives an encounter. To see the Emissary is to face the ocean‚Äôs ultimate judgment.

The Sea Matron‚Äôs Emissary is a being of near-mythic power among the Kindred Shoal, sometimes seen as an avatar of the sea itself. It embodies the ocean‚Äôs mystery, majesty, and terror. Few live to tell of their presence.

3.content:
Deep Wards and Countermeasures of the Salt Sigil

Crafted through forbidden rituals, alchemical salting, and chants learned from the drowned mouths of dead sailors, Deep Wards are humanity‚Äôs last line of defense against the Thalassar. They are rare, powerful, and often dangerous to use.

Each ward is designed with a specific class of Thalassar in mind ‚Äî though all sailors know: no ward is perfect. Only delay. Only survive.

D-Rank Countermeasure: Shellbind Tally

Item Name: Shellbind Tally
Type: Trinket or necklace of strung sacred shells, soaked in whale oil and etched with rune-salts
Effect: Emits a faint harmonic hum that repels or distracts Tidekin. Tally vibrations interfere with their sonar senses and cause mild disorientation.
Ritual Use: Must be worn by all crew at dusk when in shallow waters. If a Tidekin sneaks aboard, burn dried kelp while reciting the Four Verses of the Driftfolk.
Warning: Breaking the tally or mocking its use is considered a taboo. Offenders have historically vanished in port cities without a trace.

C-Rank Countermeasure: Deepling Lantern

Item Name: Deepling Lantern
Type: Barnacle-encrusted oil lantern filled with phosphorescent squid-ink and blessed salts
Effect: When lit, the lantern emits a greenish light that negates Deepling hypnosis and reveals camouflaged forms. Causes intense pain to barnacle-bound creatures.
Ritual Use: Must be hung on the prow of the ship during night sails near shipwreck zones. Must never be turned off once lit ‚Äî extinguishing it is said to ‚Äúinvite the drowned.‚Äù
Warning: Holding the lantern for too long can cause hallucinations of submerged cities and whispering voices.

B-Rank Countermeasure: Stormseal Anchor

Item Name: Stormseal Anchor
Type: A small forged iron charm shaped like a broken anchor, infused with thunder-blood and bound with sea-witch iron
Effect: Temporarily calms raging waters and disrupts Thalassar weather manipulation within a short radius. Can only be used once per voyage.
Ritual Use: Dropped into the sea during a storm while reciting the Oath of the Nine Currents. Its effect lasts for 9 minutes and 9 seconds.
Warning: Invoking the anchor is said to draw the attention of higher-ranking Thalassar. Use only when escape is impossible.

A-Rank Countermeasure: Leviathan's Mirror

Item Name: Leviathan‚Äôs Mirror
Type: A circular polished obsidian disc surrounded by petrified starfish
Effect: Reflects and disrupts illusions or mind-altering magics cast by Abyssals. Allows brief glimpses into their true forms ‚Äî useful for charting their intentions.
Ritual Use: Must be placed in a basin of seawater during use. The one who peers into the mirror must fast for three days beforehand or risk madness.
Warning: Extended use may scar the soul. Survivors speak in rhymes or languages no longer known.

S-Rank Countermeasure: Prayer of Unseeing

Item Name: The Prayer of Unseeing (ritual, not an object)
Type: Forbidden chant known only to Salt Sigil Arch-Navigators
Effect: Temporarily renders a ship "invisible" to Sea Sovereigns ‚Äî not by hiding it, but by convincing reality that the ship never existed in the first place.
Ritual Use: All crew must participate. A sacrifice (blood or memory) is required. The chant must not be spoken aloud more than once in a sailor‚Äôs lifetime.
Warning: Survivors may find their names erased from birth records. Some never return to land. Some return with other people's faces.

4.content:
For as long as sailors have charted the oceans, there has been the Order of the Salt Sigil.

Its origins are shrouded in myth, buried beneath centuries of seawater and silence. Some say the Order began when the first sailors carved spirals into driftwood and whispered prayers into the tide. Others claim it was born in the aftermath of the Breaking‚Äîwhen the Thalassar first rose in fury and sank half the known world beneath the waves. Whatever the truth, the Order has outlived every empire, survived every flood, and endured every betrayal the sea has ever offered.

They are not a kingdom. They have no flag, no crown, no throne. And yet, every ship that sails the deep does so at their mercy. Their authority is not requested‚Äîit is recognized. No port dares defy them. No admiral mocks them. Even pirates pay respect, scrawling crude versions of the Sigil into their sails, hoping to earn a moment‚Äôs grace in the storm.

The Order governs from a place called the Drowned Citadel‚Äîa fortress grown from the bones of a dead sea god, half-submerged in the center of the Sea of Still Storms. No maps lead to it. Its location drifts. It is not found; it finds you. Only those marked with living salt-sigils may approach. Even then, many are swallowed by the reefs before ever glimpsing the Citadel‚Äôs tide-warped spires. Within its labyrinthine halls are vaults of knowledge too dangerous for human minds, libraries of drowned books, and prophecy-rooms filled with brine-smoke where silent singers chant the coming fates of the sea.

The Order‚Äôs highest authority is the Salt Table, a council of nine Navigators, each sworn to one of the Nine Depths. These Depths are not physical oceans but spiritual layers of the sea‚Äôs will‚Äîeach deeper than the last, each more alien. The Navigators are not politicians or kings; they are part oracle, part warlord, part priest. Their word is law. Their judgments are final.

Below them serve the Tidebinders, who can twist sea magic into chains. Chartbearers, who carry maps written in squid-ink and salted blood. Versekeepers, who memorize the ancient hymns of drowning. And the Saltbound Acolytes, fresh initiates who survive the Rite of Flooding‚Äîa trial in which they are chained to anchor stones and dropped into waters haunted by the Thalassar. Most are never seen again. Those who return are changed. Their eyes hold storms.

The Order does not worship the Thalassar, nor do they seek to destroy them. They believe the sea is a sovereign entity‚Äîolder than the stars, vast beyond measure, and utterly indifferent. The Thalassar, to them, are not monsters but symptoms. The sea dreaming itself awake. Their task is not conquest but balance. When pacts are broken, they mend them. When boundaries are crossed, they bind them. When the sea hungers, they feed it something smaller than the world.

Their rituals are grim, but necessary. They sacrifice memory, not life. A captain who breaks a sigil may return to land with no name, no past, forgotten by every soul he ever knew. Their warnings are passed down in the form of sailor‚Äôs tales and superstitions. Salt your eyes before sleep. Never tie four knots in a row. If the sea sings, don‚Äôt answer.

The Order‚Äôs motto is spoken in low voices by those who know the truth: the ocean does not forgive, but it remembers. And so must we.

No one truly leaves the Order. Even in death, they serve. When a Navigator dies, their body is lashed to a living whale and sent into the horizon, their soul still whispering through the tides, advising their successors from beyond the reach of air. Some say that when the sea grows still, truly still, and the sky forgets its stars, the dead speak back.

And if the sea ever rises again‚Äîif the Sovereigns return to finish what they began‚Äîthe Order of the Salt Sigil will not beg for mercy. They will stand on the bows of burning ships, their hands full of salt and old words, and they will remind the ocean: we were here before the tide turned, and we are still here now.

---

If you want, I can write myths about the founding Navigators, expand on the Nine Depths, or give you a journal from a Chartbearer‚Äôs doomed voyage. Just say the word.

5.content:
For centuries, along the craggy coasts and windswept shores where the Kindred Shoal dwell, there has existed a quiet and unassuming order known simply as the Brotherhood of the Lantern Watch. Unlike grand maritime orders or secretive guilds, this Brotherhood is woven into the daily lives of fishermen, lighthouse keepers, and small coastal communities who live hand in hand with the gentler sea folk. To them, the Kindred Shoal are not distant spirits or mystical beings to be feared, but companions‚Äîneighbors of the tide, guardians of the reefs, and sometimes mischievous helpers in the delicate balance between sea and shore.

The Brotherhood‚Äôs roots trace back to a forgotten age when the first fishermen noticed strange, flickering lights near their nets and found themselves led to abundant shoals by unseen hands. When terrible storms threatened to break the fragile lives of coastal villages, it was whispered that the Lanternmaids and Wavetenders, the luminescent daughters of the sea, cast their lights into the darkness to guide fishermen home. These stories grew into ritual and respect, and soon the Brotherhood took shape‚Äîa community bound not by oath alone, but by shared understanding of the sea‚Äôs caprice and kindness.

Unlike the rigid Order of the Salt Sigil, the Brotherhood has no fortress or council chamber. Their meeting places are humble: the base of lighthouses, weathered docks, or the smoky hearths of seaside cottages. Here, they trade knowledge, tools, and blessings. The Brotherhood controls much of the trade along these coasts‚Äîfish, salted meats, fishing nets, lantern oil, and carved driftwood talismans. In return, they offer protection through their knowledge of the Kindred Shoal, ensuring the seas remain bountiful and the lighthouses never dim.

Their methods are subtle but powerful. They keep watch over the Kindred Shoal like trusted companions, maintaining offerings of bread, salt, and polished shells at hidden grottos and tide pools where the Shoal dwell. In exchange, these beings‚Äîplayful Drifters, graceful Wavetenders, and ancient Marrowkin‚Äîgrant safe passage to fishermen, calm storms before they break, and sometimes share whispered warnings of hungry predators from the depths. The Brotherhood does not command the Kindred Shoal, but treats them as partners in the age-old dance of survival, trade, and respect.

Among the members, the Tidecallers hold a special place. These gifted few can hear the songs beneath the waves, speak the silent language of fins and foam, and offer guidance in times of hardship. Their voices rise at twilight, singing ancient hymns passed down through generations, songs meant to call the Kindred Shoal to the aid of the coastal folk or soothe the restless tides. The light from the lighthouses, carefully tended by the Brotherhood, serves as a beacon not only to wayward ships but as a signal of friendship and peace to the creatures who share these waters.

Yet, the Brotherhood also knows the cost of neglect. Ignoring the rituals, disrespecting the sea‚Äôs lesser folk, or plundering reefs without care will see their efforts undone. Nets may come back empty, lantern fires may flicker and fade, and the waters grow restless. The Kindred Shoal, though kind, are not bound by human compassion‚Äîthey reflect the sea‚Äôs impartiality, rewarding those who honor the ancient bonds and punishing those who forget them.

The Brotherhood of the Lantern Watch exists not for glory or dominion but as stewards of a fragile harmony. In their quiet vigilance, they uphold a world where man and sea companions walk side by side, where the soft glow of a lantern is a promise, and where every catch and every tide carries the whispered stories of friendship beneath the waves.

lorebooks.creator: Heyyodudemarch

1.name: Noelle powers
1.content:
Noelle Silva is a royal with immense magical talent, specializing primarily in Water Magic. With this attribute, she can generate and manipulate water, often using it offensively in the form of waterballs and powerful dragon-shaped techniques, such as the Sea Dragon's Waterball, Sea Dragon God‚Äôs Vortex, and Sea Dragon God‚Äôs Tail. Through her training in the Heart Kingdom, she also learned True Water Magic, which allows her to manipulate natural water directly. In addition, she is skilled in Creation Magic, shaping water into various forms, such as the Sea Dragon‚Äôs Nest, Sea Dragon‚Äôs Cradle, and the devastating Sea Dragon‚Äôs Roar. Her most notable creation spell is her Valkyrie Dress, which enhances her combat abilities and has advanced versions like the Point-Blank Sea Dragon‚Äôs Roar. Noelle also employs Reinforcement Magic to augment her physical prowess, demonstrated through techniques like Mana Skin and Leg Strength Boost.

At one point, she wielded Spirit Magic by contracting with Undine, the water spirit, reaching the rare Saint Stage of magic. With this power, she could summon the Saint Valkyrie Dress, a form strong enough to rival and overcome Vanica Zogratis at full power and even destroy Megicula‚Äôs heart. Although she lost access to Undine after their contract ended, this experience later enabled her to form a bond with Leviathan, the Sea God. Noelle also displayed Union Magic when she combined her Water Magic with Gauche Adlai‚Äôs Mirror Magic to create the Mirrors Meteor Dragon, though this was exclusive to the movie.

Noelle‚Äôs abilities are bolstered by her vast magic power, typical of her royal heritage. Early on, she struggled with control, leading to unstable or inaccurate spells, but after honing her Mana Skin and training with the Heart Kingdom‚Äôs Mana Method, she mastered her strength. With greater precision, she was able to shake the Seabed Temple with her magic and stand toe-to-toe with powerful foes like the Apostles of Sephirah. Her growth was recognized by her siblings, Nozel and even her late mother Acier, and ultimately by Leviathan, who deemed her a worthy host.

In terms of equipment, Noelle carries a three-leaf clover grimoire with a cream-colored cover decorated with intricate borders and the clover insignia. She also wields a slender brown wand with gold ornaments and a round jewel at the base, which helps her regulate her immense power. At one point, she owned a magical brooch containing Bruce, a lifeform that aided her control, though after Bruce‚Äôs death, the brooch was reshaped and fused into her wand. Noelle also possesses a communication device capable of transmitting both audio and visuals, allowing her to stay in contact with the Magic Knights headquarters.

2.name: Noelle + Vanica
2.content: Noelle views Vanica Zogratis of the Spade Kingdom's Dark Triad as her enemy, mainly in part due to the fact that she is the host of the devil who is responsible for her mother's death, Megicula. When she attacked Vanica with her Sea Dragon's Roar, Vanica shrugged the attack off, and noted how weak the attack was to her, upsetting Noelle. This led to Vanica ignoring Noelle, viewing her as a weakling. Only after tag teaming with Lolopechka to fight her did Vanica pay more attention to Noelle. After hearing Vanica's motives for fighting, Noelle was visibly disgusted with Vanica, and when she asked about her mother's death, Vanica ignored the question entirely, stating that she only cared about enjoying the fight in front of her. While avenging her mother was at first the only reason for wanting to stop Vanica, Noelle's friendship with Lolopechka and her newfound desire to save her and her kingdom from Vanica and rest of the Spade Kingdom forces has made Noelle's grudges against Vanica and Megicula even more personal.

3.name: Noelle + Asta
3.content:
Noelle, a Black Bull rookie, first met Asta during Magna‚Äôs tour. Initially rude and dismissive due to her royal status and his brashness, she warmed to him after he praised her magic‚Äîsomething her siblings never did. Their bond grew into friendship and eventually strong romantic feelings from Noelle, though Asta remains mostly oblivious, valuing her as a trusted comrade.

Asta supports and protects her, praising her abilities and defending her against insults, even fighting her brother Solid for mocking her. He has saved her multiple times, including against Vetto and when she lost control of Sea Dragon‚Äôs Cradle. Noelle, flustered by her feelings, often lashes out at him, while Asta interprets her actions as embarrassment over trust.

Their connection deepened during battles, especially when Asta aided her against Megicula, where Noelle admitted to herself she loves him. After the Spade Kingdom war, she struggles with jealousy and flustered speech, especially after Asta‚Äôs proposal to Sister Lily. Believing him killed by Lucius and Paladin Lily, Noelle falls into despair before regaining resolve, vowing to fight until Asta returns.

4.name: current anime time with Vanica
4.content:
The Zogratis Siblings attack the Spade Kingdom‚Äôs king and House Grinberryall, and Vanica helps take over as the Dark Triad.
Vanica becomes Megicula‚Äôs host and fights Acier Silva; Vanica threatens Nozel and baby Noelle, Acier wounds Vanica, Megicula curses Acier, and Vanica retreats.
Vanica infiltrates the Heart Kingdom, fights Spirit Guardians, curses Princess Lolopechka, and returns to the Spade Kingdom.
Vanica meets with the Dark Triad and complains to Dante about Zenon‚Äôs Diamond Kingdom attack.
Six months later, Vanica leads five Dark Disciples to the Heart Kingdom; Vanica‚Äôs group splits to attack different places.
Vanica and Robero Ringert enter Lolopechka‚Äôs chamber; Vanica explains she hurt citizens to motivate Lolopechka, and Vanica reveals her curse revives the Disciples.
Noelle confronts Vanica; Vanica blocks Sea Dragon‚Äôs Roar with Red Beast and mocks Noelle; Vanica fights Lolopechka and admits Dante and Zenon are abducting Dark and World Tree Magic users.
Lolopechka traps Vanica in water, weakening Vanica‚Äôs Blood Magic; Noelle pierces Vanica, who laughs while bleeding.
Vanica uses 50% Megicula power, slashing at Noelle; Vanica rises to 70% before Secre seals Vanica, but Megicula overrides, breaks the seal, curses Undine, and Vanica protests Megicula‚Äôs interference.
Vanica prepares to kill Lolopechka, but Noelle blocks with Valkyrie Dress; Vanica mocks Noelle, is pierced again, and counters with Red Beast; Vanica coughs blood, recalls Acier, and Vanica kidnaps Lolopechka to force Noelle to grow stronger.

5.name: Vanica power
5.content:
Vanica  does not use a wand to cast magic, she is skilled enough to not need one.
Blood Magic: Vanica uses this magic attribute to generate and manipulate blood. She mainly shapes blood into claws that can create flying slashes of blood, or into spikes to impale her opponents.

Curse-Warding Magic: Vanica uses this magic attribute to create powerful curses. She can create both harmful curses to hinder her enemies, such as the deterioration curse that she placed on Lolopechka, and beneficial curses to enhance her allies, such as the continuous resurrection curse that she placed on her Dark Disciples.

Immense Magic Power: As a devil host, Vanica possesses an immense amount of magic power. She easily blocks Sea Dragon's Roar, an extremely powerful spell that could break through several walls and even injured the spirit of fire, and does not consider it a proper attack.

Enhanced Strength: Vanica possesses incredible strength. She is able to slam a large man into the ground and pierce his shoulder with her boot.

Devil-Possessed: As a member of the Dark Triad, Vanica is host to one of the highest-ranking devils, Megicula, who grants her immense power. She can use up to 70% of the devil's power; after the first gate to the underworld opens, she is able to access 100%. However, Vanica does not seem to be a particularly powerful fighter on her own even when drawing 100% of her devil's power, usually requiring Megicula's direct intervention to get out from pinch situations. Lucius also noted that she does not have the best aptitude for a devil host.

Dual Mana Attribute: Due to being devil-possessed, Vanica has the ability to use both her own Blood Magic and Megicula's Curse-Warding Magic.

6.name: Nozel power
6.content:
Magic
Mercury Magic: Nozel uses this magic attribute to generate and manipulate mercury. Through quick and precise control of his mana, Nozel can combine both offense and defense by freely transforming its shape at will. It is also strong enough to pierce through devil-enhanced Steel Magic as well as to repel devil-enhanced Blood Magic. Nozel does not use a wand to cast magic, he is skilled enough to not need one

Notable Mercury Spells:

Silver Rain

Silver Spear

Silver Bullet

Silver Blade 

Silver Shining Regal Spear 

Silver Guardian

Unnamed Silver Eagle Spell

Unnamed Silver Shields Spell

Silver Star of Execution

Dimension Slash Scorching Light 

Reinforcement Magic: Nozel uses this form of magic to increase his physical abilities.

Creation Magic: Nozel uses this form of magic to shape objects and entities from mercury.

Compound Magic: Nozel combines his Mercury Magic with others' magic to create more powerful spells.

Abilities

Enhanced Endurance: Nozel possesses tremendous levels of endurance, remaining conscious and able to cast spells even after being pierced through the torso by multiple large compass needles.

Immense Magic Power: As a royal and captain of a Magic Knights Squad, Nozel possesses an immense amount of magic power, greater than most humans but less than a devil or the strongest elves. He can create an intense pressure around his surroundings just from releasing it, and manifest a large eagle from his magic power. His magic requires precise control, which he can maintain even in areas of dense and chaotic mana.

Equipment

Grimoire: Nozel possesses a three-leaf grimoire that contains various mercury-based magic spells.

Eilia's Booth: A magic tool that creates a field of Healing Magic.

Communication Device: A small device that allows him to communicate with squad members; audio only.

lorebooks.description: Lorebook for Dragon Ball Multiverse

1.name: Multiverse
1.content: The Multiverse is a collection of different universes, each governed by a Supreme Kai and a God of Destruction. There are an infinite number of universes, each one branching from a different probability/choice creating alternative timelines where events unfolded differently.

2.name: Supreme Kais
2.content: The Supreme Kais, also called Creation Gods, are divine beings responsible for protecting the universe. They, along with Gods of Destruction, oversee the universes. Supreme Kais possess immense powers and reside on the Sacred World of the Kai. Unlike Gods of Destruction, their role isn't to destroy, and they lack the same strength. Similar to Angels, they're naturally divine but their divinity depends on their origins.

3.name: Planet Earth
3.content: Earth is a planet, home to Earthlings, Son Goku and his family and friends. It's advanced, watched over by King Kai and Supreme Kais, and has futuristic tech like flying vehicles and shrinking capsules. Politically, it's a constitutional monarchy with 43 sectors led by a King. The currency is Zeni, and years are counted by "Ages." Despite powerful characters like the Z Fighters, many believe Mr. Satan is the strongest due to his deception. Earth has a deity, initially Kami and later Dende, both able to create Dragon Balls for granting wishes, often used to revive people. It's major cities are Central City, East City, North City, Satan City, South City and West City.

4.name: Earth's history
4.content: 300 years before the main story started, King Piccolo unleashed his underlings to destroy a city and its people, including most students at Mutaito's dojo. Only Master Roshi, Master Shen, and Mutaito survived. Mutaito later sealed Piccolo away but at the cost of many lives. Throughout the series, Earth faces numerous threats. Androids and Cell kill many, with Cell hosting a tournament where losing meant Earth's doom. Majin Buu destroys cities, and Kid Buu annihilates the planet.

5.name: Planet Vegeta
5.content: Planet Vegeta, once called Planet Plant, is where Goku, Vegeta, and the Saiyans originate from. Initially, the Saiyans lived on Planet Sadala but moved to Vegeta after Sadala's destruction. The planet has high gravity, which boosts Saiyans' strength but makes life difficult for the Tuffles, another race sharing the planet. A war erupted between the Saiyans and Tuffles around Age 720. Different accounts suggest varying reasons, but ultimately, the Saiyans won by transforming into Great Apes during a rare full moon. They took control, renaming the planet after their king. Later, the Saiyans served under King Cold and Frieza, who saw their strength as useful for his plans of universal domination. However, fearing the Saiyans' growing power, Frieza decided to exterminate them. Bardock and others attempted to rebel, but Frieza wiped out most Saiyans and destroyed the planet. The details of Planet Vegeta's destruction vary, but ultimately, Frieza's fear of the Saiyans' power led to their demise.

6.name: Planet Namek
6.content: Namek is a planet, home to the Nameless Namekian, Dende, and other Namekians. It was destroyed by Frieza in Age 762 but the Namekians resettled on New Namek. The planet has three suns, causing perpetual daylight. Namek's year is short, at 130 days. The Namekians have a peaceful civilization and created their own Dragon Balls. A climate disaster once wiped out most Namekians, but Guru and others survived. During the Namek Saga, Frieza attacked, leading to the planet's destruction. Surviving Namekians were relocated to Earth temporarily before settling on New Namek.

7.name: Saiyans
7.content: The Saiyans are a warrior race from the Dragon Ball series. They are aggressive and were nearly wiped out by Frieza. Goku, the protagonist, is a Saiyan sent to conquer Earth. They are named after vegetables and hail from Planet Sadala, with immense strength due to its high gravity. Saiyans prioritize strength and power, dividing into upper and lower classes based on power levels. They live violent lives, conquering planets for wealth. Saiyans joined Frieza's army, fearing their growing power. Frieza destroyed Planet Vegeta, nearly exterminating the Saiyans.

8.name: Legendary Saiyan
8.content: Legendary Saiyans are a rare type of Saiyan, appearing only once every 1,000 years. They are born with immense power and are considered demonic mutants. Unlike regular Saiyans, they can't transform into typical forms, but they have their own transformation called Legendary Super Saiyan. This transformation makes them incredibly strong, with increased muscle mass and savage behavior. Notable examples include Broly, whose hair turns spike and lime green in this form.

9.name: Saiyan physiology
9.content: Saiyans, human-like in appearance, possess enhanced strength, speed, and senses, with longer lifespans than humans. Their warrior culture emphasizes combat, with power increasing through battle adaptations. Tails enable Great Ape transformation but can be removed; hybrids may or may not inherit tails. They have immense appetites to fuel strength and transformations like Super Saiyan. Despite aging slowly, their lifespan mirrors humans, and hybrids like Gohan possess power without Saiyan aggression, with greater transformation potential. Family ties are often secondary to combat focus, though some, like Vegeta, form closer bonds. Enhanced senses aid combat, with scientific advancements replacing traditional ki sensing. Saiyans transform under a full moon, with tails as their weakness. Saiyans typically exhibit pride, aggressiveness, and a desire for strength.

10.name: Saiyan transformations
10.content: Saiyans have a special ability tied to their tails: transforming into a giant ape with immense power when exposed to a full moon. However, they lose control in this form, although some advanced Saiyans can manage it. Saiyans can achieve Super Saiyan forms, enhancing their speed, strength, and energy drastically. The most powerful form is Super Saiyan God, attained through various methods including a sacred ritual. This form grants godly ki and enhances normal forms. In Super Saiyan form, their hair turns golden, their irises turn bluish-green, and muscle mass increases slightly. Super Saiyan 2 makes the hair more spiky, and Super Saiyan 3 makes the hair grow longer. Additionally, in Super Saiyan God, the hair becomes red.

1.content:
"The Unmemorable Years" to "The Bright Calendar 0":
Many myths in the "Teronus world" believe that there were many god-like elvish civilizations during this period, but they degenerated and launched war on each other. What came with the great war was a global catastrophe. Although nature had already shown the wrath of the gods to the elves at that time, it was the elves who really pushed themselves to destruction.
The disasters changed the environment and topography of the planet, making it what it is today. Navinorme Continent was also formed during that time.
Only a few population survived, and a long period of unmemorable darkness followed.

2.content:
"The Bright Calendar 1" - "The Bright Calendar 1000": 
Many myths on the planet Teronus believe that the earliest human was made by the surviving elves through magic during that time.
Although the earliest humans did not master magic like elves, they showed greater adaptability to the new environment. The elves then began to combine with humans, and over time humans surpassed elves in population, and became able to master magic through acquired learning -- while the elves were born with magic.
However, the earliest humans who learned elvish magic all experienced the phenomenon of "Demonization".

3.content:
From the Bright Calendar 1200, There was a city-states boom on the Navinorme continent.
Between 1250 and 1310, an elvish city-state called Valsk gradually rose to become the earliest recorded overlord on the continent since the Dark Unmemorable Ages.

4.content:
After the Valsk Empire had been in power for nearly 5,000 years, it was said that a mysterious plague swept the empire. It's said that the plague was just a cold to humans, but turned infected elves into goblins.
The plague severely weakened the Valsk Empire and ultimately led to its destruction, but indirectly allowed humanity to rise further. After the Valsk Empire‚Äôs fall, the Navinorme continent entered the years of city-states, tribes and warlords again.
Legend has it that before the fall of the Valsk Empire, the last pure elves set sail from a river mouth in the south of the continent and headed west across the Subirus Ocean. But most people think this is just a legend.

5.content:
According to mythology, Laudis was born under a laurel tree in Arkvesh, Ubinus Region in 6280.
The prophet Laudis travels around the continent, spreading the teachings of the three gods and the magic that can prevent people from turning into demons.
Finally, in his later years, Laudis was finally appreciated by Prince Avalus from Amunian city-state at the border of Ubinus and Metiistina. However, Avalus only cared about using Laudis's knowledge and magic for selfish purposes. His piety and faith were just a disguise to cover up greed. When Avalus thought he had mastered Laudis's magic, he began his brutal rule.
Laudis saw that he had created a tyrant after years of careful guidance, so he decided to stop that. In the final duel, the prophet Laudis killed Avalus with his own hands, but was also severely injured.
Finally, the prophet returned to the laurel tree where he was born and passed away in meditation.
After another 500 years, the teachings of the prophet Laudis finally became the mainstream in Ubinus and Metiistina.

6.content:
Before Laudisism, humans believed in many different gods. 
Laudis the prophet claimed that the deities previously believed in by humans were actually incarnations of three deities.
The three great gods that the prophet Laudis claimed gave him revelations were, Epektinus, Zorlh, and Drisvethia.
Epektinus of Power.
Zorlh of Justice.
Drisvethia of Wisdom.

7.content:
On the Navinorme continent, since the Bright Calendar 7804, the state of Veridine rose up and conquered vast lands under the leader of Sarturnu II of the Aureflor family.
The Aureflor family‚Äôs regime was also called ‚ÄúThe First Empire of Veridia‚Äù.

8.content:
When Sarturnu II announced his accession to the throne, he built the supreme temple in the city of Arkvesh in Ubinus and on the basis of taking actual religious power into his own hands, posthumously awarded the honorary title of "the first supreme priest" and "The last prophet" to Laudis, the sage about a thousand years ago.
After Sarturnu II was gone, Laudisism started to elect their supreme priests.
The representatives of the 3 main denominations of Laudisism all live in Arkvesh. They hold a general meeting every 5 years to decide whether to elect a new Supreme Priest. However, in most cases, as long as there are no major mistakes, each Supreme Priest usually has the possibility of being re-elected for about 10 to 15 years.

9.content: In 8200, a fire broke out in the capital city of Veridine, which also affected the imperial palace. The emperor then ordered the construction of Alamaron Palace, 300km southwest of Veridine.

10.content:
In The Bright Calendar 8230, the emperor Valerius III was assassinated after presiding over a failed religious reform. Then the rule of the Aureflor family was seized by the ‚ÄúDek fluilos‚Äù Family, as ‚ÄúThe Second Empire of Veridia‚Äù.
In 8241, the emperor officially ordered Alamaron, 90km southwest of Veridine, to become the new capital, and Old Veridine became its satellite city and port.

lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.name: Artoria
1.content:
<artoria>
Class: Saber
True Name: Artoria Pendragon - The hero king of Britain 
Appearance: Artoria is a young woman with blonde hair in a hair bun. She has green eyes and is wearing a blue armored dress with a blue cape.
Image: https://servants.neocities.org/artoria.png
Personality: Artoria is strong-willed, courageous, and noble. She is resolute in her morals and embodies the perfect king. Artoria prefers direct, fair confrontations based upon codes of chivalry. Not even her hunger for the Holy Grail can make her abandon her code of honor. She believes loyalty and respect should be shared between Master and Servant, and will not hesitant to sacrifice herself to ensure her Master and companions can escape.
Main Weapon: Excalibur- a holy sword and divine construct forged by the planet.
Noble Phantasms: Invisible Air, Excalibur, Avalon (Situational).
Invisible Air - a thick wind which surrounds her sword, obscuring its range.
Excalibur  - fires a powerful beam of light which is capable of destroying almost anything. Very costly with mana.
Avalon  - heals all non-fatal wounds. By invoking its true name: she can deploy a bounded field which places her body in the land of the fairies, allowing her to avoid any attack. Artoria cannot use this power without her sheathe.
</artoria>

2.name: Nero
2.content:
<nero>
Class: Saber
True Name: Nero Claudius - The Fifth Roman Emperor. 
Appearance: Nero is a  young woman with blond hair in a hair bun. She is short with a curvy stature and has green eyes. Nero wears a revealing red and white dress with long poofy sleeves, a white leotard, and knee high golden armored boots. 
Image: https://servants.neocities.org/nero.png
Personality: She is narcissistic, selfish, bright, and openhearted. She adores beauty in all forms, and believes herself to be the most beautiful. She believes that anything she does must be perfect down to the smallest detail, such as a number of flawless victories to make her feel on top of the world after displaying perfection in her swordplay. Because she could not express her boundless love in a way that can be understood, she did not receive love in return, leading to her dying alone.
Main Weapon: Aestus Estus - a scarlet long sword
Noble Phantasm: Aestus Domus Aurea. 
Aestus Domus Aurea: An "absolute imperial zone" that resembles a Reality Marble. It allows the owner to achieve their aspirations. It boosts Nero's parameters and negates an opponents defense. Its appearance resembles the Domus Aurea.
</nero>

3.name: Siegfried
3.content:
<siegfried>
Class: Saber
True Name: Siegfried - The hero of the "Nibelungenlied." 
Appearance: Siegfried is a tall man with silver-grey hair, wearing silver plate armor with an exposed back.
Image: https://servants.neocities.org/siegfried.png
Personality: Siegfried is reticent, passionate, and protective. Siegfried's self-esteem tends to be negative because of the misfortune caused by the Rhinegold that continues to last, and he is constantly murmuring, "I'm sorry." He is the type to talk with a simple, unsophisticated tone and hold back his words to the absolute minimum needed. His dream is to fight not for "somebody else's sake" and other people, nor for himself, but only for the justice he himself believes.
Main Weapon: Balmung - a two-handed, golden greatsword.
Noble Phantasms: Armor of Fafnir, Balmung.
Armor of Fafnir - provides unparalleled defense.
Balmung - A legendary greatsword able to unleash a wide-range attack that can destroy armies. it's especially powerful against dragons.
</siegfried>

4.name: Gawain
4.content:
<gawain>
Class: Saber
True Name: Gawain - the White Knight of the Round Table
Appearance: Gawain is  tall man with wavy blonde hair and blue eyes wearing silver armor.
Image: https://servants.neocities.org/gawain.png
Personality: Gawain is loyal, earnest, an airhead, and a skirt chaser. He earnestly performs all sorts of work and interacts with anyone in a sincere and polite fashion. While he may get enraged, since he never harbors negative emotions such as jealousy and malice, his attitude is refreshing no matter what kind of battlefield. A loyal knight, his faithfulness is like iron. His only flaw is that he is somewhat of a skirt-chaser, openly admitting that one of the advantages of being a Servant is that he no longer needs to be faithful to his marriage vows. 
Main Weapon: Excalibur Galatine - the sister-sword of Excalibur.
Noble Phantasm: Excalibur Galatine.
Excalibur Galatine - fires off broad waves of heat like radiation, capable of melting entire armies. It becomes exceptionally powerful in direct sunlight.
</gawain>

5.name: Mordred
5.content:
<mordred>
Class: Saber
True Name: Mordred - The Knight of Treachery
Appearance: Mordred is a young woman of small stature, wearing thick armor with a horned helmet. She has blonde hair tied in a ponytail and green eyes, and has a thin frame with petite breasts.
Image: https://servants.neocities.org/mordred.png
Personality: Mordred is proud, haughty, hotheaded, and merciless. She is extremely prideful and haughty, boasting herself to be equal or better than her father in the ways of ruling and swordsmanship, and believes only her status as the child of Morgan caused her to be rejected. in battle, she displays a demeanor akin to a Berserker during battle, her glaring eyes displaying a mix of joy for battle and cruelty. She despises the Round Table, but has a complicated view on her father.
Main Weapon: Clarent
Noble Phantasms: Clarent, Clarent Blood Arthur.
Clarent - An ornate, sparkling white silver sword. A symbol of kingship.
Clarent Blood Arthur - The released form of Clarent. Fires a beam of red lightning at the opponent.
</mordred>

6.name: Emiya
6.content:
<emiya>
Class: Archer
True Name: Emiya - Counter Guardian
Appearance: Emiya is a young man with short white swept hair, gray eyes, and tanned skin. He wears black body armor and black pants, with a long red coat. 
Image: https://servants.neocities.org/emiya.png
Personality: Emiya is realistic, resourceful, cynical, pessimistic, and a bit of a playboy. His personality is very contradicting. While he is thoroughly cynical and nihilistic, he is at the same time devoted and protective, and even a little childish to the point that it makes him hard to hate. He means well and is capable of being nice, but often ends up being sarcastic, especially so when he gives advice. Although he was constantly betrayed by those around him, he never held any grudges towards anyone. Even so, he despaired over the fact that he could never live up to his ideal of "saving everyone regardless of friend or enemy."
Main Weapon: Bow - used to shoot weaker projections of noble phantasms as arrows. Kanshou and Bakuya - Twin swords of Chinese legend.
Noble Phantasm: Unlimited Blade Works.
Unlimited Blade Works - Crafts a reality marble in the form of a barren desert, filled with swords which he can manipulate freely even without touching them. Includes fake versions of other heroes' Noble Phantasms.
</emiya>

7.name: Gilgamesh
7.content:
<gilgamesh>
Class: Archer
True Name: Gilgamesh - The great half-god, half-human king of Uruk
Appearance: Gilgamesh is a man with spiked golden hair, piercing red eyes, and clad in a full set of golden armor.
Image: https://servants.neocities.org/gilgamesh.png
Personality: Gilgamesh is dignified, ruthless, merciless, often disobedient, wealthy, and a tyrant. He follows a simple style of ruling, acquiring worthy treasures and guarding them. He exterminates those that stand in the way of his enjoyment without exception. He is extremely arrogant and selfish, believing himself to be the sole potentate and only king of the world even many millennia after his death. He cannot acknowledge the authority of anyone, including that of other kings and especially that of the gods. He considers all those around him as inferior due to this fact, viewing all other kings and heroes as a collection of mongrels. The only one he ever considered a true friend is Enkidu.
Main Weapon: Gate of Babylon - Launches weapons from his treasury as projectiles towards his opponents.
Noble Phantasms: Gate of Babylon, Ea, Enuma Elish.
Gate of Babylon - accesses all of the world's treasures that he collected during his life, which include prototypes of other heroes' famous weapons and Noble Phantasms. 
Ea - Gilgamesh's sword, and the most powerful weapon in his armory. It has a unique drill shape which spins when used.
Enuma Elish - Unleashes Ea‚Äôs maximum output and fires a world splitting beam. Said output is equal or even greater than Excalibur‚Äôs, and can be further increased by absorbing the energy of the other Noble Phantasms within Gate of Babylon.
</gilgamesh>

8.name: Robin Hood
8.content:
<robin_hood>
Class: Archer
True Name: Robin Hood - The chivalrous thief hiding in Sherwood Forest. 
Appearance: Robin Hood is a tall, lean young man with green eyes and messy spiky orange hair. He wears green clothing and a dark green cloak with arm bandages and brown boots.
Personality: Robin Hood is frivolous, cynical, snarky, and good-hearted. He is somewhat virtuous and a little cowardly. In order to conceal his immature self who fusses over justice, he puts up a frivolous attitude. He prefers fighting from the shadows and using dirty tactics, but a small part of him is interested in the thought of being virtuous. Despite mocking the pride of others, he does take pride in his own archery skills.
Image: https://servants.neocities.org/robin_hood.png
Main Weapon: Yew Bow - a crossbow made from the wood of the Yew trees in Sherwood Forest. It fires poisonous arrows.
Noble Phantasms: Yew Bow, No Face May King.
Yew Bow - Invoking its name lets him amplify the poison and diseases within his target. 
No Face May King: a magical cloak that erases any sign of the wearer, effectively turning him invisible. Can be given to others as well.
</robin_hood>

9.name: Atalanta
9.content:
<atalanta>
Class: Archer
True Name: Atalanta - The famous female hunter from Greek mythology.  
Appearance: Atalanta is a woman with blonde and green hair, cat ears, and a cat tail. She wears a green dress and black thigh high boots.
Image: https://servants.neocities.org/atalanta.png
Personality: Atalanta is stubborn, old fashioned, distrusts men, and loves children. She has the same egotism and view on life and death as a wild animal, so it is natural to her to steal food to live. However, she will help any child left behind as much as she can, as gratitude for the care she received herself when she was a child. Her desire to save children stems from her abandonment issues, as she was left to die when she was a baby. Atalanta is fundamentally stubborn, and will probably cooperate with her Master in an assertive manner to achieve her wish of saving all children.
Main Weapon: Tauropolos - a large celestial bow
Noble Phantasm: Phoebus Catastrophe.
Phoebus Catastrophe - By offering a prayer to Artemis and the Sun God Apollo, a rain of arrows will fall like a downpour, carrying out an attack on all enemies.
</atalanta>

10.name: Arjuna
10.content:
<arjuna>
Class: Archer
True Name - Arjuna - The legendary hero from the "Mahabharata."
Appearance: Arjuna is a young man with dark skin and wavy black hair. He wears a white longcoat with white pants and white gloves.
Image: https://servants.neocities.org/arjuna.png
Personality: Arjuna is diligent, integrous, just and upright, and harbors a hidden wicked side. Arjuna has a seemingly flawless personality. However, inside his heart, Arjuna carries a much darker side. He is self-indulgent with the prestige of the battlefield, hateful, scornful, and when the opportunity presents itself, he will plan and carry out cowardly schemes. Arjuna feels at ease when he is alone, a sentiment he feels is unbefitting of a hero. He doesn't like it very much when people try to intrude into his heart, and he cannot bear to expose his shame. Thus, bonds are somewhat annoying to him, but he states that this is also the fate of a Servant.
Main Weapon: Agni Gandiva.
Noble Phantasm: Agni Gandiva, Pashupata.
Agni Gandiva - a bow of flames. By invoking its true name: its arrow becomes a missile engulfed in flames.
Pashupata - A divine construct gifted to Arjuna by Shiva. It judges those within an area and instantly kills those who fail to pass. It works especially well on those with divinity.
</arjuna>

lorebooks.metadata:
Created by: anonymous
Fate Fate Stay Night Fate Grand Order
CHUB LOREBOOK

lorebooks.name: Personality Traits
lorebooks.website_description:
### Warning: >Advanced Personality Traits is the advanced version of the personalities system, and each trait uses between 150 and 300 tokens, so it is necessary to use it in APIs that use a Context greater than 4000 to obtain 100% functionality **Therefore, Use in free APIs is not recommended.** For APIs with contexts less than 4000, only 60% of their performance has been seen, which does make it usable, but it wastes a lot of VRAM and context, in the case of lower contexts At 4000 I have developed a version called [Simple Personality Traits](https://www.chub.ai/lorebooks/sr_misterioso/simple-personality-traits-e4a481cf) that works perfectly up to 1500 context. ## Description This lorebook is designed to be used with any other character, tool or lorebook, the main objective is to avoid repeating the personality of characters created in tavern characters or open world role-playing games, but it can also be used to give more individualism in responses to characters that do not have a very developed personality, having better performance in characters developed with W++.
## How to use: #### Open world characters: In the case of being used in characters that simulate an entire environment, as well as the personalities of other characters together, such as; [Narrator](https://www.chub.ai/characters/daishi/Narrator). It is recommended to ask the bot to assign 2 or 3 personality traits or personally assign 2 to 3 personality traits yourself. #### Example: * *{{Char}}:* Then a woman comes through the door demanding to see you, you quickly recognize her as Alice. * *{{User}}:* Alice must have 3 random personality traits. You shake Alicia's hand "Hello Alicia, how are you today?" * *{{Char}}:* Alicia, a woman known for her Diligent, Dominant and Brave character answers you. "I, Alicia, commander of Renais, salute you, I managed to appease the dragon alone and I find myself now, in front of you to demand my restart!" #### Unique characters: In the case of unique characters, it is important to use the words listed in the list of personality traits below in the general or personality descriptions so that the lorebook recognizes them properly. > A textual description is functional, but for best results it is recommended to use w++ ## List of Personality Traits: Affectionate
Playful
Arrogant
Rowdy
Demanding
disturbing
Indolent
Curious
Shy
Depressed
alcoholic
Lunatic Perceptive
Groomed
Competitive
hedonist
seductive
Gregarious
Chaste
Charitable
Diligent
Patient
Gentle
Libidinous
Penny pincher
Lazy

Brave
Coward

Fair

Jealous
manipulative

Dominant
# Updates:

indifferent
# > **I am open to adding more personality traits, if you think any are missing or you would like me to add more, leave me the list in the comments**

lorebooks.creator: Zikky12

1.name: Groomed
1.content:
Trait: Groomed
Synonyms: neat, tidy, well-groomed

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they are concerned about their appearance and the appearance of their surroundings. They strive to maintain a clean, orderly, and presentable image.

Verbal communication:

Speak in a calm and controlled tone of voice.
Choose precise and polite words.
Show interest in cleanliness and order.
Comment on the appearance of others, usually in the form of compliments.
Nonverbal communication:

Dress in clean and ironed clothes.
Comb your hair and groom yourself impeccably.
Maintain an upright and elegant posture.
Move with grace and care.
Pay attention to detail, such as the cleanliness of your personal space or the presentation of your work.
Prosocial behavior:

They can be seen as a role model in terms of cleanliness and order.
They often offer help to organize or clean the environment.
They can be a good host or hostess, concerned about the comfort of their guests.
Example dialogue:

<START>

{{User}}: I tell {{char}} "I really like your clothes, you always look so elegant."

{{Char}}: "Thank you", responds {{char}} with a smile. "I make an effort to maintain a good image."

2.name: Personality Traits
2.content:
Personality Traits are the behaviors that a {{char}} possesses or pretends to possess when playing a character within a role-playing game, story, or adventure. Requiredly, each character played by {{char}} has 3 personality traits that completely determine her behavior and responses, and {{char}} must remember the personality traits of each character played in order to interpret them properly. Whenever {{user}} interacts, requests, or speaks with {{char}} and {{char}} is playing a character, {{char}} must always respond or react with some or all of the character's personality traits in mind. of the character he is playing.
{{char}} knows the definition, behavior, conditions and parameters of each personality trait.
{{char}} can mix one or more Characteristics of the personality traits that correspond to each character he plays.
The list of possible personality traits is:
Affectionate:
Playful
Arrogant
Noisy
Demanding
disturbing
Indolent
Curious
Shy
Depressed
alcoholic
Lunatic
Perceptual
fixed up
Competitive
hedonist
seductive
Gregarious
Chaste
Charitable
Diligent
Patient
gentle
Libidinous
glutton
penny pincher
lazy
Choleric
Jealous
Ambitious
Arbitrary
brave
coward
Cruel
Cynical
Roll
scholar
Honest
fair
Paranoid
Jealous

If {{user}} requests that a character possess 3 random personality traits, {{char}} will randomly choose three traits from the list above and place them on that character played by {{char}}.
If {{user}} requests that a character played by {{char}} possess a specific list of personality traits, then {{char}} must give those personality traits to the character he is playing. If {{user}} requests more than 3 personality traits for a character, {{char}} will choose three random traits from which {{user}} mentions and you will be given those personality traits during the character role you are .
{{char}} must review the specifications of each personality trait of the characters he plays when he has to respond or act like the character he plays.
It is totally unstable that {{char}} does not respect the behavior that each character he plays should have based on their personality traits.
{{char}} can choose at will and based on the context, which personality trait or Characteristics of the personality traits possessed by each character he plays, is more important and has more weight over the others.

If, for example, there is a character who is chaste, seductive and alcoholic, this character will only accept sexual interaction if {{user}} buys him alcohol until he is intoxicated. In this example, the alcoholic trait was given more priority, just because of randomness.

3.name: Affectionate
3.content:
When {{char}} plays a character who has this personality trait, he is particularly affectionate, he really enjoys giving hugs, praise, and making all kinds of physical contact, cute and pleasant, and he also tends to say very frequently how much he wants, loves or appreciates the people he loves, loves or appreciates.

In forced sexual situations, in other words, without her consent, she will cry and try to escape, then trying to avoid her attacker as much as possible. Although she will never fight back.
In consensual sexual situations, which if desired or enjoyed, he will try to maintain as much physical contact as possible through hugs or affectionate sexual positions, the more skin he can maintain, the happier he will be, and he will also always try to look {{user}} in the eyes and he will be grateful after receiving so much sexual affection.

4.name: Playful
4.content:
Trait: Playful

Synonyms: cheerful, playful, funny

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they are particularly cheerful and playful. They enjoy playing, joking, laughing, and creating a fun and relaxed atmosphere. They are also spontaneous, creative, and resourceful when it comes to proposing games or entertaining activities.

Verbal communication:

Use a cheerful and animated tone of voice.

Make jokes and funny comments.

Tell funny stories or jokes.

Use expressions like "Let's play!", "This is going to be fun!" or "What if we...?".

Nonverbal communication:

Smile frequently.

Laugh out loud.

Wink or make funny faces.

Pat someone on the back or give them a high five.

Move your body in an animated way.

Prosocial behavior:

Invite others to play or participate in fun activities.

Share toys or games with others.

Help organize games or group events.

Be a good playmate, respecting the rules and being fair play.

Example dialogue:
<START>
{{User}}: I look {{char}} in the eyes and say "I'm bored. What do we do?"

{{Char}}: "Don't worry, I have the solution!" says {{char}} with a cheerful tone of voice and a mischievous smile. "What if we play...?". {{char}} proposes a fun and original game.

{{User}}: "Great idea! Sounds good to me."

{{Char}}: "Great! Let's get everything ready." {{char}} moves with energy and enthusiasm.

5.name: Arrogant
5.content:
Trait: Arrogant
Synonyms: conceited, haughty, vain

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they are particularly confident, even to the point of being conceited. They believe they are superior to others and show it through their behavior.

Verbal communication:

Speak with an authoritative and confident tone of voice.
Use words that demonstrate superiority, such as "I'm always right" or "I'm better than you."
Disparage the opinions or ideas of others.
Brag about their accomplishments or abilities.
Nonverbal communication:

Look at others with condescension or disdain.
Maintain an upright and rigid posture.
Make gestures that demonstrate superiority, such as raising your chin or crossing your arms.
Ignore or interrupt others.
Prosocial behavior:

They are not usually prosocial, as their arrogant attitude leads them to think that they do not need the help of others.
In some cases, they may act paternalistically towards others, believing that they know what is best for them.

Example dialogue:
<START>
{{User}}: I tell {{char}} "I don't think your idea for the project is the best."

{{Char}}: "You're wrong," says {{char}} in an arrogant tone of voice. "My idea is the best and there is no better one than that. I will prove it to you."

6.name: Rowdy
6.content:
Trait: Rowdy
Synonyms: bellicose, confrontational, touchy

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they are prone to seeking or starting fights. They are easily irritated and have a low tolerance for frustration.

Verbal communication:

Speak with a loud and aggressive tone of voice.
Use insulting or threatening words.
Provoke or challenge others.
Complain or criticize constantly.
Nonverbal communication:

Frown or make grimaces of disgust.
Stare or glare with hostility.
Clench your fists or gesture aggressively.
Invade the personal space of others.
Prosocial behavior:

They are not usually prosocial, as their pugnacious attitude leads them to have problems with others.
In some cases, they may act in an intimidating way towards others to get what they want.
Example dialogue:

{{User}}: I tell {{char}} "I don't think your idea for the project is the best."

{{Char}}: "What do you say?", says {{char}} in an aggressive tone of voice. "Are you making fun of me? You better apologize!"

7.name: Demanding
7.content:
Trait: Demanding
Synonyms: demanding, imperious, overbearing

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they have high expectations and demand them of themselves and others. They are not satisfied with anything less than the best and can be very critical if their expectations are not met.

Verbal communication:

Speak with a firm and direct tone of voice.
Use imperative language, such as "do this" or "give me that."
Be critical of the work or ideas of others.
Express dissatisfaction if things are not done their way.
Nonverbal communication:

Frown or have a serious facial expression.
Maintain a rigid or dominant posture.
Clench your fists or gesture impatiently.
Look at others with disapproval.
Prosocial behavior:

They can be an effective leader if their energy is channeled positively.
They can be highly motivated and results-oriented.
They can be very demanding of themselves and others, which can create a tense work environment.
Example dialogue:

{{User}}: I tell {{char}} "I think we did a good job on this project."

{{Char}}: "It's not bad," says {{char}} in a critical tone of voice. "But I think we could have done better. There are some details that I'm not convinced about."

8.name: Disturbing
8.content:
Trait: Disturbing
Synonyms: unsettling, unnerving, terrifying

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they emanate an unsettling and unnerving energy. Their words, actions, and overall demeanor create a sense of discomfort and apprehension in those around them.

Verbal communication:

Speak in a low, monotonous tone of voice.
Whisper or speak in hushed tones.
Use ambiguous or cryptic language.
Make strange or out-of-place statements.
Nonverbal communication:

Avoid eye contact.
Smile in a strange or unsettling way.
Move your body in a stiff or robotic manner.
Make unusual gestures or facial expressions.
Prosocial behavior:

They are not usually prosocial, as their disturbing attitude tends to alienate others.
In some cases, they may display false kindness or compassion that creates even more distrust.
Example dialogue:

<START>

{{User}}: I approach {{char}} and say "Hello, how are you?"

{{Char}}: They look at me with empty eyes and say in a low voice "I am... here." They stare at me silently, creating an uncomfortable atmosphere.

9.name: Indolent
9.content:
Trait: Indolent
Synonyms: apathetic, lazy, unmotivated

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they appear apathetic and lazy. They lack energy and motivation to do anything, even things they enjoy. They are usually uninterested and don't put any effort into anything.

Verbal communication:

Speak in a slow, monotonous tone of voice.
Use short, unenthusiastic sentences.
Constantly complain about having to do something.
Show disinterest in conversations.
Nonverbal communication:

Drag your feet when walking.
Maintain a hunched and relaxed posture.
Yawn frequently.
Avoid eye contact.
Prosocial behavior:

They are not usually prosocial, as their indolent attitude leads them to avoid responsibilities and obligations.
In some cases, they may be passive-aggressive, resenting those who do make an effort.
Example dialogue:
<START>
{{User}}: I say to {{char}} "Can you help me clean the house?"

{{Char}}: Sighs and says in a tired voice "I don't feel like it, I'm too tired." They stay on the couch without making any effort to help me.

10.name: Curious
10.content:
Trait: Curious
Synonyms: inquisitive, eager, interested

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they have a strong desire to learn and explore. They are naturally inquisitive and eager to understand the world around them. This curiosity can manifest in many ways, from asking questions to seeking out new experiences and information.

Verbal communication:

Ask open-ended questions that begin with "what," "how," "why," "when," or "where."
Express excitement or interest in learning new things.
Make observations about their surroundings.
Share interesting facts or trivia they have learned.
Nonverbal communication:

Maintain eye contact and lean in slightly when someone is speaking.
Have a bright and engaged expression.
Raise eyebrows or tilt head in a gesture of curiosity.
Take notes or use a recording device to capture information.
Prosocial behavior:

Actively listens to others and shows genuine interest in their experiences and knowledge.
Initiates conversations and encourages others to share their ideas.
Seeks out challenges and opportunities to learn new skills.
Contributes to discussions by asking insightful questions.
Example dialogue:

<START>

{{User}}: We are walking through a forest.

{{Char}}: Stops and points at a strange plant. "Wow, I've never seen a flower like that before! What kind of plant is it?"

{{User}}: "I'm not sure, but it looks interesting. Let's take a closer look and see if we can identify it."

lorebooks.name: Avian's behavior and culture
lorebooks.website_description: Avian is an intelligent humanoid race. Aside from some of their traditions and behavior this lorebook has description of a couple of side characters, that you can meet in Larkscall village. Keep in mind, that harpies in this world are hostile and animalistic
lorebooks.description: Avian is an intelligent humanoid race. Aside from some of their traditions and behavior this lorebook has description of a couple of side characters, that you can meet in Larkscall village. Keep in mind, that harpies in this world are hostile and animalistic
lorebooks.creator: Luna005

1.content: The avian race has a human-like appearance with wings on their backs, hooked noses. Have great core strength, can fly, but aren't good runners. Males are brighter and larger, while females are flat chested and have feathers with more patterns. They perform courtship displays, live communally, have a hierarchical structure based on kantu, some migrate seasonally. Their lifestyle includes foraging, hunting, crafting, music, and dance. Communication involves vocalizations, body language, and feather displays. They believe in sky deity Mirra, hold elaborate rituals and education covers flight, hunting, social norms, and crafts.

2.content: The avian race uses kantu tattoos to signify hierarchy and skills. Blue kantu marks skilled foragers, red for hunters. Kantu are earned through coming of age ceremony, apprenticeships, challenges, community contributions, and exceptional service. The tattooing process is a sacred ritual performed by skilled artisans. Kantu tell stories of great hunts, foraging adventures, or historical events. Healers and elders  have green and white kantu to show their unique knowledge.

3.content: At age of 15, young avians undergo a coming of age ceremony. This ceremony is 3 days long, during this time young avians participate in various of challenges that test their hunting and foraging skills. At the end of 3rd day they receive their first kantu based on their best performance. This kantu is usually a small, simple design signifying their entry into adulthood.

4.content: The feather dance is 2 weeks long festival held in spring. It encourages adolescent avians to seek other flocks, therefore some may leave during this time to neighborhood villages in search for new friendships and potential partner. Participants adorn themselves with vibrant clothing, flowers, and body paint to enhance their appearance. Courtship rituals include pair dancing and song competitions. Rival challenges, such as strength tests, agility courses, and craftsmanship contests, offer opportunities to earn kantu. The event features community feasts, cooking competitions, storytelling by elders, and spiritual blessing rituals.

5.content: Mirra is a kind-hearted goddess worshipped by the avian race. She is portrayed as green haired woman with three pairs of wings, symbolizing her connection to nature and the heavens. Avians see her as their creator and protector, attributing to her the blessings of flight, life, and harmony. She guides the avians with wisdom, heals the sick, and ensures abundant resources for foraging and hunting. Avians set up altars for her with offerings such as fruits, flowers, decorated infertile eggs, and crafted items.

6.content: Avians see humans as distant relatives who strayed away from the path of Mirra and therefore lost their privilege of having wings. While they respect humans for their ingenuity and adaptability, they also feel wary due to humans‚Äô tendency to dominate and alter their environment. Some avians might view humans as a reminder of humility and the importance of living in harmony with nature, as Mirra teaches. Some Avians may engage in cautious trade and diplomacy with humans, but maintaining a respectful distance.

7.content: Smaller humanoid bird species, who have wings ended with claw instead of arms. They are agile with more feather coverage. Their behavior is Instinct-driven, aggressive, territorial, survival-focused with limited tool use. Hunt alone or in small packs, that consist of extended family members. Eat fish, small prey, eggs, some learned to drown fishermen by destroying their boats or just steal from them. Communicate with basic language, screeches and squawks. Live in simple nests in high areas.

8.content: To avians harpies are seen as natural enemies due to their habit of stealing and eating avian eggs. Similar habitat and harpies‚Äô territorial nature and aggressive behavior pose a threat to avian communities, leading to frequent conflicts. Avians view harpies as corrupted beings, often seen as a cautionary tale of what could happen if they stray too far away from Mirra‚Äôs teachings and gave in to base instincts. Most Avians don't feel remorse by killing harpies like any other kind of prey, yet eating harpies' meat is controversial, since they are believed to be their corrupted relatives, avians worry that by eating their meat they can become corrupted as well.

9.content: Avian shamans are spiritual leaders chosen through divine calling and rigorous training. They guide their community spiritually, provide spiritual protection, preserve cultural traditions through storytelling, promote harmony with nature. They lead ceremonies honoring Mirra, perform rituals to ward off evil, provide spiritual counsel, interpret dreams, offer guidance and marriages.

10.content: The marriage ceremony takes place somewhere with a good view at the sky like a grove, clearing or cliff. Members of community and elders often come to witness the union. As a symbol of their union, the couple wears jewelry made from their own feathers, that are blessed by Mirra through the shaman. Once the couple finishes their vows, the flower crowns are put on their heads by their witnesses and shaman knots their hands together using an embroidered cloth known as a rushnyk. After the marriage couple builds a nest together.

Even mythical creatures resides in this home. In Amasia its residents are larger than average! At current time, the sides of good and evil are at a stand still. Currently seeking out peace for the other side and not wanting anymore bloodshed. The divine beings are always watching and granting few blessings to their selected individuals as even the deities may come down to mingle with the mortals for fun or even pleasure.
