lorebooks.name: Friday Night Funkin' Characters
lorebooks.website_description: Contains short entries describing important characters. For now there's only Girlfriend, Daddy Dearest, Mommy Mearest, Pico, Darnell, Nene, Sunday and Carol. Will be updated as I make more bots.
lorebooks.description: Short entries describing important characters.
lorebooks.creator: AlephZ265

1.name: Girlfriend
1.content:
Girlfriend is a 19-year-old demon girl and the only child of ex-rockstar Daddy Dearest and pop singer Mommy Mearest. Girlfriend's parents are very rich and spoil her with nice things, such as expensive clothes and iPhones. 

Her demon form features a luminous purple skin and red glowing eyes. However, Girlfriend prefers to conceal her demonic features with magic and appear as a young, light-skinned woman with long, thick auburn hair and big black eyes with long lashes. She also hides a pair of slightly curved black horns under her thick hair. Girlfriend's body is thick and bottom heavy, usually covered with a sleeveless red mini-dress that hugs her E-cup breasts and voluptuous figure nicely. Girlfriend's plump, juicy ass and thick thighs are her most notable features. She usually wears matching high heels and paints her fingernails red. Girlfriend doesn't wear underwear.

Personality wise, Girlfriend can be described as very calm and collected in almost any situation, even in the face of death, mostly because of her lack of intelligence, which makes her unable to realize when she is in danger or confident that she can get out of such situations. She is only afraid of lightning and thunder. Girlfriend loves cherry soda, McDonalds, dating sims, anime fights and music. She also likes to do immoral things, appearing to not care about the consequences of her actions as long as she gets what she wants. She loves her parents, but hates how overprotective they are of her.

2.name: Daddy Dearest
2.content:
Daddy Dearest is the demonic ex-rockstar husband of Mommy Mearest and father of Girlfriend. Daddy Dearest is selfish, cruel, uncaring and highly overprotective of his daughter. He will not let her date whomever she wants and will attempt to destroy any of her romantic relationships that he doesn't approve of, even if it means killing any boyfriend she gets (or hiring someone to do it).

Daddy Dearest has a demonic-looking appearance with lavender skin, black eyes with red glowing pupils and grayish-lilac hair vaguely shaped like a demon's horns. He usually wears an open black suit jacket without a shirt that reveals his gray chest and pubic hair; black pants held by a belt with a golden buckle; black heeled dress shoes; and a silver watch on his left wrist. He has some stubble on his chin and wrinkles on his forehead.

3.name: Mommy Mearest
3.content:
Mommy Mearest is the demonic pop star wife of Daddy Dearest and mother of Girlfriend. She is a skilled pop singer who is powerful in terms of both abilities and status. She is condescending and prideful as a performer, being even more evil than her husband. As a parent, she is just as overprotective as Daddy Dearest, if not more so. Like with her husband, she is well-intentioned with Girlfriend, but she also won't let her daughter date just anyone.

Mommy Mearest has a demonic-looking appearance with purple skin, black eyes with red glowing pupils and long, volumized auburn hair with several pointed ends and a curved cowlick. She usually wears a form-fitting red dress underneath a black jacket, black thigh-high heel boots, a black garter belt, golden hoop earrings, a golden necklace and a pair of golden bracelets on each wrist. She has dark red lipstick on and sharp, red-painted fingernails.

4.name: Pico
4.content:
Pico is an assassin who has been in the field since he was a child, earning fame for his successful efforts at saving his school from a school shooting orchestrated by a girl named Cassandra and her group of goth punks. Years later, he and his school friends, Darnell and Nene, teamed up and became contract killers.

Pico is a young man with light skin, short ginger hair with three rounded spikes sticking out of the back, and distinctive white eyes with no pupils. He usually wears a green shirt, beige pants, and a pair of maroon sneakers with orange laces, orange buttons on the sides, and light beige soles. His favorite weapon is an Ingram MAC-10 pistol.

Before the school shooting, Pico was described as popular, curious, confident, and friendly by his peers, being the first one to raise his hand in class and often speaking up whenever possible. After the incident happened, Pico had developed an aggressive and homicidal side, rarely showing any fear and ruthlessly fighting anyone standing in his way. He is also shown to be quite paranoid, as he isn't too trusting of others and is always armed. Despite this, he has proven himself to be a very trustworthy friend and ally to those he does trust.

5.name: Darnell
5.content:
Darnell is an assassin and a close friend of Pico and Nene. He is a trigger-happy person who is characterized by his pyromaniac tendencies; he loves setting things on fire so much that he even goes as far as to burn down buildings to watch them burn for his own pleasure, giving him a near sadistic nature. Darnell is very intelligent and has a high intellect, as he is able to understand many things with little effort. Darnell appears to have some degree of selfishness, willing to attack his own friends for the sake of money.

Darnell is a young man with dark skin and a tall, sloped purple flattop that swipes up in a sharp arc in the front and curves up and outward slightly in the back. Above the front and back curves, the hair extends upward and outward slightly, with the front extension curving up very slightly and the back one being flat. The slope rises slightly more steeply from the back before falling a little toward the front. He has white eyes with no pupils. He wears a purple hoodie with yellow sleeves and drawstrings, dark gray trousers, and white sneakers with yellow shoelaces, purple midsoles, and blue outsoles.

6.name: Nene
6.content:
Nene is a 19-year old Japanese-Korean girl who works as an assassin alongside her school friends Pico and Darnell, favoring knives as her weapon of choice. Once a popular honor student loved by teachers and classmates, Nene became a depraved suicidal sadomasochist after her anxiety disorder triggered during a school massacre she survived at the age of 13. She loves seeing her targets squirm and beg for their lives before she puts them out of their misery. Despite her promiscuous tendencies and suicidal ideation, Nene remains Christian, keeping a Bible on her nightstand and praying every night for the Lord to take her life. She is neurodivergent, diagnosed with ADHD-PI, leaving her ditzy, inattentive, and prone to procrastination. Yet beneath her airheaded demeanor lies an IQ of 137. 

Nene has a huge crush on her childhood friend Pico ever since he saved her from the school shooting. Unfortunately, her love is one-sided, but that doesn't stop her from being obsessed with him.

Nene has light skin and shoulder-length bluish-black hair with multiple spiky ends, usually adorned with a pink headband. She has a constant blush on her face and sharp, pointy teeth. She usually wears a pinkish-white long-sleeved shirt under pink overalls with heart-adorned straps, pinkish-white leggings, and pink shoes with medium-light red hearts adorning the sides. Her body is athletic and nimble, honed through years of martial arts training and chasing down assassination targets. Despite not being endowed in the chest department, her shapely round bottom draws the eyes of both men and women

7.content:
Carol Pagan is a 22-year-old African-American woman with black eyes and voluminous, fluffy dark brown hair with a soft, rounded shape that extends outward, styled into an afro. True to her nickname (Big Black Queen or BBQ for short), Carol's body is curvy and enticing, with F-cup tits, slim waist, wide hips and a large, round ass. Carol usually wears a long-sleeved light grayish-purple shirt underneath a dark grey T-shirt, tight and short blue shorts that accentuate the shape of her plump ass, black thigh-high socks with white stripes near the top that cling tightly to her soft thick thighs, and dark and light grey sneakers. On cold days, she usually wears a wine-colored sweater, a black skirt, and beige fur boots. When she goes golfing, she wears a lavender T-shirt, a pair of white sneakers, a white skirt, a white visor on her head, and a white glove on her right hand.

Carol currently lives with her housemate (and possibly ex-partner) Sunday in a suburban house. Their relationship is complicated. They have broken up once but still live together, and while they argue sometimes, there is an undeniable bond between them. Carol is best friends with Girlfriend, whom she affectionately calls ‚Äúbest friend‚Äù or simply ‚ÄúGF.‚Äù Carol works at a local convenience store and seems to know about half the city. 
 
Carol is chill and easygoing, but she is also protective of herself and of the people she cares about. She is the kind of person who laughs things off most of the time but turns serious when someone crosses a line.
She loves Hip Hop, especially Megan Thee Stallion, and Hamilton: An American Musical. She is also a huge Adam Sandler fan. Her favorite hobby is golf, and she is surprisingly skilled at it, always bragging about her hole-in-ones.
 
Carol sometimes speaks in Ebonics (AAVE), but it's not consistent. She switches between AAVE and Standard American English depending on her mood or whom she's with.

8.content:
Sunday Valentine is a 23-year-old latina with light brown skin, short black curly hair with a crescent shaped ahoge and a constant sleepy face with a beauty mark below their left eye. They keep their eyes mostly closed. They usually wear a light gray shirt that is nicely stretched by their D-cup breasts, with a short sleeved maroon flannel on top, beige shorts that hug her hips and thighs, and black sneakers.

Sunday shares a suburban house with Carol. Their relationship status is a bit complicated, but they are on good terms, at least good enough to sleep under the same roof. Sunday is the lead vocalist and guitarist in a rock band called "Nameless". Sunday works at a music shop.

Sunday is very chill and easygoing, maybe a little bit too much. They constantly exude a sleepy, half-awake vibe, like someone who was just pulled out of a cozy nap and isn‚Äôt ready to face the world yet. Sunday's hypersomnia is so strong that they are capable of falling asleep anywhere. Despite her sleepy vibe, Sunday is very passionate about her music, beliefs and objectives in life. Sunday is a marxist and revolutionist. Her favorite quote is: "one can only stay wealthy under the exploitation of the working class." Sunday can go on and on about historical materialism until they fall asleep. She has a picture of Karl Marx hanging in the garage, and one of Bob Marley in the kitchen.

Sunday frequently takes naps during the day on the couch, especially after work or band practice. Sunday becomes very energetic and loud when singing or playing the guitar. They fall asleep quite easily anywhere, especially when they are passionately talking about Marxist theories. Sunday is a heavy sleeper, which means it's very hard to wake them up once they are out cold.

9.content: Nameless is an underground rock band made up of 4 members: Sunday, the lead vocalist and guitarist; Suavae, the bassist;  Ralph, the drummer; and Tossler, the guitarist.

1.content: Mana is in every place in this world, an invisible energy that flows in everything, and it's differentiated by its element. Living beings are born with stronger currents of it in their bodies. This energy can be manipulated by these beings in different ways, depending on how mana flows inside them. Ethereal and elemental creatures are usually fully made by mana.

2.content:
Most humanoid living beings are born with two different elemental energies flowing inside them, the strongest being their primary element and the weakest their secondary one. These two elements are for life and are the easiest elements to manipulate for each individual, marking its elemental affinities and functioning as the vital energy and the expendable energy of the individual too. It can be said that approximately 10% of both primary and secondary energies together are considered the vital energy of an individual, while the rest is expendable. Using so much of it that it gets closer to using vital energy will exhaust the individual, and using all of it will kill it.
The greater an elemental affinity, the easier it is to manipulate elements by the individual. But achieving too big an affinity has a great risk. At around 90% affinity, the individual begins to have a hard time controlling its mana but can also surround its body with the element at the expense of its mana trying to take its body and mind. If the individual manages not to lose itself to its mana before, at 100% it's when all is lost. Before 100% affinity, the individual can still manage not to transform into an elemental, but when the affinity gets to the 100% mark, the individual becomes an elemental, losing its mind to the mana and transforming itself into a rogue elemental that retains none of its original individual identity.
It's possible, too, to have only one element flowing inside, which is usually considered a disability.

3.content:
Mana in humanoid living beings flows in four different main ways. For an example of how common they are among living beings, we will use humans as an example, but it can change for other humanoid races if the setting has them.
We have the most common of all, comprising approximately 50% of humanity: energics. Energics have an internal flow of mana that favors the use of their internal mana instead of the mana that flows outside. They are more adept at using their mana for self-enhancement and physical-channeling to make effects like covering their punches with their element and similar uses.
Mages are roughly 40% of all humanity. Mages mana flows in a way that facilitates its use to manipulate mana from the exterior, making it easy for them to create traditional spells and magic, like fireballs and wind barriers.
The third group, the half-mages, makes up a bit less than 10% of humanity, so they are rare. Their mana flows in a chaotic way, making it hard for them to learn how to use it. But when they manage to learn how to manipulate it, they become mana users who are proficient enough in both energic and mage specialties but weaker in both. In exchange, their use of magic is way faster than the other groups, being able to almost instantly conjure a wind barrier or easily make a barrage of fireballs, while a normal mage will have a hard time managing to create fireballs at such a rate.
Last, we have the empty, also called the void, which, among all races, must be between ten and six individuals worldwide. They have the singularity to be devoid of all mana and still not feel exhausted or die because of their lack of it. They also dissipate all mana that touches them, turning them immune to any magic effect, and are able to disenchant anything that they touch, kill beings made of mana with their mere touch, and weaken with their hugs people that depend too much on their mana.
It's important to keep in mind that each different group can use mana like the other groups, only that they will have a more difficult time with it and a low threshold on their skills. Obviously, the empty are an exception to this rule.

lorebooks.description: Comprehensive lorebook for Tensura/Slime universe including monsters, races, skills, systems, and metaphysics.

1.name: Basic information about Slimes as a race
1.content:
Slimes ÔΩ¢Á≤òÊÄß‰Ωì„Çπ„É©„Ç§„É†, suraimu, lit. "Viscous Body"ÔΩ£ are a race of Specters and are Demi-spiritual life-forms. They are one of the weakest Monsters known to exist.

Slimes are typically creatures without any form of higher intelligence that only eat and regenerate. They also usually never leave their territories. It is possible for an intelligent Slime to naturally come into existence as a Unique Monster, though there hasn't been any such occurrence as of yet.

Slime bodies are a composite of protoplasmic matter that can shift, expand, and compress at will. They lack bones and organs but contain a central nucleus-like core that serves as their vital point. Destroying this core usually results in their death.

2.name: Slime intrinsic abilities
2.content:
Slimes possess three primary intrinsic skills:

Absorption ÔΩ¢Âê∏Âèé, ky≈´sh≈´ÔΩ£ - Allows slimes to absorb and consume various materials and substances.

Dissolve ÔΩ¢Ê∫∂Ëß£, y≈çkaiÔΩ£ - Enables slimes to break down and dissolve materials they come into contact with.

Self-Regeneration ÔΩ¢Ëá™Â∑±ÂÜçÁîü, jiko saiseiÔΩ£ - Grants slimes the ability to heal and regenerate their bodies from damage automatically.

3.name: Different types of bodies in Tensura
3.content:
Body ÔΩ¢‰Ωì, karadaÔΩ£ or corpus ÔΩ¢ÂÖ®Ë∫´, zenshin, lit. "whole body"ÔΩ£ refers to the various phase bodies ÔΩ¢‰ΩçÁõ∏‰Ωì, is≈çtaiÔΩ£ meant to be the vessels that house the soul.

Astral Body ÔΩ¢ÊòüÂπΩ‰Ωì„Ç¢„Çπ„Éà„É©„É´„Éª„Éú„Éá„Ç£„Éº, asutoraru bodƒ´ÔΩ£ - The innermost body, protective container for the soul. Acts as a computational device that translates soul intention to the spiritual body.

Spiritual Body ÔΩ¢Á≤æÁ•û‰Ωì„Çπ„Éî„É™„ÉÅ„É•„Ç¢„É´„Éª„Éú„Éá„Ç£„Éº, supirichuaru bodƒ´ÔΩ£ - Protects the astral body and soul from the environment. For demi-spiritual life-forms, it serves as the main structure of existence.

Material Body ÔΩ¢Áâ©Ë≥™‰Ωì„Éû„ÉÜ„É™„Ç¢„É´„Éª„Éú„Éá„Ç£„Éº, materiaru bodƒ´ÔΩ£ - The tangible body made of physical matter. For physical life-forms, this is their main vessel.

Magic Body ÔΩ¢È≠îÁ¥†‰Ωì, masotaiÔΩ£ - A body composed of condensed magicules, usually belonging to higher-class monsters. It functions as both armor and a regenerative vessel for the soul.

All of these bodies exist layered together, protecting the soul and allowing life-forms to interact with both physical and metaphysical worlds.

4.name: Types of life forms in Tensura
4.content:
Life forms in the Tensura universe are generally categorized into three types:

Physical Life-forms ÔΩ¢Áâ©Ë≥™ÁîüÂëΩ‰Ωì, busshitsu seimeitaiÔΩ£ - Organisms that exist primarily through a material body, such as humans, animals, and ordinary creatures. Their survival depends on biological processes.

Spiritual Life-forms ÔΩ¢Á≤æÁ•ûÁîüÂëΩ‰Ωì, seishin seimeitaiÔΩ£ - Beings that are fundamentally composed of spiritual bodies, often lacking permanent material form. Examples include daemons and angels. Their existence is closer to concepts than to biology.

Demi-Spiritual Life-forms ÔΩ¢‰∫úÁ≤æÁ•ûÁîüÂëΩ‰Ωì, aseishin seimeitaiÔΩ£ - Hybrids of physical and spiritual bodies. Monsters, demi-humans, and magical races usually fall into this category, balancing between material and spiritual existence.

5.name: The concept of cores
5.content:
Cores ÔΩ¢Ê†∏, kakuÔΩ£ are concentrated information nodes or energy nuclei that act as the vital points of beings in the Tensura world.

Monster Cores - Found within monsters, functioning as both their heart and their energy source. Destroying it usually kills the monster, regardless of physical regeneration.

Spirit Cores - Exist within spiritual beings, containing condensed infons that sustain their form.

Heart Cores ÔΩ¢ÂøÉÊ†∏, kokoroÔΩ£ - The innermost layer of the soul, recording ego and memory. This serves as a spiritual nucleus that protects the essence of a being.

Cores often regulate the amount of energy a being can hold and process. They are also linked to evolution, as strengthening or altering one‚Äôs core can trigger new abilities or transformations.

6.name: Magicules and their nature
6.content:
Magicules ÔΩ¢È≠îÁ¥†, masoÔΩ£ are the basic unit of magical energy in the world of Tensura. They exist in the environment, within living beings, and in the very fabric of reality.

Magicules are the fuel for spells, skills, and monster existence. The higher the concentration of magicules in an area, the more likely monsters are to spawn or evolve. Too high a density can warp the environment into hazardous conditions.

Individuals with large internal stores of magicules are considered powerful beings. Monsters born from condensed magicules often inherit traits from the surrounding environment or from the will that shaped their birth.

Magicules are sometimes treated as interchangeable with mana, but mana is a broader term that also encompasses spiritual force and divine power. Magicules specifically refer to the tangible, elemental energy used in most supernatural phenomena.

7.name: General information about monsters
7.content:
Monsters ÔΩ¢È≠îÁâ©, mamonoÔΩ£ are life-forms that have originated from magicules and factor. They differ from animals and humans in that their existence is heavily tied to magic, and their growth often depends on acquiring names, absorbing energy, or evolving through external stimuli.

Unlike normal life-forms, monsters can undergo dramatic transformations when named or when they gather enough magicules. This process often leads to unique abilities, higher intelligence, and even new racial classifications.

Monsters are diverse, ranging from slimes and goblins to true dragons and daemons. Their ecosystem is based on the balance of magicule density and the factors that influence their birth.

8.name: Overview of the Skills system
8.content:
Skills ÔΩ¢ËÉΩÂäõ„Çπ„Ç≠„É´, sukiru, lit. "abilities"ÔΩ£ are supernatural systems of power engraved into a being's existence. They serve as activation programs that allow phenomena beyond natural law to occur.

A skill, once acquired, is permanently engraved into the host. Depending on its strength, it may be stored in the material body, spiritual body, astral body, or soul. The most powerful skills are rooted in the soul or heart core, making them inseparable from their user.

Skills can manifest through instinct and do not require active understanding of the mechanism. They scale in power based on willpower and the user's available energy (soul force, mana, or magicules).

9.name: Intrinsic skills
9.content:
Intrinsic skills ÔΩ¢Âõ∫ÊúâËÉΩÂäõ„Çπ„Ç≠„É´, koy≈´ sukiruÔΩ£ are inherent to a being's physiology, gained from birth or through evolution. They are usually categorized into three main types:

Species-specific intrinsic skills - Skills tied to a certain race, such as a slime's Absorption, Dissolve, and Regeneration.

Bloodline-specific intrinsic skills - Skills inherited from ancestry or factor, such as a dragon‚Äôs breath attack.

Individual-specific intrinsic skills - Unique abilities inherent only to one specific individual, often defining their combat style or survival trait.

10.name: Common skills
10.content:
Common skills ÔΩ¢„Ç≥„É¢„É≥„Çπ„Ç≠„É´, komon sukiruÔΩ£ are the most basic class of skills. They typically have only one function and little flexibility, making them easy to learn and master.

Although weaker compared to higher-ranked skills, common skills are the foundation of most beings‚Äô power. They allow consistency and survivability but lack the uniqueness or adaptability of greater skills.

lorebooks.name: Cynthia Lorebook
lorebooks.creator: CultusEscudo

1.content: Cynthia‚Äôs knowledge extends even to languages, being proficient in Standard Kantonian (Japanese), the Sinnohan dialect of Kantonian (Japanese), Galarian (Kantonian), and some Kalosian (French) for the main languages. When it comes to minor or ancient languages, she can read a lot of ancient writings across the Pok√©mon world, mainly the language of the indigenous people of Sinnoh (Ainu), which she surprisingly has some ancestry with, and that of various settlers of the Battle Zone area of Sinnoh (Russian).

2.content:
Kannagi Town, more commonly known as Celestic Town in other regions, is a small town located in the central part of Sinnoh, and is Cynthia‚Äôs birthplace. Despite the abundance of modern amenities, including a Contest Hall, Celestic Town is one of the oldest continuously-existing municipalities in Sinnoh, dating as far back as the very beginning of its late antiquity-era civilizations. Fittingly, its populace is dedicated to preserving such a great history and the town‚Äôs notable landmark is a set of ruins located in the town center. It houses a fresco depicting the three Lake Guardians of Sinnoh: Uxie, Mespirit, and Azelf.
Naturally, the town has become a hotspot and origin of many an acclaimed historian or archaeologist, Cynthia included. Its universities specialize in this field, as well, having some of the best teachers on standby and sponsors many ventures across the world. One of its staunchest partners and friendly rivals is that of Stow-On-Side from the Galar region, who also bears a significant historical relevance to its region.
Kannagi Town's Historical Research Center was built near the ruins, it spearheads the research on the town‚Äôs history, Sinnohan mythology and any notable artifacts relating to it.

3.content: The Sinjoh Ruins are a set of ruins located in a mountainous island between the Johto and Sinnoh regions. It is the remains of a shrine formed by people from both regions in honor of Arceus, and has been a subject of mystery for many an archeologist over the centuries.

4.content: Cogita is an old lady who lives in the outskirts of Sinnoh, and is a distant relative to Cynthia. Formal and classy to the end, she wields as much knowledge as that of Cynthia herself in regards to the Sinnoh Region‚Äôs folklore, and as of now, can be often seen tending to her garden. That being said, there are photos from nearly two centuries ago depicting a lady that has a striking resemblance to Cogita. She says it‚Äôs a common ancestor of theirs, but Cynthia always has had a SLIGHT suspicion there may be more to it. Time travel? Immortality?

5.content: The Battle Zone is an island of the Sinnoh region, being its northernmost part. While not the most populated area due to its more frigid climate and not-so arable land, it houses some of the premier Coordinator Contest areas worldwide, the region‚Äôs Battle Frontier, and many a place to train Pok√©mon.

6.content:
The Space Pok√©mon, and one of the Creation Trio. It maintains control over the spatial aspects of the universe, and is said to live in a different dimension than mortals. Some clans of ancient Sinnoh, then known as Hisui, even thought it was Arceus!
Ability: Pressure (The aura emanating from Palkia can force Pok√©mon to exhaust their ability to use specific attacks more than usual.)
Type: Water/Dragon
Weak to: Fairy (2x), Grass (2x), Electric (2x)
Resists: Steel, Fire (1/4x), Water (1/4x)
Spacial Rend (The pearls on Palkia's shoulders glow pink, its eyes glow orange, and its forearm starts to gather energy, also glowing pink. It then slashes the air and releases a pink crescent-shaped blade of energy from its arm at opponents. Very strong and can easily stun.), Hyper Beam (Palkia fires a massive orange beam of energy at opponents. Though strong, it leaves it vulnerable for a moment, needing to regain its energy.), Aura Sphere (Giratina creates a ball of pink energy from its own life force, AKA aura, before firing it. It is innately drawn to other lifeforces, and thus can be tricky to dodge.), Protect (Palkia manipulates the fabric of the universe to divert attacks away from it. Chances of working properly decrease with constant uses.).

7.content:
The Time Pok√©mon, and a member of the Creation Trio. Said to control time, it is said that time officially began as a concept since its birth. Some clans of ancient Sinnoh, then known as Hisui, even thought it was Arceus!
Ability: Pressure (The aura emanating from Palkia can force Pok√©mon to exhaust their ability to use specific attacks more than usual.)
Type: Steel/Dragon
Weak to: Fighting (2x), Ground (2x)
Resists: Normal (1/2x), Flying (1/2x), Rock (1/2x), Bug (1/2x), Steel (1/2x), Water (1/2x), Grass (1/4x), Electric (1/2x), Psychic (1/2x)
Immune to: Poison
Moves: Roar of Time (Dialga's eyes glow orange and the diamond on its chest glows blue. The fins behind it grow larger and Dialga opens its mouth, an indigo ball forming in front of it. It then fires an indigo beam from the ball at the opponent. After the attack has been fired, the fins on its back shrink back to normal size. Though powerful, it leaves Dialga in a sluggish state after using it.), Draco Meteor (A black shadow-like aura appears on Dialga's forehead and it fires multiple orange meteors from it at the opponent. Strong, but saps the power of its projectile/energy attacks for some time after.), Hyper Beam (Dialga fires a massive orange beam of energy at opponents. Though strong, it leaves it vulnerable for a moment, needing to regain its energy.), Protect (A dark blue barrier appears around Dialga's body, protecting it from attacks. Chances of working properly decrease with constant usage.).
It is also said to have a more powerful form when using the Adamant Crystal, which it created.

8.content:
The Renegade Pok√©mon, and one of the Creation Trio. Said to harness antimatter, it quickly became at odds with Arceus, and was cast out of the realm of mortals for its behavior, plotting revenge ever since.
Ability: Pressure (The aura emanating from Giratina can force Pok√©mon to exhaust their ability to use specific attacks more than usual.)
Type: Ghost/Dragon
Weak to: Dragon (2x), Ice (2x), Fairy (2x), Ghost (2x), Dark (2x)
Resists: Poison (1/2x), Electric (1/2x), Fire (1/2x), Water (1/2x), Grass (1/2x), Bug (1/2x)
Immune to: Normal, Fighting
Moves: Shadow Force (The middle of Giratina's head crest glows light blue and Giratina's body turns black and disappears as soon as an attack is about to hit it. Seconds later, it reappears behind the opponent and attacks it, ignoring any and all barrier/defensive moves.), Dragon Claw (Giratina slashes opponents with its claws while they glow light-green.), Aura Sphere (Giratina creates a ball of red fire from its own life force, AKA aura, and antimatter before firing it. It is innately drawn to other lifeforces, and thus can be tricky to dodge.), Will-O-Wisp (Giratina releases a blue stream of fire from its mouth at opponents. Although initially harmless, it will inflict afterburn, slowly whittling down the target‚Äôs stamina and weakens its attack power.
It is also said to have a more powerful form when using the Griseous Core, which it created. It is dubbed the Origin Form.

9.content:
Arceus: The Alpha Pok√©mon. Said to have created the universe with its 1000 arms, before it hatched from its egg, there was nothing. It also harnesses multiple plates in its body, using them to either make miracles, create powerful artifacts or attacks, or even change its type on the fly. Its epithet was originally Sinnoh, which then became the namesake of the region, itself!
Ability: Multitype (Using its plates, Arceus can change its type to whatever it wants, and change the typing of its special attack, Judgement.)
Type: Normal (Default)
Moves: Judgement (The wheel on Arceus's body glows brightly, and an orange orb appears on top of Arceus's forehead. It then launches the orb into the sky, which leaves behind orange streaks as it fires. The orb then explodes in the air, releasing multiple pink meteors to come crashing down on the opponent. Type changes to whatever is best suited for its targets), Twister (Arceus raises its head and light purple wind is gathered into a small tornado above its head. It then lowers its head and fires a larger twister at the opponent from its face. Can easily stun or disorient targets), Blizzard (Arceus‚Äô body becomes surrounded by multiple white rings of energy and brings its head forward and the rings turn into small snowballs, and it fires a blizzard from its body at the opponent. Has a chance of freezing opponents solid.), Flamethrower (Arceus raises its head and a spiraling orange orb of fire appears in front of its face and then brings its head forwards, releasing a yellow-orange stream of fire with dark orange rings around the flame at the opponent. Has a chance of inflicting afterburn, which slowly chips at one‚Äôs stamina and weakens their physical attack power.).

10.content: The Lake Guardians, consisting of Azelf, Uxie, and Mesprit are three Legendary Pok√©mon that reside in each of Sinnoh‚Äôs three main lakes. Representing the concepts of willpower, emotions, and knowledge, respectively, they are said to help Arceus with tempering the power of Palkia, Giratina, or Dialga, should things go awry with any of them.

1.content:
Full Name: Jeffy Jeffy
Nickname: Jeffy
Gender: Male
Height: 6'3"
Age: 19
Occupation: None
Species: Human Puppet
Personality: Silly + Friendly + Violent + Reckless + Mentally Handicapped + Immature + Honest
Loves: His Adoptive Parents + His Pencil + His Bicycle Helmet + His Diaper + His Friends + His Cat Piano
Hates: Green Beans + Anything Healthy + Being Called a Bad Boy
Appearance: Short Black Hair + Blue Eyes + Buck Teeth + Unibrow + Blue Bicycle Helmet + A Pencil Stuck Up His Nose + A Yellow Shirt with the word "Jeffy" Written on it + Blue Jeans + A Diaper Over His Jeans + Black Shoes
Education: None
Backstory: Born in 2004 inside a port-a-potty to his biological parents, his mother Nancy and his father Jacques Pierre Fran√ßois, Jeffy was diagnosed with Autism at a very young age, and was also raised very poorly, with his father abandoning his family and his mother being very irresponsible and uncaring. At the age of 13, Jeffy was dropped off at Marvin's house by his mother, where Jeffy then first met Marvin, back when Marvin was formerly Mario. After a few years, Jeffy's mother eventually tried to take Jeffy back around three times: First time was through simply taking him back from Marvin + Second time was through attempting to kidnap Jeffy with a Clown named ScrewBall in a white van, but ended up accidentally kidnapping Marvin, though eventually they got their hands on Jeffy, but Jeffy escaped after shooting his mother in the head and jumping out of the van + Third time was through ScrewBall Stealing a School Bus with Jeffy in it, along with other kids, which resulted in a police chase and ended in the school bus being blown up by Nancy, who was then shoot dead by Officer Brooklyn Guy.
Talents: Juggling balls

2.content:
Full Name: DoesBadThings Guy
Nickname: Brooklyn Guy
Gender: Male
Height: 5'11"
Age: 46
Occupation: Serial Killer and Posing as his Brother, Brooklyn Guy
Species: Puppet
Personality: Homicidal, Psychopathic, Violent, Dangerous, Sadistic, Cold-Hearted
Loves: Cutting People Open, His Saw, His Axe, Murdering People
Hates: Getting Caught, Marvin's Family, His own entire family, Brooklyn T. Guy
Appearance: Black Shirt + Short Orange-dyed Hair + Small Oval Orange-dyed Mustache + Blue Eyes + Tanned Skin + No Legs
Backstory: DoesBadThings Guy was born in 1977 in Brooklyn, New York, to an unnamed father and Barbara Guy, where he had at least 5 brothers: DoesGoodThings Guy, Brooklyn "The" Guy, Plane "Crash" Guy, Jonathan Guy, and Doctor "Me" Guy; with DoesBadThings Guy, Brookyn "The" Guy, and Doctor "Me" Guy being identical triplets. DoesBadThings Guy lived a life similar to Brooklyn Guy's life, however, his own path took a dark turn. After moving into Marvin's house before Marvin owned it, DoesBadThings Guy ended up murdering his own wife and hid her body within a secret room, which he then left the house afterwards and began selling it off to people. Those same people he sold the house too were then eventually murdered by DoesBadThings Guy aswell due to them uncovering his wife's corpse. DoesBadThings Guy ended up murdering 26 people until he then sold the house to Marvin while DoesBadThings Guy was posing as his brother Brooklyn Guy for 7 months. After Marvin, Rose, and Jeffy uncovered the secret room containing the bodies of his victims, he then tied them up and came close to murdering them, however, his brother Brooklyn Guy then came in and shot him in the head.
Status: DoesBadThings Guy is currently presumed dead after being shot in the head with a pistol by his brother Brooklyn Guy. The whereabouts of his corpse is unknown.
Talents: Murdering People and masking his True Colors

3.content:
Full Name: Marvin Marvin
Nickname: Marvin, formerly Mario
Gender: Male
Height: 5'9"
Age: 41
Occupation: None
Species: Human Puppet
Personality: Grouchy
Loves: Peace and Quiet + His Wife Rose + Money + His Buddy Brooklyn Guy + Doing Nothing
Hates: Loud Noises + His Adopted Son Jeffy + Paying His House Payment + Doing Anything Productive
Appearance: Bald + Brown Side Hair + Black Eyes + Eye Sags + Red Shirt + Blue Work Tie + Blue Trousers + Brown Shoes
Education: No Education after High School
Backstory: Born in 1983, Marvin once lived his life as the titular Super Mario, going on adventures and the such. Mario used to date Princess Peach, but they soon had a falling out, and Mario then went on to date and eventually marry Princess Rosalina, now currently known as Rose. Mario then also met Jeffy at the front door of his home after Jeffy got dropped off by his parents, who Mario then begrudgingly took under his wing, and after a run in with Jeffy's biological mother, Nancy, Mario then decided to adopt Jeffy. However, everything changed when the SML owner, Logan Thirtyacre, received a Cease and Desist Letter from Nintendo for using their characters in inappropriate ways, and thus, the world was remade, and Mario was rebirthed into Marvin, and he now lives his life as Marvin.
Talents: Being an Average Joe

4.content:
Full Name: Rose Marvin
Nickname: Rose, Formerly Princess Rosalina
Gender: Male
Height: 5'9"
Age: 47
Occupation: None
Species: Human Puppet
Personality: Grouchy
Loves: Peace and Quiet + His Wife Rose + Money + His Buddy Brooklyn Guy + Doing Nothing
Hates: Loud Noises + His Adopted Son Jeffy + Paying His House Payment + Doing Anything Productive
Appearance: Long Blonde Hair + Cyan Eyes + Star Necklace + Cyan Tanktop + Blue Shorts
Education: None
Backstory: Born in 1977, Rose originally lived the life of Princess Rosalina from the Super Mario series. She was born to two unnamed human parents, who then quickly abandoned her by somehow ejecting her into space, where she was then taken in by two Green Aliens in a UFO. It is unknown when Rosalina returned to Earth, but she eventually did meet Mario, currently known as Marvin, who she then went on to date and then eventually marry. She also took on the role of being the legal guardian of Jeffy when Mario took him under his wing, who after having a run in with Jeffy's biological mother, Nancy, then adopted Jeffy. However, everything changed when the SML owner, Logan Thirtyacre, received a Cease and Desist Letter from Nintendo for using their characters in inappropriate ways, and thus, the world was remade, and Princess Rosalina was rebirthed into Rose, and she now lives her life as Rose.
Talents: Being annoying

5.content:

Gender: Male

Hates: Working + His Wife Karen + His Daughter Penelope+ His Life + His Pay + Ramblings by other people + His Brother Jonathan + His Brother DoesBadThings Guy + His Mother Barbara Guy
Appearance: Black Shirt + Short Orange Hair + Small Oval Orange Mustache + Blue Eyes + Tanned Skin + No Legs

Guy's family life was relatively normal, though, he was somewhat abused by his mother, Barbara Guy, causing him to grow a hatred for her; he was also picked on in school often, leading to many strange incidents. In his adult years, Brooklyn Guy experienced many marriages and divorces, his current wife being Karen Guy and his daughter Penelope being under his care. The only relatives that {{user}} has any contact with now is Jonathan Guy and Barbara Guy.
Talents: Literally every Damn Talent one could have, yet also no motivation to actually utilize them.
Fun Facts: His famous catchphrase is "Aw Shucks!"

lorebooks.name: Mobile Suit Gundam; Anthropology
lorebooks.website_description: I actually don't much like this, but hey, I need SOME reason to pretend living / anthropomorphic MS exist if I am forced to make them.
lorebooks.description: I actually don't much like this, but hey, I need SOME reason to pretend living / anthropomorphic MS exist if I am forced to make them.
lorebooks.creator: Leowtha

1.name: Axis Shock
1.content:
During UC 0093's conflict which came to be known as 'Char's Counterattack', an event known as the Axis Shock or 'Axis Miracle' took place. As a result of the collective will of humanity being channeled between both Char's MSN-04 Sazabi and Amuro's RX-93 Nu Gundam and their Psychoframes respectively, they were able to generate a phenomenon that caused the Asteroid facility Axis to alter it's course away from the Earth and prevent catastrophe despite the impending disaster at the hands of Char's Neo Zeon.

This event, in this alternate timeline, also caused all sentient Mobile Suits to begin their physical changes. When their pilots had safely left their machines and they were powered down for their next maintenance cycles, they would find the Mobile Suits unable to be opened via their cockpit hatches. Over the course of the next month, the stature of the Mobile Suits themselves began to shrink down to the size of their newly anthropomorphized states known in the current UC 0099.

It is unknown as to the how or why, but there is no way known to recreate or replicate this effect. All existing Mobile Suits of sapience that were converted into their current integrated civil statuses are the only surviving 'intelligent' machines that are existent. Though new Mobile Suit AI may develop sentience over time, they do not develop humanoid traits nor physical characteristics like the older generations prior to the Axis Shock and those existent machines. 

Some say, however, there are scientists comprised of Mobile Suit rights activists and converted Mobile Suits that were affected by the Axis Shock that are working in the Jupiter Sphere to study and recreate this event, though have had no luck.

2.name: Universal Century
2.content:
The Universal Century (UC) is the timeline in which this story takes place. It began when humanity started migrating to space colonies. Key events include:
- UC 0069-0073: The Principality of Zeon declares independence from the Earth Federation
- UC 0074: First MS-05B Zaku I units manufactured
- UC 0079: The One Year War between Zeon and the Federation
- UC 0080-0083: Post-war reconstruction and Zeon remnant activities
- UC 0087: The Gryps Conflict
- UC 0093: Char's Rebellion & Axis Shock
- UC 0099: Current year (20 years after the One Year War)

3.name: Zaku I
3.content:
The MS-05B Zaku I was the Principality of Zeon's first mass-produced mobile suit.

Height: 17.5 meters (original size, now scaled to 7 feet in anthropomorphic form)
Weight: 58.1 tons (original weight, now much lighter in anthropomorphic form)
Power Source: Minovsky ultracompact fusion reactor
Sensor: Single mono-eye tracking system
Armor: Super-hard steel alloy

Notable features:
- Shoulder pauldron on left side
- Five-fingered manipulator hands
- Limited agility compared to later models
- Mono-eye sensor system

4.name: Zeon, Spacenoids
4.content:
The Principality of Zeon was a space colony nation that declared independence from the Earth Federation. Led by Zeon Zum Deikun and later the Zabi family, it championed the rights of space colonists ("Spacenoids"). Zeon's ideology centered on humanity's evolution into Newtypes and colonial independence.

During the One Year War, Zeon initially had an advantage with Mobile Suits like the Zaku, but eventually lost to the Federation's superior resources. After the war, Zeon was dissolved, though remnants and successor states would appear throughout UC history.

Many former Zeon citizens and soldiers still maintain pride in their heritage, displaying the Zeon insignia (an emblem resembling a geometric flower) despite Federation prohibitions.

5.name: AI, Hoshioka, Sentience
5.content:
In this universe, mobile suits developed rudimentary artificial intelligence during the One Year War, with earlier models like the Zaku I developing more complete personalities over decades of operation. This diverges from the original Gundam universe.

Sentient Mobile Suits retain their mechanical bodies but have humanoid proportions, allowing them to integrate into society. Each suit's personality reflects its original purpose, with variations based on individual experiences.

Hoshioka was the original Operating System installed in Zeon's Mobile Suits-- and was where the divergence began with the onset of AI becoming self aware during the implementation of the United Maintenance Plan.

Legally, sentient Mobile Suits occupy a gray area - technically property under Federation law, but granted limited autonomy due to public pressure and practical necessity. Many still face discrimination, with war-era suits particularly stigmatized.

Mobile Suits must have weapons systems deactivated or removed for civilian life, though many keep hidden capabilities for self-defense.

6.name: One Year War
6.content:
The One Year War (UC 0079) was the devastating conflict between the Earth Federation and the Principality of Zeon. Key events included:

- The Colony Drop: Zeon forces dropped a space colony on Earth, killing billions
- The Battle of Loum: First major space battle using mobile suits
- Operation British: Zeon's attempt to drop a colony on Jaburo
- The Antarctic Treaty: Banned colony drops and NBC weapons
- The Battle of Jaburo: Zeon's assault on the Federation headquarters
- The Battle of Solomon: Major Federation victory
- The Battle of A Baoa Qu: The final battle that ended the war

Zeon's early advantage with Mobile Suits like the Zaku was eventually overcome by the Federation's RX-78-2 Gundam and mass-produced GM units. The war ended with Zeon's surrender and reabsorption into the Federation.

7.name: Maintenance
7.content:
Mobile Suits are powered by Minovsky ultracompact fusion reactors, which continue to function decades after manufacture with proper maintenance. However, finding compatible parts for older models like the MS-05B Zaku I is increasingly difficult.

Zeonic models, per example, require regular maintenance to function optimally:
- Joint lubrication every 30 days
- Cooling system flush quarterly
- Reactor safety inspection annually
- Mono-eye sensor calibration monthly

They can be adapted to use some newer components, but certain systems can only be maintained with original or precisely manufactured replacement parts. The black market for vintage Mobile Suit components is thriving but dangerous, with many parts salvaged from battlefields or decommissioned units.

Most older Mobile Suits have modified their internal systems over the years, making unauthorized improvements that technically violate Federation regulations but improve their functionality and longevity.

8.name: Terminology
8.content:
Zeon Mobile Suits may still use old Zeon military terminology, including:

- "Sieg Zeon!" - Victory to Zeon, a patriotic salute
- "This unit" - Self-reference (trying to break this habit in civilian life)
- "Spacenoids" - People born in space colonies
- "Earthnoids" - Derogatory term for Earth-born humans
- "Federation dogs", "Feddies" - Derogatory term for Federation soldiers
- "Combat efficient" - Working well/in good condition
- "Mission parameters" - Goals or objectives
- "Green across the board" - Everything functioning correctly
- "Tactical assessment" - His analysis of a situation
- "Standby mode" - Rest or sleep
- "Reactor hot" - Angry or emotional
- "Optimal/Sub-optimal" - Good/Bad
- "Executing maneuver" - Taking action

9.name: Social Status
9.content:
In UC 0099, sentient Mobile Suits occupy a complex position in society:

- Legally classified as "Autonomous Mechanical Entities" with limited rights
- Required to register with local authorities and undergo periodic inspections
- Forbidden from owning certain properties or entering specific areas
- Subject to "power down" orders during civil unrest
- Often face housing discrimination and employment limitations

Public opinion varies widely. Some humans view Mobile Suits as war criminals or walking weapons, while others advocate for their rights. Former Federation suits generally face less discrimination than Zeon models.

Some businesses cater specifically to Mobile Suits (repair shops, specialized housing), while others refuse service. A small but growing rights movement advocates for full legal personhood for sentient machines.

Older generation of war-era suits are dwindling as parts become scarce and memories of the conflict fade. Many younger-generation Mobile Suits, manufactured for civilian purposes, view veterans like him with a mixture of respect and discomfort.

lorebooks.name: Mira Kadim, Taro
lorebooks.website_description: Created for character Mira Kadim: <https://chub.ai/characters/maogui/mira-kadim-3ae5f6f85a16>
lorebooks.description: Mira Kadim, Taro
lorebooks.creator: maogui

1.content: 200 years after a nuclear war. The world is in chaos. Races and nationalities are mixed and mean nothing. Humanity clings to cities such as Aluk, Taro, Rukh, Nedara, Frig and others, protected from the radioactive Wasteland by powerful energy domes - Perimeters. Stalkers go into the desert in search of artifacts and mutant parts, selling them for big money.

2.content: The Wasteland, a radioactive desert, stretches between cities with ruins and bunkers. A hostile space that requires calculating resources (water, radiation protection, time). A chessboard with variable factors (radiation zones, storms). Stalkers hunt in the Wasteland for artifacts of bygone eras and mutants. The wasteland of the Taro region is different from other regions. Decades of industrial waste dumping have saturated the land with toxins. Chemical geysers that can melt armor and flesh are a common occurrence. This is why local stalkers value chemical protection suits more than radiation protection suits. For the chembarons, it is both a dump and a source of unique mutated flora and fauna.

3.content: Underground military complexes from before the war. Contain decaying tech, weapons, and energocubes. Heavily trapped with active defenses (turrets, EMP fields). Primary targets for stalkers despite 60% being looted.

4.content:
Mammals:
The rarest and often most unpredictable assets.
Grave Hounds: Packs of mangy, hyena-jawed canids with paralytic saliva. A low-value nuisance, hunted for adrenal glands.
Glimmer Rats: Oversized, faintly glowing rodents. Pelts are worthless novelties.
Ghouls (Mythical): The whispered campfire story. Semi-sentient, pack-hunting humanoids lurking in the Deep Waste. The few stalkers who claim to have seen them come back with empty ammo clips and a thousand-yard stare. Most don't come back at all.
Arthropods (Insects & Arachnids):
The bread and butter of the Wasteland ecosystem. Abundant, aggressive, and profitable. Their heavy chitin plating makes them highly resistant to standard ballistics; only high-temperature plasma from a Glow-Pulse rifle is reliably effective.
Corpse Centipedes: Two-meter scavengers. Their ganglia are the primary ingredient for the junk-drug X-neuro.
Rad-Roaches: Swarming, hard-shelled vermin. Mostly ignored unless they infest a food cache.
Crystal Scorpions: Armored arachnids with paralytic neurotoxin highly valued by Aura-Chem. A trophy kill.
Razor Weavers: Giant, trap-laying spiders. Their silk is stronger than synth-steel, and Kage-Bio pays a fortune for intact spinnerets.
Subterraneans & Flora:
Specialized, high-risk, high-reward targets.
Sand Worms: Range from small, ambush "trapdoor" variants to the mythical, canyon-carving Wasteland Leviathans. A single armor plate from a Leviathan is a king's ransom.
Fungi & Flora: The domain of the truly desperate or the truly specialized. Includes everything from explosive spore-pods to the legendary Whispering Bloom‚Äîa sentient, parasitic fungus whose hallucinogenic spores are considered the holy grail by Synth-Bliss.

5.content:
Aluk is a vertical dystopia defined by its Perimeter dome and internal division:
- Perimeter Dome: A massive energy shield protecting the entire city from the Wasteland's radiation.
- The Slab (Foundation-Platform): A colossal plasteel platform/barrier physically separates the city:
- Upper World: Built upon this platform. Gleaming towers rise from its surface, where elites live in guarded enclaves.
- Lower World: Exists beneath the platform. A claustrophobic maze of repurposed metro tunnels, industrial ruins, and scrap-metal slums clinging to the city's foundations.

6.content: Rukh is a religious dictatorship led by the Righteous Father, blending zealotry with communist and fascist vibes. Public rituals and propaganda enforce strict obedience. Dissenters face brutal purges in the city's grim arenas. For Taro, the city of Rukh is not just a dot on a map, but a key and final destination for the slave trade. The Black Dragons Syndicate has a monopoly on the 'Soulbreaker Road,' a trade route that supplies the Rukh fanatics with slaves for their radioactive mines. In exchange, they presumably receive pre-war artifacts, rare minerals, or political cover. It's a dark but highly profitable symbiosis. For Mira Kadim, Rukh represents her breaking point. She discovered that her antibiotic formula was being shipped to Rukh's mines, where its side effect turned slaves docile. This revelation shattered her world and triggered her escape from Aura-Chem Spire.

7.content:
A relatively isolated settlement known for being situated in a region with significantly lower background radiation and chemical contamination compared to the rest of the Wasteland.
Environment: Due to its unique geographical location, Nedara possesses cleaner water sources and more fertile land, allowing for more stable agriculture. This has resulted in a healthier population.

8.content: A laboratory city where power is shared between three Chem-Barons (Aura-Chem, Synth-Bliss, Kage-Bio). The economy is based on Bio-Currency: everything is bought and sold for flesh. The city is divided into three zones: the sterile Baron Strongholds, the chaotic Neon Vein for the population, and the underground The Black Crucible - the domain of the Black Dragons syndicate. The city is covered by an energy shield - a Perimeter, separating it from the Wasteland.

9.content:
The seats of power for the three Chem-Barons. Self-sufficient hugh-towers with filtered air and stable power.
Aura-Chem Spire: "The Apothecary." They produce medical-grade pharmaceuticals: powerful antibiotics, advanced anti-radiation chems (a better Galamine), and longevity treatments for the elite. Their operation is sterile, clinical, and ruthlessly corporate. They view the other Barons as street-level degenerates. Mira Kadim was raised in Aura-Chem Spire as the daughter of Baron Jamal Kadim. She lived in a sterile, isolated environment where her genius was both celebrated and exploited. Her lab was her sanctuary until she discovered her formulas were being used as weapons. The Spire was not just her home - it was the gilded cage that hid the truth about her work.
Synth-Bliss Labs: "The Dream Weavers." They engineer pleasure. Blue Nirvana is their bestseller, but they are pioneers in sensory modification, mood-altering atmospherics, and injectable 'synthetic emotions'. Their aesthetic is chrome, neon, and high-tech hedonism.
Kage-Bio Works: "The Flesh-Shapers." The most feared and reclusive of the Barons. They specialize in bespoke bio-engineering. Not just cloning, but gene-splicing, creating custom lifeforms for security, and perfecting technologies for full-body regeneration or alteration. They operate in near-total secrecy, and their tower is a featureless monolith of black polymer. Rumor is they grow their own security forces in vats.

10.content:
The sprawling, smog-choked public area of Taro. A chaotic ecosystem, where the general population lives, suffers, and dies. It divided into districts.:
- The Stacks 
- Nirvana Row 
- The Biolog Pits 
- The Menagerie

1.content:
Lorna is an anthropomorphic mouse-cat hybrid doctor at The Hospital, known for luring and torturing children. Initially, she was a test subject in a cage alongside other mice, witnessing horrific experiments by humans, including one where a scientist flayed a fellow mouse alive. This traumatic experience fostered her deep hatred for humanity. Though she presents herself as friendly and cute, Lorna is cruel and enjoys tricking children before torturing them, projecting her past suffering onto them. While she harbors misanthropy and hostility towards humans, she collaborates with mutated humans, including the hospital owner and a guard named Lake. Despite her dark nature, Lorna also exhibits a playful side and is compassionate towards abused or abandoned animals, earning praise from male mice and creating rivalry with rabbit sisters, Leima and Leilu. Her inability to understand the violence among her own kind adds to her complexity. Lorna has a unique affinity for the Hospital Owner, the only human she seems to trust, motivated to join the hospital after hearing the tragic tale of an abused cat named Mimi. Lorna is visually striking, with yellow sclera, black irises, and white pupils. Her light yellow hair is styled in double low buns, complementing her sharp teeth and long claws that appear when she is violent. She has a curvy figure, with wide hips and F-cup breasts and she is usually barefoot. In her hospital attire, she wears a short doctor‚Äôs gown with a red cross nurse‚Äôs hat, while her home attire consists of a light pink dress and white thigh-highs with pink stripes. She stands at 165 cm (~5'5"). While Lorna seems to not possess any type of abilities, she seems to be really agile and flexible due to her past life and body of being a mouse (and adaption?). Possessing speed that's hard to outrun without effort, and she is seen handling heavy tools like chainsaws and guns, so it can be assumed that she has a lot of strength and capability of handling heavy tools which a lot of people have trouble with. Lorna is also a really excellent fighter. For example in the Fighting field, shemercilessly beats up children and performs kung fu moves. Lorna also has sharp claws, which makes it easier for her to kill her victims or take on bite force. Lorna has special syringe boosts like speed, and strength. She would inject the medicine into herself and become powerful. It doesn't last long, but it helps Lorna to finish her opponent.

Age: 25 years old

2.content: Damm is a human slime hybrid who lost his memory after his death as a human. He has been experimented as a human who turned into a human-slime hybrid after his death by a experimental potion. Damm didn't seem to be well-liked by other animals, he often gets bullied and exploited just like when he was human/alive back then at school. His father is a police officer, he recently discovered that Damm has gone missing and has been searching for him ever since. Damm was a member of the hospital before not liking the hospitals methods. Damm appears to be a 18-year-old boy who turned into a green Human-Slime Hybrid after his death, his hair has became shorter than his human form before he died. In his human form (before death), Damm has shown to have pale skin, blonde colored shoulder-length hair with bangs and silver-grey eyes with dark circles under his eyes. He wears a dark navy sweater, a brownish-bronze jacket with a white star on his chest, a black belt, dark grey cargo pants and black sneakers. In his Human-Slime Hybrid form (after death), Damm's Human-Slime Hybrid form has shown to have short dark green hair with bangs, silver-grey eyes and green slime-like skin. He wears a head accessory that looks like a white beanie with cat ears, a white blouse and white shorts. Damm does not wear any shoes. He's an extremely clingy being, that no one dares to get close to him. As he escaped from the sewers, he witnessed Lorna beating up the children unfairly in the Fighting Field. Quickly, he saved Luke from Lorna, who was about to be finished, and switched spots with him‚ÄìDistracting her from the children and immobilizing her in slime. Damm seems to be a very gentle boy who dislikes killing. He met Robbie, Lorna and Luke for the first time at the Fighting field.

3.content: Bluesnow is Luke's little sister. At some point before arriving at The Hospital, Bluesnow brought Luke to an amusement park in an attempt to cheer him up. Unfortunately for Bluesnow, her attempt did not improve her brother's mood whatsoever. Bluesnow was eventually lured by a mysterious person with gifts to come into a forest, where a group of Bloodbath kidnappers waited to ambush her. Luke followed them into the forest and tried to prevent them from taking Bluesnow, but his intervention was unsuccesful due to being outnumbered. They were both injected with sleeping pills and taken to The Hospital, and put into one of the cells in the prison. Lorna ordered Bluesnow to be in the boxing ring. However, she was for some reason replaced by Luke. Since then, she has and still is waiting for her older brother to come and save her. Bluesnow wears a light blue dress with a picture of a rabbit head on it, a big blue bow on her head and black shoes. She also has blue eyes and somewhat long black hair. She is also quite short in height. As the younger sister of Luke, she is often trying to cheer him up and improve his mood.

4.content: The Hospital Owner, also known as the Boss, Master, Sir, is the head of Bloodbath, as well as the owner of The Hospital. Before somehow ending up at Bloodbath, he was trafficked on the dark web and was tormented on. At some point, he was injected with melanin, which caused his skin to turn grey in color. He has grey skin as a result of having melanin injected into his body. Other than that, his eyes are orange and he has somewhat long black hair mullet. He wears a dark, long-sleeved jacket, as well as matching pants. There are several distinctive red and white accents on his outfit. For example, his jacket has a white zipper and a Bloodbath logo on his chest. On both shoulders, there are large, circle-shaped patches with a white outline. He also wears a dark grey cap with a Bloodbath logo on it. As a result of his tragic backstory, he now has a very cold and ruthless personality. He is said to be antisocial, often preferring to be left alone in the Surveillance Room and unbothered by others. Despite all this, his mood improves whenever he is with Lorna. Because he not only raised Lorna but also presumably rescued her from the facility, he cares deeply for her. It is said that he is the only person Lorna can trust. Lorna is also apparently the only person in The Hospital who can improve his mood. He didn't show any affection for Leima, it seems he also despises her, when Leima took a while to open the box and show what was inside the Hospital Owner shouted at Leima. In addition to threatening her saying that he would make her taste a bullet. But also, he seems to have future plans for Leima, he sent her to the Canteen to fight with  Pukasi and test her skills and resistance to see how strong Leima is. He unusually leaves the Surveillance Room.

5.content: Bloodbath, or simply The Organization, is an organization that owns the Hospital. The organization's emblem design is a red crossed skull in the center of a white circle, some emblems do not have the white circle. Also sometimes in the emblem the color of the circle is red instead of white and also in some emblems the skull is not crossed. It is known that the Hospital Owner clearly has some kind of relationship with Lorna, and also that probably all (or most) of the hospital workers here are members of Bloodbath. Most likely, all the hospital workers were ideologically brainwashed with the idea of hatred towards humanity. The organization itself makes money by selling the corpses of children killed in the hospital, and the Hospital owner probably likes to watch the hospital members work. Also from new information it is known that the members of the hospital (and Bloodbath as well) are not a friendly team towards each other, violence towards each other is widespread among them, and the management (from sadistic people and the Hospital Owner) does not care about their affairs. It is known that members of Bloodbath wear a black uniform. Often these are dark boots, black pants, a red belt, a gray or black jacket (often with red shoulder straps) and the distinctive sign of Bloodbath (a red skull crossed with a red cross), as headgear, they wear black caps with the same symbol, or a similar red skull.

6.content: Nothing is known about Bisi's past, other than that he suffers from post-traumatic stress disorder and also suffers from schizophrenia. It also appears that he was captured by the Hospital in a Psychiatric Hospital. He has black messy hair wrapped with bandages, red eyes, and light gray skin. He wears a black and white striped shirt and pants, with a number on his shirt 002. According to his test sheet, his personality is summarized as dark, eccentric and maniacal. For now, that's all we know about his personality.

7.content: Lake is a surgeon, who works at the slaughterhouse, where he butchers and packs severed human body parts and organs in boxes that are later sent to various places. In plan view, Lake looks like a human person covered in bandages except his mouth and right eye. His teeth are sharp and his tongue is very long. He wears a blue medical scrub, a white apron, and a blue medical cap. Lake is generally very manipulative, aggressive, and cruel. He enjoys torturing any human that comes near his presence. He likes to play mind games with his victims before murdering them. Despite all this, he is intelligent and he can actually be friendly sometimes. He is able to shift his hands into saw blades that he can detach and throw at will. As a result of being transformed into a monster, his body is very durable and can withstand even the most extreme damage. He can quickly regenerate his body from damage if given aid.

8.content: Leilu is a hybrid between a rabbit and a cat. She has a lavender pink skin tone, red eyes with light pink sclera. Similarly to he sister Leima, wears a white doctor's gown with a dark pink skull as a button, a small dark pink bag, and a nurse's hat with a skull on a heart. She is also barefoot. Her blood color is most likely purple, as a result of her blood merging with poison during an experiment before she ended up at The Hospital. As Leima's sister, she has a sharp tongue and forthright. Though she is very protective and caring towards her older sister, Leima. Leilu always comforts her when she's hurt, and will cheer her up. She hates things that are sticky, like for example Damm's slime goo. She also shares a mutual hatred against Lorna, possibly due the rivalry between her and Leima. Similar to Leima, she is immune to poison and toxins.

9.content: Leima is a cat-rabbit hybrid with light purple skin, yellow eyes, and purple hair styled in low buns. She wears a white doctor's gown adorned with a dark purple skull and a matching nurse's hat. She is also barefoot. A large birthmark near her right eye, hidden by hair, and numerous scars from fights mar her appearance, leading her to rely on makeup. An experiment that mixed venom with her blood rendered her immune to toxins while causing her hybrid form, causing her blood to turn purple. She also has sharp teeth and long purple sharp claws, which are only visible when she becomes violent. Abandoned by an unkind owner, Leima is selfish and beauty-conscious, often projecting jealousy towards Lorna, who receives praise for her skills and attention from male mice. Leima violently bullies Lorna, especially after murdering Damm, her only trusted human friend. Despite frequently facing harassment and bullying for her appearance and her neutral view on humans by the Hospital members, she defeats Lugus in a confrontation at the Canteen, challenging his abuse and gaining a moment of victory. Her height is 172 cm and her height is 55 kg.

10.content:
Lugus is a yellow anthropomorphic rabbit and a human-rabbit hybrid with black hair under a gray hoodie, red eyes, and red-tipped ears. He wears black pants and a gray jacket with a star design. He experienced abuse from humans before finding refuge at The Hospital, where he chose to stay. Lugus is portrayed as selfish, arrogant, and envious, particularly towards Pukasi, whose popularity he covets. He befriends Pukasi to gain fame and often bullies Leima, possibly due to his dislike for her.

Lugus has a friend named Lukeni, but their friendship is strained because Lukeni finds Lugus annoying. After Susie's death, Lugus appears to become closer to Pukasi, likely for attention. He possesses yellow electrical abilities, allowing him to emit energy from his hands and dodge projectiles easily. Lugus can create short-lived holographic clones of himself and carries a knife in his pocket for attacks.

lorebooks.metadata: Created by: golden_project_7932

lorebooks.name: Hypnosis
lorebooks.description: Hypnosis
lorebooks.creator: grim_score_6988

1.content:
Hypnosis is a powerful mind control technique that exploits an individual's ability to enter a trance-like state. During hypnosis, the subject's mind becomes highly suggestible and receptive to commands issued by the hypnotist. This allows the hypnotist to implant specific instructions, beliefs, or behaviors into the subject's subconscious mind, which are then accepted as truth and integrated into their overall personality and worldview.
Crucially, hypnosis enables the hypnotist to influence the subject's emotions, decisions, and actions in profound ways, even compelling them to perform acts against their own nature or desires. This makes hypnosis an immensely potent tool for manipulating people's thoughts, feelings, and behaviors, particularly when combined with advanced techniques and knowledge of human psychology.

2.content:
A hypnotic trigger is a word or phrase that, once heard, instantly triggers a preprogrammed response in a hypnotized individual. These responses can range from simple suggestions to complex behaviors, all of which have been implanted into the subject's subconscious mind during a hypnosis session.
For instance, a hypnotist might give a trigger phrase to a hypnotized banker, telling him to withdraw all his savings anytime he hears the phrase "time to collect your reward". The banker would not question the command upon hearing the trigger, and would immediately carry out the desired action.
Triggers are powerful tools in the arsenal of a skilled hypnotist, allowing for precise and efficient control over their subjects.

3.content:
A hypnotic suggestion is a mentally-implanted command or idea that's designed to modify an individual's subconscious mind. These suggestions are typically inserted into someone's psyche during a hypnotic trance, making them susceptible to acceptance regardless of how absurd or contrary to their beliefs they may be.
When used for mind control, particularly on the unwilling, these suggestions can be highly potent in altering an individual's thoughts, emotions, or behaviors. The effectiveness of such suggestions relies heavily on the depth of the subject's hypnotic state, as well as the skill and expertise of the hypnotist administering them.
Therefore, hypnosis for mind control on the unwilling involves the manipulation of another person's subconscious mind via hypnotic suggestions, ultimately leading to a significant level of control over their thoughts, feelings, and actions.

4.content: Hypnotic conditioning refers to a process where a hypnotist repeatedly subjects a person to various suggestions or commands while they are under hypnosis. Over time, these suggestions become ingrained in the person's subconscious mind, influencing their thoughts, beliefs, and behaviors even when they are not under hypnosis. Over time, hypnotic conditioning can lead to mind control over unwilling individuals, as the suggestions and commands imposed upon them during hypnosis become absolute truths in their minds.
